Reviews.Title: “Would Not”
Reviews.Author: Royalist
Reviews.Content: Our little group stayed here the night of Feb. 14/12... two rooms.. had never stayed at this hotel but thought that after a Mexico to Toronto flight with a needed overnight for connection next day, it would be convenient...Well maybe it was just us..but we had a hell of a time getting to this hotel. I was under the impression it was an easy walk via a pedway..and presto you are there..not so.. there we were , 6 of us, after a long flight, pushing carts laden with luggage...in and out of elevators...then a monorail...no one told me about this....then finally into the lobby...I settled everone down into chairs and went to stand in this" holding" area where a sign says "wait here.'...I being a proper Maritimer stood where I was told waiting my turn, as people just kept walking past me to be checked in...I thought one of the two ladies at check-in would tell them I was next...but no..., so I walked up to the counter where the lady looked at me and said "Sir, you have to wait your turn" .I felt all of the blood leave my entire body and gather in my face as I said "WHAT".. ice was dripping of the word.....she then went into a robot mood and checked me in...ignoring any questions I had..as if i was not speaking. We got to our rooms...very small for the price, and mine was, of course, next to the monorail...Hell, I was so tired....down we go to an eating area off the lobby for some nourishment.....waited an hour for soup and a club.. the waiter was very cordial and said he was sorry for the wait...yeah me too..staggered back to our rooms for some sleep...in the a.m. got back to the airport for a wonderful and reasonable breakfast. it was easier going back to the terminal..just followed the crowd.. I feel this is certainly a buisness persons hotel, as we were almost the only ones with luggage..all others were rushing to and fro with just brief cases...and for sure on expense accounts...next year I will certainly leave the terminal...wait for the shuttle..and get a more comfortable stay a couple of miles down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stopover Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorwichCityFC
Reviews.Content: We always travel via Air Canada and use their Stopover Program when traveling through YYZ. Booking J class always gets us a king room for $10 bucks each way. Cannot beat that offer. The hotel is an easy and quick trip from T1 using the free train to T3. Check-in is usually pretty quick. The rooms are nice being clean and very comfortable. Cannot stand hotel pillows and this hotel is no different. Would rather use the telephone book but that's another story. The only concern I have for this hotel is the elevators. They are on the smallish side and I would suggest trying to get a room on the upper floors because if you are leaving early and you are on the lower floors, it might take a few before you can get on. We have used room service, the lounge and the dining room and have been satisfied with each. It is pricey but we have had no complaints. For those who don't want to pay the prices, it's a quick trip to T3 for some decent choices. We have always found this hotel to be relatively quiet during our stays, however stay away from the rooms next to the elevators. The constant hum of the lifts is deadly. All in all, this is now our stopover option and would pay the internet rates should the Air Canada program no longer exist.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay very convienent.”
Reviews.Author: myblueeyed
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable stay and the staff are very helpful. Very convienent right at airportn, will return.

Reviews.Title: “Will keep returning”
Reviews.Author: Aafia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely convenient for individuals passing through the Toronto airport en route to another destination. It has a very relaxed atmosphere and seems very welcoming to families. Recently, I've noticed that there have been promotions that have considerably reduced the cost to stay here. All staff members have always been welcoming and cheerful every time we have checked in and out. The rooms and bedding are comfortable although starting to get a little dated and dark.

Reviews.Title: “convenient after a late flight”
Reviews.Author: muskokaguys
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a number of times in the past, using the hotels reverse parking option-where you leave your car before your vacation and check in to the hotel afterwards for the night. This works well for us and is pretty reasonable and very convenient to the airport. Rooms are very clean, fairly spacious. The beds are great with soft linens and pillows. Bathrooms are small, but toiletries nice. Coffee maker is adequate. Get a room facing the parking lot for quiet. The monorail is very noisy at night 24 hours a day.

Reviews.Title: “Two more great stays!”
Reviews.Author: cubabound2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two different nights in March, and had great stays. Clean, comfy rooms, very family friendly, good service, helpful staff. Quick and easy check in and out, and good room service selection and quality for an airport hotel. We will continue to stay here when passing through Toronto. It's worth it for early flights, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: MortgagePro
Reviews.Content: This is ideal for a stayover on a connection.Had a fly in and leave in the AM and the same connection on the return leg.On the return the flight was late and room service was closed.Cudos to the convenience store owner in the hotel who was up until 1:00AM. Walk to your fight and connect terminal 1 via shuttle.Walk from baggage pick up to your room. Restaurant was decent.Room was spacious and clean. Check in was smooth and staff were efficient and personable. I would say they have it right.I wouldn't stay anywhere else now when flying out of TO.

Reviews.Title: “perfect way to start a trip”
Reviews.Author: noneck-11
Reviews.Content: having to be at the airport at 3 am this hotel is the perfect choice for me.l got a park and fly package so parking was on the top floor of the garage so u can just walk in the lobby door makes it easy with your bags.the front desk was very helpful and l was in my room in mins.the room was nice and the bed is amazing as always at the sheratons so comfy l chose to upgrade to club which gave u a nice lounge to sit in as well as snacks and drinks .there was more food in the am but l was long gone to the airport which is steps away never having to go out in the cold perfect for me in shorts

Reviews.Title: “Easy for layover”
Reviews.Author: Kelvin M
Reviews.Content: Hi had a 12 hour layover. Very easy to get to from Terminal one , taking tram to the hotel. Checkin in was smooth. Very quiet room. Good for layover or early morning flights but wouldn't stay if you planning a trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay while connecting in TO”
Reviews.Author: JandK786
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in November before going overseas. This was the 2nd time I've stayed at this hotel, and both times I was very happy with my choice! The hotel is very convenienty located at Terminal 3, with a short train ride to Terminal 1 (Air Canada- all destinations). Taking the train was very easy and quick, not to be compared with other airports (Frankfurt comes to mind as being a pain!). The lobby is that of an airport hotel, with flight information and check-in kiosks for Air Canada and other airlines, which is also very convenient. The room was very spacious and comfortable. For SPG members (Gold or Platinum), there's a great lounge on the top floor, with nice breakfast, view and everything else you could want from a lounge. Needless to say, there is a price to pay for convenience. If you have an early morning flight, and you want to avoid the stress of shuttle buses, etc., then I would go for the Gateway, otherwise there are plenty of other nice airport hotels close by (Hilton Airport is very nice).

Reviews.Title: “SERIOUS MOULD PROBLEM THROUGHOUT HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: maria_amd
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately there is a serious mould problem throughout the hotel. If you have children, are pregnant or have any health concerns, might want to avoid this hotel. Its too bad, because the location is so convenient for travellers and the hotel staff are exceptionally professional and service oriented. But this cannot change the fact that during my visit December 2011, they were unable to find a single guest room that did not exhibit visible signs of mould. See photo. Management was advised in writing and claim to be looking into the matter. The housekeeping staff that I spoke with during my stay indicated that this problem was not unknown to them and that that despite recent efforts to re-seal the windows, the mould problem is persisting.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: jakemister
Reviews.Content: Due to a 6:00 a.m. departure from YYZ we decided to stay at the Sheraton Gateway that is attached to Terminal 3. We were very satisfied with the room and quite surprised at how quiet it was. We did not hear any aircraft or notice any other guest noise. We ate in the restaurant and although it is pricey we felt the meal and service were worth it. Definitely first class! They were right on time with the 3:00 a.m. wake up call and the check out handled very well. Would recommend staying over rather than the 1:00 a.m. treck to the airport via other transit means.

Reviews.Title: “Park & Fly”
Reviews.Author: pixiegirl39
Reviews.Content: The sheraton Gateway at the Pearson Airport in Toronto is an extremely convenient place to stay. The hotel is well maintained. The check in service is excellent, however we stayed at club level & the service there was not what I thought it would be. The food they put out was excellent however the person working in there did not come out of the back to offer any cocktails or wine. When my Husband finally was able to ask for a glass of wine it was about 2 ounces and was $14.00. We were pleased with our room. With the hotel being at terminal 3 we just to the shuttle train to terminal 1 very convenient. I believe our wifi was also included in our room too! Overall very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Location is its Main Attraction”
Reviews.Author: travelingprof
Reviews.Content: The night of SuperBowl 2012 we stayed in this hotel because we had an early morning flight from terminal 3 at Toronto Pearson airport. We didn't want get up at 4PM to drive to the airport and we wanted to avoid any potential snow problem that could well arise in Canada in February. It's very convenient to go down an escaltor from the hotel to the departure area of terminal 3. The downside was that the room was shabby and run down but clean enough. A complete bed-side light fixture was missing from one side of the bed with only the mounting brackets showing. The bath/shower combination was a disaster - the plastic knob that controlled the temperature was loose and moved sideways when it shouldn't. It was downright dangerous and could have scalded us. An unsuccesful attempt had been made to repair the bath area as a very crude chaulking job showed. The corridors were dim probably to play down a poor state of repair. The staff wasn't helpful - we came in with four bags and the bell staff couldn't be bothered helping us presumably because they were watching the SuperBowl. The place really needs a makeover and better staff training but I guess they do so well on their location they can afford to let everything else slide.

Reviews.Title: “A CONVENIENT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: 155004Bill
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed overnight prior to an International trip. Hotel is right at the airport, very quiet and a short walk and tram ride to airport departure gates(total 10 minutes). Hotel is well maintained, has great facilities and is very quiet. Price is very competitive--the bottom line: you cannot go wrong staying at this Sheraton facility!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect start and end to a vacation”
Reviews.Author: mayan-fan55
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Gateway at Pearson Airport in Toronto is the perfect place to stay before heading out on your vacation. The hotel itself is very well maintained and clean. Rooms are up to date and offer a good list of amenities. However, the best thing is the fact that the hotel is attached directly to airport so you can walk over to the terminal via a covered walkway. If you have to go to Terminal 1, there is an indoor walkway and escalator that takes you to the shuttle train which runs every 4 minutes or so. The hotel offers a parking package so you can leave your car at the hotel. No waiting for a shuttle to a parking lot away from the airport. And, you can also leave a suitcase checked at the hotel to keep you winter clothes in when you return. This is great if you're flying to a sun destination.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton needs to do better than this.”
Reviews.Author: K-Man60
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that the room itself was fine. It was clean, the bed was for the most part comfortable and the room was spacious. For $269.00 per night it better be. This is where the good part ends. The lighting in the room was poor. I had to turn on almost every lamp in the room just to get enough light to see. I didn't bother with the ones that did not work or had no light bulbs in them. The ones that did work had such low wattage bulbs in them that they barely gave off any light. They charged me an additional $15.00 per day for WIFI. It's complimentary at the other hotels I stay at, the Hilton, the Marriott, the Holiday Inn and all of their subsidiary hotels. It comlimentary at the airport itself. Now that's cheap. I had breakfast at their restaurant the next morning. They charged me $10.00 for a bowl of watery oatmeal and an additional $8.00 for a cup of coffee. When I commented to the waiter on the watery oatmeal, he got quite indignant and told me that was how oatmeal was supposed to be made. I guess he never spent any time out on the prairies where they know how to make good oatmeal. My old Scottish grandma would turn over in her grave if she saw the slop they were passing off. Long story short, $33.00 for breakfast for 2 bowls of slop and 2 cups of coffee. The Sheraton needs to do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Early flights, no problem, walk across the sky bridge”
Reviews.Author: Bob T
Reviews.Content: First stay when my trip was extended and needed to be closer to the airport, you can't get closer unless you sleep in the terminal, across the street. Rooms are good size, clean and was surprisingly quiet given the location. Restaurant is fine, never tried room service and generally have had late dinner and breakfast. Was a great stay, I usually don't favor staying so close to the airport, but have returned to the Sheraton already once already

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for an early flight”
Reviews.Author: leenNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location- you don't have to go outside, just take the train from Terminal 1 to Terminal 3 if you arrive at Terminal 1. Check in was quick. The hotel is busy at all hours due to its location, but service was great. We had supper in the hotel restaurant, which is pricy, but to be expected where it is attached to the airport and is very convenient. There is free wifi in lobby (we had a bit of access to it as we were on 2nd floor), so it worked intermittently. The room was nice. Had a king-sized bed, desk area as well as a chair and ottoman. A personal pet peeve is when hotels have HD tvs and no HD feed, which was the case with this hotel as well. The hotel was a bit noisy, again to be expected when it is attached to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for airport but pricy”
Reviews.Author: Madeleine75
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here but we did pay the price. $160 US The bed was comfortable, it was quiet and the usual Sheraton toiletries were available. We also ate at the restaurant which was great service and great food but again expensive. Stay here if you don't want to bother working out which shuttle you need and waiting for said shuttle to take you to your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convienent but booking nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Braddock54
Reviews.Content: Made the mistake of picking up the phone and calling Sheraton Reservations for this hotel. Similiar customer service, as say, Air Canada. Ended up being booked into a Sheraton in California. Absolute nightmare, don't waste your time with them, and use Expedia, etc. The room was your average hotel room, not run down, but not the most posh room I have ever stayed, given the price. You are paying for the convenience is all. Crib provided by hotel was pretty brutal and resulted in near broken limb or two. Easier than taking the shuttle I guess. As far as 'in the airport' hotels, Vancouver's Fairmont is far nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Peace of mind location.”
Reviews.Author: brianbluebird
Reviews.Content: Great room, great beds, great linens.Hotel gave us ideal room and met all our requirements.Of course we stayed here rather than risk snow and cold in January. For peace of mind .But there wasnt any snow! Porter will escort you or you can push your trolley from baggage carousel into your room and keep it.! So, cheaper in spring to stay off Airport I guess! Slighly difficult to find the way there (especially if jet lagged) in that you need to go up one floor from arrivals and first timers could use more signs outside of the secure area in the Airport.. Too many choices of elevators not all signed. We stayed 2 seperate nights 2 weeks apart and still had to think about the route on nite 2. The word Shuttle train is similar to word Shuttle (bus) which is at different location/area. Semantics plays a part here if you ask directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great for jet-setting”
Reviews.Author: baileypenney
Reviews.Content: Returning from Virginia, my wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Gateway because of its quick availability at Terminal 3 since time was short. While I was going to be in Toronto for a few days, my wife only had a 6-hour layover. So time was of the essence and hotel shuttles were too slow. Check in was fast but unfortunately, a fire alarm would deter us from getting to our room for at least 1/2 hour. The room was quiet and comfy for a quick nap. Room service was prompt and delicious. All amenities were as expected for a Sheraton. The Link is great if you're traveling without your laptop. The fitness center was a good size with plenty of available equipment. I didn't use the indoor pool but it looked inviting. This stay was as good as the previous. Definitely a good spot if you want to be near the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient -- when the elevators are working!”
Reviews.Author: david44
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that the easy access to both the terminals makes this an excellent choice, and the room quality is good Sheraton standard even if a little dated. Main problem during my stay was that 2 of the 3 lobby elevators were out of service, with long lines at breakfast time. By the way, if you are just wanting a buffet breakfast then consider the club rooms -- the main lobby restaurant only serves an a la carte menu that is going to set you back over 30 dollars per head (especially if you want extras like coffee and juice!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect for a layover”
Reviews.Author: TLLcanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a layover to a trip in the Caribbean. It was quick and easy to access from the airport. Check in was fast. Our room was clean and comfortable. The bed and pillows were particularly comfortable. We chose to dine at the bar located in the hotel. My husband remarked that his meal of chicken wings were the best wings he had ever eaten (and he eats a lot of wings!). We were very pleased that we could not hear a single plane arrive or take off from our room. I would certainly stay here again and recommend for any Toronto layover.

Reviews.Title: “"sweet dreams"”
Reviews.Author: LandryHalifax
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at this hotel but I should also mention that we got a heck of a deal so it made it quite affordable.It was so nice to get off a plane and be in your room within 20 minutes and the fact that the following morning it took 5min from the time we left our room and checked in for our flight back home.The room was very clean and the best part of our stay was how comfortable and wonderful the bed was.It was the most comfortable bed that my husband and I ever slept in and that also included the pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience”
Reviews.Author: Blossom606
Reviews.Content: Very clean and cozy rooms. Perfect for catching a plane at Terminal 3. Parking is expensive so we chose to park at the value parking lot and take the monorail to the hotel. The hotel price is very high so we only book at room in the winter to avoid waiting for hotel buses from other hotels. Only complaint is the price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience++”
Reviews.Author: lancelongthrust
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for an overnight @ Pearson airport. Hotel is connected to Terminal 3 which has a monorail to Terminal 1. Typical Sheraton. Clean, nice rooms, etc. Room rate was a hefty $250/night for a standard room. Room service (breakfast) was mediocre and overpriced. Overall, worth it for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient.....but desperately in need of a renovation!”
Reviews.Author: IzzyEdmonton
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this airport hotel many, many times over the years. Stayed here again last night for a business meeting held at the hotel. Over the years, I have noticed the gradual deterioration in the condition of the hotel. It is now way overdue for a renovation. The hotel is conveniently located in Terminal 3 of the Pearson International Airport in Toronto. If you are forced to stay overnight at the airport for flight connections, it is a good place to stay. The hotel IS clean. The rooms are large and spacious. The bed is very comfortable and you have a large work desk for the business traveller. However, the furniture and decor is old and tired and could do with a facelift. The room I stayed in last night was not the best - Room 383. It must have been located right over their restaurant because there was a greasy smokey smell in the room and it lingered all night. The windows don't open, so you couldn't even get any fresh air to get the smell out. The light fixture on one side of the bed was ripped out of the wall and missing. The bathroom was adequate for one person but not more than that. Toiletry was minimal - no bath gel. There was poor sound proofing in the hotel - I could hear every toilet flush all night and people talking in the hallway and in the other room. Did not get a good rest at all. I would stay here again only if I'm forced to lay-over at the airport due to flights but would not choose this hotel otherwise unless they do a reno. Have to give housekeeping credit though - they still keep the rooms clean - which is the most important factor to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caribe-Harlequin46
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed at this hotel for an overnight stay before an early morning flight. This is our second visit. On both visits this hotel exceeded our expectations. The staff was efficent, friendly and professional. The rooms are modern, tasteful and comfortable. The convienance of being attached to the Airport complex is simply unbeatable. We wouldnt hesistate for a moment to re-book here and or reccomend this property to friends and family!The only complaint I really have is the lack of free Wifi. MacDonalds has free Wifi for heavens sake ! But that wouldnt stop me from staying again...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but slow check-in.”
Reviews.Author: Ephedra7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here due to early flight out of T1 next day with small children. Arrived for check-in at 8pm, was very very busy and took over 30minutes. Made the mistake of leaving bags with porter and took over an hour to get bags to room- (thank goodness I had everything for the kids in a handbag so we could get them to sleep) the porter apparently didn't label our bags when we first got there and then when he got swamped, he must have forgot to look into it. We were told we'd get some bonus SPG points as a form of apology but have yet to see that. The room was clean and quiet. It was easy to get to and from T1 via the train. Loved the convenience, and even though the price was high, I'd stay here again. Hopefully they can get more staff on in the evenings to speed check-ins.

Reviews.Title: “Tale of 2 stays - one just fine / the other not so”
Reviews.Author: luxury-lizard
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed one night - two times, a week apart. The first stay I arrived from Australia at 10:30pm - smooth check-in, standard king room on 7th floor - left early the next morning. A week later my husband and I checked in around 6pm on a pre-paid rate - well here the issues started - first of all the front desk agent could not find my booking and asked for a print-out. I did not have one (as I made the booking when I did not have access to a printer) - fortunately I had one on my laptop - he was quite unfriendly about the whole thing but finally got us checked in. We were assigned a room on the 4th floor which had a whole host of issues - there was a broken ironing board blocking the entrance to the room just inside the door, the alarm clock was on the floor, and the mini-bar was empty and turned off, there was no bottled water, and no bathroom amenities. I went back to the front deck and spoke to the same agent - his attitude was "oh really, the system indicated the room was ready". He asked if we wanted a new room but since I had already opened my suitcase etc - I said no - can we just get some bottled water and by the way why don't you give us access to the Club Lounge - which he did however we never got the water. Now onto the Club Lounge - since it was now about 6:30pm we went to the lounge to have a drink (you pay full bar prices for these) and the free canapes which were quite nice. When we ordered a drink - a beer and a glass of wine - the server / lounge attendant told us they only had 1 bottle of Stella, some Corona and some Bud and one type of wine. So we ordered the Stella and a glass of wine - well the Stella turned out to be Light (which had already been opened so we did not return it even though this is not what my husband wanted) and my glass of wine was served in a beer glass because "they had no wine glasses". These 2 drinks cost $25 + tip. The continental breakfast the following morning was quite good. Of course, we chose this hotel for the convenience of being attached directly to the terminal; however, we were flying into and out of T1 so it's not quite as convenient as when using T3. You need to take the train from T3 to T1 and walk quite a distance to the check-in area. A further gripe is why should internet access be $17 per day ?? it's free throughout the entire Toronto airport. But one tip - if you're on the 7th floor you can actually access the free WiFi provided in the Club Lounge on the 8th floor. I will be contacting Sheraton directly to find out why my online pre-paid reservation made while logged on to my SPG account went missing - very strange indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Super Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Scoobabums
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at this hotel both before and after our trip and we will most certainly come back. The shear convenience of staying on site and not having to use airport shuttles back and fourth, makes the airport experience so much less stressful. The hotel is located in Terminal 3, and we had a flight out of Terminal 1, there is a monorail train that pulls into the lobby area and connects to the parking lots and other Terminals. Just go up escalator from the front of the lobby, no kidding, it was exactly 6 minutes from our room, to the airline baggage check in desk in the other Terminal. There are airline e-ticket computer terminals located in the hotel lobby area also. We ate dinner in the lobby bar/restaurant which was again convenient and pleasant though very overpriced, but hey, no one ever goes to an airport for a cheap meal. We stayed in a standard room on the 7th floor, could not hear any outside noise, though people in the next room were banging around at 4am, but this is fairly typical of any airport hotel I have found, as people commonly leave early in the morning, focused on their departure and not considerate of others sleeping in. The room was typical Sheraton, clean, pleasantly decorated, functional, and the bed was very comfortable. The staff were extremely friendly and efficient. Agreed the hallways are more reminiscent of Motel 6, and you have to pay extra for internet and local phone calls, but these are very small negatives. This will be our Toronto Airport Hotel of choice from now on.

Reviews.Title: “My Preferred YYZ Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mykel67
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying at the Sheraton Gateway before or after a flight out of Pearson Airport. Each time we've reserved a park-n-stay package through Sheraton's website, which is a terrific value. Considering that the daily rate for parking alone in the Terminal 3 garage is $140 per week, the room itself (if you are staying on a weekend) is practically free! Check-in was super fast, and we were pleased to find our room very clean, comfortably outfitted and in excellent repair. The common areas, however (hallways, lobby, lounge, restaurant) are showing signs of excessive use and are probably due for a soft-refurb. We enjoyed some good martinis and a couple of very bland club sandwiches in the lobby bar before turning in for an early night in a very comfortable bed. Check out was a breeze, and we were able to store a small suitcase of warm clothes for our return from the tropics. It's always nice not to have to worry about off-site shuttles and open-air parking. Sheraton Gateway, we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service, 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMO73
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly impressed with the hotel and it's staff. I arrived at 3am after a long and delayed flight and couldn't have been made to feel at home more. I was given a complimentary upgrade to the Executive floor - which meant that breakfast was included from a calm and relaxing lounge. So calm that a couple of guests were still in their bathrobes and slippers! The meal choices on offer were plentiful and the amenities in the room exceeded any that I have been presented with before (I travel a lot, so have plenty to compare). Check in and check out were efficient and there are computer terminals in the lobby with direct link to major airline sites so that you can easily check in for your next flight and print your boarding card. The biggest draw for me was the location of the hotel ... in the terminal. My room was on the 7th floor facing the runway, yet this did not interrupt a good night's sleep (or maybe the comfort of the beds was enough to do it alone).

Reviews.Title: “perfect location from YYZ”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveller010
Reviews.Content: Good size rooms - got a discount rate. It is best if you don't require parking - we had someone drop us off and then it was very very easy for early morning flight. No need to worry about morning shuttle to terminal - just walked across the road.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: limeee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as we had a very early flight. We found everyone very helpful and pleasant. Check in was slow but she was very friendly. I requested a runway view while checking in and thats what we got. I did book this on priceline for a very cheap rate. Our room was clean with a great view on the 7th floor. There was a coffee maker with tea and coffee. We visited the pool and hot tub and enjoyed it as well. We did not eat dinner here but walked over to terminal 3 and had several options. The only noise we heard was from a person calling Happy New Year a few minutes after midnight and then it got quiet again. You could not hear the planes! We would not hesitate to stay here again. It was so quick and easy to get the link train to terminal one and only took a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for its location”
Reviews.Author: BJAMoo
Reviews.Content: we stayed here one night, afetr arriving late, with two young children (6&4). It is certainly easy to get too from the terminal and we pushed our luggage airport trolley all the way into the room. The room was basic but clean. The resturant food was adequate, but service appalling, with us having to ask for serveral things I would have thought any attentive waiter would have done. ie, more water, more drinks etc. If we needed to stay around toronto airport for its location i would do it again, but just eat elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: hotsand-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed once in Dec another time in Jan as connecting flights because a great location right in the airport terminal 3 and no worries of traveling in snow or taxi prices. The room given to us was a standard room compared to many hotels we have stayed in when traveling each year. The bath room had a mirror light out, and found the toilet not working properly, we found the odour at first kind of stuffy in the main room. I sat down at the desk table and pulled the chair closer and a nail on the bottom frame protruding out I scratched my finger as very sharp. I told the desk clerk as we went to the bar/eating area.Chair removed. Another chair could have been brought back to our room for our convenience but was not! Quite busy in the bar and I had to go get a waiter as thought we had been waiting too long(10min)or not seen sitting down. This area also serves the same menu as their dining room. We attended the dining room, no one at their front desk but we could see a man in a area where they place their food menu talking to another waiter. We stood at the desk for a few minutes then I walked to the man and asked if we could sit down. He said yes anywhere and kept on talking. We did sit down. The dining room atmosphere I think could be up dated and improved. Lights very high, leather seats sink down to far, wood around table was sticky as varnish coming off, and top stained as one can tell where the table mat's have been for a long while and table top look dirty but only because finish needs up dating. Food came in good time but I would suggest two waiters in the evening dinner hour as we had to wait for water service as one very busy. This was at the Dec stay near evening and dinner time . On our Jan 20012 visit, the room we stayed in was much better in quality. Ate in the dinning restaurant again and my food cold and waiter split a jog of water right behind my wife. If you order any alcohol drinks with a meal for two our bill well over $100.s surprized.! Conclusion. Excellent location. We felt food meal was just average for amount and quality. This hotel is on the high scale price for sure. Decor average and should be up dated. The front clerk (Jan) should of been aware of our Star Wood preferred guest Membership as we told her. Did not ask if we wished assistance with our luggage to our room. This hotel in my view is only a four star for service and dinning as well as decor. hotsand-7

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: cal8888
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a stopover on an international flight in early December 2011. Getting to and from the hotel is pretty painless. As it is located in the airport (a short tram ride away from the terminals) it made our 6:00am flight the next day a breeze. Check-in experience was efficient and staff was very pleasant. However, thank goodness we could handle our own luggage as bell staff was nowhere to be found. The room was excellent - well appointed and immaculate. And it was QUIET. The beds were awesome as usual for the Starwood hotels - and the shower was GREAT - lots of hot water and good pressure. We just had a basic room - no upgrade - and it was still great. Would definitely stay here again - with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, Quiet”
Reviews.Author: vgeorge19
Reviews.Content: Its great, if you have a late flight and just want to crash cause within 5 minutes of getting off the plane you are at the hotel since its right next to the terminal. For a hotel airport, its very quiet. If you want to enjoy Toronto then this is not the place cause, however, for a layover or the first night before you venture into the city its perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for airport stay”
Reviews.Author: MarcRoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night: Hotel highlights: - Location, location, location: Well worth to pay the few extra $$$ and be at the airport rather than having to wait for the shuttle outside (especially in winter) - Free computers in the lobby with free internet and printing - Friendly staff - Restaurant choices in the terminal

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: The location alone would warrant staying at this property for a layover or the night before an early morning flight. However, the quiet rooms provided an excellent night's sleep and the service and amenities were very decent. SPG Points, Gold upgrade and recognition, I would not stay anywhere else at YYZ.

Reviews.Title: “Second chances are well deserved”
Reviews.Author: artifactory
Reviews.Content: I've stayed many times here and I always leave with mixed feelings but last weeks stayed was fantastic. I still think the food is way too expensive; $56 for a Cobb salad with chicken, side of fries and yogurt seems too high for me. I mean maybe in Zurich or Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a layover”
Reviews.Author: frannick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located and easily reached via the inter-terminal train. Very nice, large room with comfortable bed. Very happy with the PC access and free internet in lobby area since we didn't have a laptop on us. We got a good deal/rate which always helps. Would definitely stay here again if between flights requiring an overnight layover..

Reviews.Title: “Let's talk convenience and value”
Reviews.Author: BeenAroundFolks
Reviews.Content: Got the room on travelzoo for $99.00. That good value greatly coloured the overnight stay in a very positive light. The room itself standard/nice. Bed good with very good linens. View overlooked airport runways. Nice, but couldn't be seen unless standing at window. Concern about airplane noise unfounded. Staff very good, actually. Fitness centre/pool -- meh, but what do you expect? Parking, excessive at almost 30 bucks, but i have never found reasonable parking at any airport. Convenience? Terrific if you have travel requiring you to stay at an airport hotel. Otherwise, why would you possibly choose this isolated place to stay? You can't walk to anything at all. Toronto is a fabulous city with all sorts of activities. Wouldn't even consider taking advantage of any of them from this hotel. Exhausted from travel and need an overnight hotel for a morning flight or have a long drive planned after arriving late at YYZ and want a fresh morning start? This hotel would fulfill your needs admirably.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: islandhoppers
Reviews.Content: I only spent a day at this hotel, but it was fantastic. I wasn't feeling well when I arrived, but the convenience store had what I needed so I didn't need to wander into the airport. Very nice rooms that are very clean, and extremely comfortable bed. I needed to rest during the day, and they had great block-out blinds. Top notch all-around.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: Famtastictravel
Reviews.Content: Our family recently stayed at the Sheraton Airport in TO for a one night stay after a trip to the DR. Despite the very late check in, the staff was friendly and helpful and quick. Our room was small, but well appointed and we had everything that we needed. The beds were very comfortable! The hotel was quiet and the noise from the airport was minimal. Again, staff at the check out were very friendly. With the direct link to the terminal and the monorail link to the parking, this was an extremely convenient place to stop in for a quick night's stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location attached to the airport”
Reviews.Author: darrennelson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night as I had a very early flight in the morning and got a great rate ($99 on spg.com). The Sheraton is in a great location, attached to terminal 3 ... all you have to do is walk across the path, or take the short shuttle to terminal 1 in the morning (Unless you are waiting for a flight, not sure why you would choose this hotel.) Check in was easy, fast and friendly. The rooms are standard Sheraton rooms; nothing fancy and a little dated but good enough. My biggest concern was going to be the sound of the air planes taking off which I did not hear. I would consider staying here again, if the price is good, when flying out early in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an airport stay”
Reviews.Author: carnelia
Reviews.Content: Hotel in the airport, short walk/train distance from terminals But strangely, can't hear the planes from the inside so had a very good night of sleep. Rooms are spacious and have a mini bar, useful for a very late check in. You can also print your boarding passes from the lobby. Can't comment on the price, used customer points and was in transfer so didn't use the parking. Easy and fast check in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nyctla123
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from hotwire.com, so initially we didn't know the name or the exact location of the hotel. We liked the fact that it was a Sheraton Hotel. However we didn't like the fact that it was LITERALLY INSIDE the airport. You park your car in the terminal parking and pay around $28.00 for parking. The main downside of this hotel was the paid parking, which I thought was a bit expensive for a suburban hotel. The hotel itself was pretty decent, nice and clean. Staff was friendly. A bit far from downtown Toronto, so if your primary destination is downtown then I would recommend finding a place closer to downtown. But overall a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: vidpersaud
Reviews.Content: Located near to the Toronto airport, the Sheraton Gateway is conveniently reached by rapid and frequent monorail from Terminal 3. The room was clean and the bed comfortable for an overnight stay. Most people would agree that this hotel is one of the the best choices for a stopover when arriving late in Toronto or for catching an early connecting flight.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: time_to_relax
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an easy-peasy stopover hotel this is your place! We parked at the lot where you can catch the link train, ($70/week), and then took the train directly to the Sheraton/Terminal 3. It doesn't get any easier than that! The hotel itself was very nice and the room was decent. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and it had all of the necessary amenities. If we paid rack rate I would probably be a little disappointed however we picked it up on a 'name your own price' site. Big bummer...no hot water in the morning. Not even warm water...it was a very chilly start to the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: Helper_One
Reviews.Content: The plus: Very convient to the airport, rooms are adequate...clean but required simple mtce., the wall plug beside the bed did not work so the light and clock did not function...the grout in the bathroom was very stained and the toiletries were too small for 2 people. The negative: Resturant offers ONLY the buffet on Monday and Tuesday mornings...my husband had the buffet and the potatoes were still partially frozen, the eggs were stone cold as was the bacon. I only had toast. The bill was $34.00!!! Will NEVER, EVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but tired”
Reviews.Author: rlf_vancity
Reviews.Content: The ONLY reason you would stay here is if you needed a convenient overnight stay in Toronto, and if you could use points / discount / etc. It is not worth the rack rate, and don't expect a four star hotel with great amenities. It is a tired hotel, badly in need of a reno. The bathrooms are antiquated (our sink was even plugged) and the furnishings are pretty bad. The food in the restaurant is viciously overpriced and lacking any imagination. Standard amenities for a high price....location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AllanPage
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sheraton Gateway because of it's location at Pearson Airport. With a very early check-in time I did not wish to be stuck somewhere in traffic, especially considering I had to come from another city. I was able to book using SPG points, so the only expense I had was internet service (I can't live without it) at $15.00 per night. The greatest difficulty I had was locating the hotel since the signage on the approach roads was a bit hard to read. Second problem was at check-in when they couldn't find my reservation by name and I had to dig out the confirmation number. I've never had this problem before ANYWHERE. The room provided was quite adequate, clean and modern. Being at the end of a hall at the furthest distance from the elevators resulted in a quieter stay. My room faced the runway yet there was absolutely no noise from the outside. Morning checkout was easy and it was a short walk from the reception desk to the shuttle trains and terminal 1.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: PrincessGolden
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times this year. It's a great hotel. You can often find some great rates online if you book in advance. You area 30 second walk from Terminal 3, and a 3 minute train ride from Terminal 1. Stay at this hotel and you will thank yourself at 4am when you're going to drop bags for early morning flights! The rooms are clean and comfortable. The beds and linens are wonderful. I sleep well at this hotel. I have only used the room service, but found there to be a good selection with quick service. Check in and out is very quick. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the convenience”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteKelowna
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before and find it very convenient for a layover in Toronto over night. It comes with a price, but if you fly out of Terminal 3 early in the day, it gets you to the gates in record time.The rooms are well equipped and the beds are very comfortable. The noise level can be annoying if your room is located beside the monorail.Rooms on the other side are quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lookingforavacation
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to a 24 hour layover from Cuba to Halifax. I asked for an upper level floor with a king size bed over looking the runway. My request was granted with a smile. Front desk staff were quick and friendly. Our room was great, no issues, very clean and comfortable. there were a few issues that keep me from giving this a five star. The first being that you have to pay $2.00 for calls even if they are local or if you are using a calling card as well as a rate/minute! The restaurant is extremely over priced. My next issue is the real problem. I threw my back out the day before and was in extreme pain. I called and explained this to guest services and asked if I could stay in the room until 3pm as it would be very unconfortable for me to wait around in the airport. he explained that the policy was that I could stay until 2pm but anything after that was a $50.00 charge. I understand they have to draw the line somewhere but it was only an extra hour and in the interest of customer service I don't think it was too much to ask. The other issue was lack of communication with staff. The maid started knocking on the door at 8:30am and did this 2 more times until my husband had to tell her we weren't leaving until 2pm. At least she knocked. the guy who refills the water just swiped his card at 11:50 am and walked right in without knocking. Thankfully my husband was in the room as I was still undressed in bed!! This will not stop me from booking here again if I get a good deal but it may be something they could work on. I have never had to use the "do not disturb" card at any hotel for fear that they will walk right in but I will if I return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Albertusguntur
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern rooms, fantastic outlook. I had an early morning flight out of Toronto and could not have been happier with the hotel. It is connected to the airport, so within minutes of leaving my room you are at the check in desk for your flight.

Reviews.Title: “Lifesaver with a Comfy Bed!”
Reviews.Author: cubabound2008
Reviews.Content: We had to travel back East rather suddenly, due to a death in the family. We booked this hotel literally in an airport on the way, and we were graciously greeted, and upgraded. The hotel itself is probably on the dated side, but the bed was comfortable, the toiletries were nice, and the room service food (though on the expensive side) was very good, and available late at night. The location....well, it's attached to the airport, so for us, it was perfect. I'd absolutely stay there again---without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: halifaxns
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night to attend meetings happening at the hotel. Flying into Terminal 1, it was a quick walk to a short train ride to Terminal 3 to get to the hotel. Easy and fast check-in. Room: Excellent bed. The view I had was of the train going back and forth to T1, so I left the curtains closed so train riders wouldn't be looking in on me (ask for a room above the 3rd floor and you'll be above the train). For an airport hotel, it was very quiet. Amenities: No wi-fi in the room is really inexcusable for an airport hotel. The on-site restaurant/bar was pretty good (a bit expensive, but that's every hotel bar). The ease of getting to the hotel from the airport would make this my choice anytime I need something close to Pearson.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for short stopover or weekend”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: So convenient being right inside the airport. Just walk up and then straight to your room. Rooms are really well equipped, comfortable, very quiet and the beds are so comfortable! Food is good at the restaurants (or room service) as well but if you can get around Toronto has some really good restaurants. Pool and fitness center are also very good. I have stayed at this hotel many times and will go back.

Reviews.Title: “pleased to be sure”
Reviews.Author: kimmilil
Reviews.Content: I was anticipating a noisy and unrestful stay . I have to say I was very pleased with the ambience and excellent service at this establishment . The staff was lovely ,the rooms well appointed and tastefully decorated. The restaurant was pricey but that is to be expected. The jacuzzi was wonderful and hot and the jets relaxed my stress away . AHH :) I will be returning to thanestablishment for sure in the future

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Efficient but lacks smiles, and hold the salt!”
Reviews.Author: JustMeSingapore
Reviews.Content: I flew in from New York for one night in preparation for a long 15 hour flight back to Hong Kong, then Singapore. It was easy to find the hotel (a brisk 7-10 mins walk and skytrain) from Terminal 1 where I first landed, although some small confusion from the signs from the skytrain to the hotel (which is located in Terminal 3). Check-in was ultra efficient - but I found the front desk devoid of smiles, even a clinical cold feeling. I wish I felt more welcome. Rooms were okay, but you need to pull the day and night curtains fully to insulate the noise from the traffic and equipment from my room on the 7th floor. After that, it was very quiet. As there was nowhere else to get food, I ate at the hotel lobby's Grill restaurant. I had the soup of the day, and a salad as entree to "detox" before the 20 plus hours flight back. While the soup was delicious, unfortunately, the chef had a very heavy hand in salt and seasoning. Same for my greek salad. On top of the very salty greek cheese, there was salty olives. Thankfully, the walnut bread was delicious, but I could feel my temple throbbing and my heart pounding from the sodium-high. Even in New York, the salt wasn't that big a problem for me. Ack! Generally, a fantastic choice (okay, its the only choice connected to terminal 3, but its a good choice) for an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: TorontoSunvacationer
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the accessible room with my wheel-chair bound father for one night before catching morning flight out. Check in was fine, no problem. The room itself was clean, comfortable and really no complaints. It was roomy enough to move the wheelchair around and the bathroom had a roll-in shower and bars along the wall for safety and security. The hotel is on the LINK (rail line) between the terminals so it was super easy and quick to get to the airport. The only complaint I have is the price of beer in the bar/lounge downstairs - $12 for a bottle! But what can you do in a hotel? Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - right in the airport”
Reviews.Author: PeterDCanada
Reviews.Content: Was able to get a $132 night Maritime Travel rate (Thursday - Sunday). Great room with a great airport view. Bed was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the convenience!”
Reviews.Author: sfw67
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed overnight at the Sheraton Hotel Terminal 3 in order to catch an early morning flight, as I have done on several occasions. You really can't beat the convenience! In addition, the service at check in and the bar was very friendly, the room was clean, and the bed very comfortable. While overall a pleasant stay and (in my opinion) good value if you are utilizing the airport, I wouldn't stay for more than a couple of days. Accommodation within the city is much better suited for an extended stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Always Consistent”
Reviews.Author: dj_canada
Reviews.Content: Face it, the reason to stay is proximity to airport. I've stayed there a few times and am always amazed at how quiet it is despite being so close to the very busy runways at Pearson. Room service menu is a bit limited but food is good. Front desk staff are friendly and helpful. Never have had a bad stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not connected to Terminal 1 or 2”
Reviews.Author: aloo707
Reviews.Content: This place is not connected to terminal 1 or 2. You have to take a monorail to get to this hotel. The advantage is that you can bring you luggage trolley right into your hotel room. The place is very pricey if booked thru various websites. I was lucky I was able to book it thru Hotwire.com Got an amazing deal. The room and the washroom is neat and clean - just basic, no fancy frills that you would expect for the price you are paying. The only thing that I did not like was the room lighting including the corridors was not bright.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value! Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: Irene D
Reviews.Content: We had a 10:40 p.m. flight and chose to stay at this hotel due to its convenient proximity to Terminal 3. The Front desk staff was professional, very friendly and provided us with a 4:00 p.m. checkout at no extra cost because we had to wait a few minutes to checkin. We found the room to be clean and comfortable. The restaurant was a wonderful place for us to meet some family members for a farewell dinner and when the staff learned it was the day of our 34th anniversary, they covered the cost of dinner for my husband and I. We will most definitely stay at the Sheraton Gateway Hotel whenever we fly. I would recommend people call an agent as well as checking the online rate as I have found that the agents can often give a better deal. What is great about the Sheraton is we were able to use our points from previous Sheraton stay to cover the cost of the room. How good is that!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable customer service & comfortable quiet stay”
Reviews.Author: YYZAviator
Reviews.Content: I've had the pleasure of staying at this hotel over 15-20 times, and most recent, the past 3 weekends in a row, and felt the need to share this. This hotel has always been a favourite place to stay. The staff are fantastic, attentive, and very welcoming. The decor is somewhat dated, but they are making efforts as of late to improve the hotel. They recently completed a renovation of the gym and are currently working on the Club Lounge. My stay typically is on the 8th floor, (the Club Floor), and has always been delightful. The beds are comfortable, and the rooms are always clean. Any special requests I've made have always been fulfilled, and taken care of with speed. Cora & Claudette (I may have her name wrong) have been absolutely fantastic to deal with at the Front Desk - my request for a Airfield View has always been accomodated. Being this close to the airfield, you'd expect a lot more noise, however the hotel is very quiet, and the triple-pane windows do prevent a lot of noise from entering the room. The only downsides to this hotel are the following: 1) Parking Cost - NOT a direct cost that goes to the hotel, as the Airport Authority controls the parking. However, it really is annoying to have to pay for parking. 2) The restaurant is very pricy -- this is to be expected in an airport hotel, however. 3) ANY hotel that charges for internet today is crazy. This should be as much a staple as a coffee machine or shower products. Other than that, my stay has ALWAYS been fantastic, and I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly good for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gamelanlover
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early October 2011. I had a 6AM international flight out of Pearson and needed something very close to the airport. This was perfect- our room was excellent and the check-in staff were professional and courteous. We also got a last minute price break on the room. I'd recommend this to others and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Toronto Airport - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: akuczynski
Reviews.Content: I had a long day of traveling and I'm always hesitant to stay at an airport hotel, but the Toronto Sheraton at the airport has changed my views. I had an excellent stay from the front desk checking me in, to the room service and the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: traumaknight
Reviews.Content: My wife, two year old and daughter were on our back to the US and booked a night at the hotel. Paid about $150 Canadian on expedia for the room. Tried to get an upgrade to a suite at the desk, was told there were no suites at the hotel period. Although on their website, they say there are. Curious. The room itself was ok, nothing spectacular. The best thing was that it overlooked the runway, which kept my daughter entertained for an hour. It was also surprisingly quiet. The food was ridiculously expensive (like all hotels.). Continental breakfast in the morning was $18.50 as I recall. We went to the airport terminal for our meals. Additionally there was a large fee for Internet access in the rooms, we went across to the terminal to use the free wifi there. If McDonalds can give u wifi for the price of a Big Mac, why can't a hotel????? Drives me nuts. By far the best thing about the hotel was the location, could not be beat. Otherwise, very average in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “A quick and simple stay.”
Reviews.Author: LangleyVagabond
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel each time I have an extended lay over or early morning departure out of Toronto. The hotel is convenient as it is attached to the airport, and you do not have to take a shuttle. The food in the restaurant is very pricey though, and depending on what you order, it is not necessarily house made.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is slipping”
Reviews.Author: happysanman
Reviews.Content: Have stayed several times...noticing rooms are not as clean and bright as they once were, towels were not a bright white nor were they luxurious. Parking is insame $30 your not downtown toronto, expect to pay $20 for inroom movie rental...will avoid next trip to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: mbsef2000
Reviews.Content: I enjoy this location anytime I have a early flight out of Pearson. The staff is very friendly, the rooms at club level at wonderful and the club lounge may be one of the nicest in the area. I would highly recommend this location to anyone laying over or seeking a quick airport hotel as it is directly connected by monorail system to the main terminal. My only note would be to ensure you are not in a room next to children as the walls are a bit thin. I once awoke to the sound of overly excited youngsters ready to catch their flight to Disney. Can't win them all I suppose. :)

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, pleasant and very convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Bill S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sheraton Gateway while flying out of Toronto on our way back to Lima, Peru. The hotel was pricey, but we saved a lot of money flying out of Toronto--rather than the other nearby airports in the U.S. We chose the hotel because it is connected to the airport terminal that we were flying out of. Other nearby hotels were much cheaper, but we had 22 pieces of luggage and did not want to hire multiple taxis to get them to the airport. We made the right decision. The customer service at the hotel was excellent! The bell-hops helped store our luggage for the night, then brought it from the hotel to the terminal the next morning. One bell-hop stayed with us while our luggage was checked and scanned. Also, the maintenance man sacrificed his duck tape to keep my luggage secure. The room was excellent. We enjoyed the indoor pool, also.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient as a transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tienne2001
Reviews.Content: Stay one night in this hotel during 1 night transit in Toronto. The location is very convenient, it's still in the airport. The room is clean and roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Just make sure your room is not on the 3rd floor.”
Reviews.Author: heysnoopy
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and comfortable but the floor I was on happened to be where they have conference rooms. It was rather noisy at night and I was woken up by carts wheeling outside. I think the night crew were preparing meeting rooms for the next day. Location was extremely convenient to airport. There's a walkway connecting to the monorail which took me directly to the terminal where I need to be.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel with large clean rooms. The only donfall to this place was it was a bit pricey.We arrived too late for our connection flight so the airline put us up at this hotel for the night, which was nice after a long day of traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny when travelling with a child”
Reviews.Author: MCGKingston
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Sheraton Gateway on 3 occasions, most recently in February 2011 before a trip South. We live 3 hours away from Toronto, and it's cheaper for us to drive to Toronto, stay in the Sheraton Gateway, and park for the week than it is to get connecting flights for the 3 of us. It also relieves a lot of stress about weather, as we can travel the day before and the day after at our own pace. We have never had a bad experience. The staff have always been great during the check-in process. Being able to check bags (of winter gear) was a huge relief, as we were a bit worried about leaving things in our trunkless car. The rooms are not huge, but big enough. We've had them provide a crib when our son was younger and that always fit easily enough. We have used room service, and it's the most reliable room service we've experienced - the food is fresh, hot, and good. The restaurant was quite kid-friendly, and it's nice that you can just take your child out to move around in the lobby while you're waiting for food, especially after a 3-4 hour drive. We have not used the pool. I cannot stress enough how easy it is to get up in the morning, get ready, and walk over to the airport without going outside in -20 degree weather. It's very quiet, considering it's at the airport. In the universe of a 3 year old boy, having a room that overlooks the train is quite exciting! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff. Bonus for young children”
Reviews.Author: kballtex
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here coming home from a visit in Ontario. The location is great for catching a morning flight as you're right next to the terminals. the staff here are wonderful - despite being on points for this stay we got excellent service from the bell staff as well as the front desk. The bonus for those with small children is the crib is actually a crib not a pack n play. Though you have to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “you can't beat the convenience to the airport”
Reviews.Author: ladolcevitabequia
Reviews.Content: this trip we stayed at the Sheraton Gateway, booked through Hotwire, so we didn't know we were booking the Sheraton until it was a done deal...got a great rate...the room was very nice and the bed was divine...the only thing was that the bathroom was a little tight...if you were on the toilet the door opened into your knees...the room was very quiet, the bedding perfect...we had a wonderful nights sleep and didn't have to get up as early as we would if we had to take a shuttle to the airport...you can't beat the convenience, just go downstairs, through a door and you're at the shuttle stop...two minutes later you are in the terminal...perfect...we would definitely recommend it for the night before you fly...can't comment on the amenities as we didn't use any, as we had friends coming to take us out to dinner and our time was short...the front desk clerk was very helpful and while we were checking email in the lobby a hotel ambassador came by and asked if had any questions, and she was very helpful...

Reviews.Title: “Super Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christine F
Reviews.Content: Travelling alone I find the Sheraton Gateway perfect. It has perfect access from the Toronto Airport, without having to leave the airport. Check in is easy, the room is clean and has everything to make the stay more enjoyable. The in-hotel restaurants are very good and the hotel offers health and relaxation. The staff are all very helpful and courteous. I have no hesitation in recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location and location!”
Reviews.Author: Boisdulac
Reviews.Content: Indeed, location is the clear strong point of this hotel: conveniently situated inside Terminal 3 of the aiport, you can reach the hotel lobby after landing without exiting the airport building and comfortably rolling your bag all along. As commented by other reviewers, services can definitely be improved: the front desk staff could have been more smiling and more helpful when arranging for car rentals and visits to downtown Toronto (you would say they were making you a favor by checking you in! ;-). The upgraded room we booked (club level) was well worthy of a 4-star hotel, with lots of space, although the look of it feels a little bit classic, especially the toilets. Unfortunately, the club itself was under repair and therefore not accessible to clients (no mention of it during the booking). The breakfast buffet was nice - warning: only continental breakfast was available at the time of our visit, but quite a big choice of items. One last positive comment: the management team reacted very quickly to our negative feedback and they sent a nice apology note; we hope some or all of the above items have improved by the time we visit again! In summary, an inexpensive 4-star hotel ideally located for a short stop in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, decent value, super convenient”
Reviews.Author: njabbott
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here three times because of the convenience. On my recent trip it took 18 minutes and 12 seconds from the opening of the aircraft doors until I entered my room (yes I was lucky with Immigration and I did not check any bags). The rooms are clean, comfortable and well appointed. In terms of price it was similar to places such as the Hilton which can require a 15 minute wait for a bus. As long as the rates are reasonable I will never stay anywhere else at Pearson having previously stayed at the Hilton, Holiday Inn, Sandman and Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great room!”
Reviews.Author: 2plus2-9
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night as we were flying out early the next morning and it makes it so much easier when we stay close to the airport. This was our fifth time staying in the hotel but our first time being given a room with 2 double beds plus a double sofa bed. This was great option as we had two kids with us. To be honest even the front desk clerk didn't believe there would be a sofa bed in the room with the two other beds but when we unlocked the room it was very long and there was lots of empty space over by the window. The only issue which wasn't a negative for us was that you couldn't do anything with this space as there was no light over at that end of the room except for the window. When the sun went down forget trying to use that space. But all we did was store the 3 suitcases and two carry-ons. All 3 beds were comfortable. The room was clean. We had dinner in the lobby and headed to bed. I was a bit worried that being the first room on that corridor would be noisy but we didn't hear a thing. The hotel is in a great location and is a very good option for families flying out of Toronto's airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ,Nice rooms , great service”
Reviews.Author: Ohad B
Reviews.Content: I got stuck in Toronto during Hurricane Irene and needed a room for the night close to the airport. I used some of my staraward points and paid only $45 + 2800 point so the price was good. The hotel is great if you donâ€™t want to get out of the airport. They upgraded me to a Club room since I have the Sheraton Gold and the room was great. Overall the best part of a hard trip was the good night sleep in this hotel. The club is not open 24*7 to take drinks like some Sheraton clubs are. (and should be)

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel near Pearson International Airport (YYZ)”
Reviews.Author: mandyy403
Reviews.Content: I travel to Toronto a lot for work and all of my work is done at Pearson International Airport. The Sheraton Gateway is the most convienient place if you are doing the same or are looking for a place to stay if you have to stay overnight for a connecting flight. Now, it's most convienient for those travelling in and out of Terminal 3 as it's literally right across the departures level road in front of the airport. The hotel is a bit pricey, but worth it. No need to worry about shuttles, taxi's or even the train (if you're flying out of Terminial 3). If you're flying out of a different terminal, all it takes is a quick (free) ride on the sky rail and you're there The hotel rooms are always very clean and the beds are some of the most comfortable i've slept in. The decor is modern and you can tell the hotel takes pride in its appearance The Mahogany Grill in the lobby is a great place to grab a drink or some food, but again, its quite pricey I will always stay this hotel when i'm on business or pleasure, it's fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: PJONG
Reviews.Content: Great location! This hotel is ideal for us catching a 1:30am flight in the wee hour with 7 checked in luggages for a family of four. Even our car rental return with Hertz is directly downstairs and no long walk is required. The lay out of this hotel is excellent. Walking distance to terminal 3 on an enclosed bridge.Â  Although the hotel is about 20 years (we were told), it is very well maintained. The hotel staffs serviced us well and the bell boy even help us with the trolleys to the terminal. On one of the days that we stayed, we return with our room not clean but the cleaner quickly came and clean it for us and the hotel manager even come by to check if we are well taken care of. It was impressive for us as we felt we were looked after quickly on any inconveniences. My complain Â is the poor breakfast buffet selections which is very limited. And also the hotel charges substantially for every single devices that want to connect to the internet. Considering in our family of 4 and each of us want our own access on our devices, it's a setback for us.Â  Saying that, I'm sure they would improve on it and I definitely enjoy my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best way to park and fly out of YYZ”
Reviews.Author: Peter A
Reviews.Content: The park and fly package can't be beat. For a price not much higher than the cost of parking at Pearson's Terminal 3 alone we had a great room and were able to relax the night before our early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good place if you miss your flight”
Reviews.Author: berne18
Reviews.Content: I was put up here in August by AirCanada overnight beause my incoming flight from Tel Aviv got in late and there were no more flights to Chicago. Check-in was believe-it-or-not smooth and WELCOMING, especially after traveling so many hours and facing an early flight the next morning. Claudette at reception was sympathetic, friendly and efficient. Reminding her I had a 7:30 am flight and had to check baggage, she suggested a wakeup call at 5:00 and told em that if I do not answer the phone, they would come knock on my door to make sure that I wouldn't miss my flight! I did not avail myself of the proffered dinners and breakfasts, but did enjoy the Starbucks coffee in the room.I was able to wheel my luggage cart with its heavy bags right into my room, which was very helpful. Signs from the airport terminals are a bit tricky. Claudette is an exemplary employee.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jilltimestwo
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here as we had an early flight the day of our departure. We were in Toronto for 2 nights only and this was a very convienient hotel to stay in. The room was quiet and very clean with great housekeeping. The only suggestion I have and I have passed this onto the hotel is that black tea bags are needed in the room. The only tea supplied was an orange infusion and Earl Grey. The response from the hotel was very prompt and hopefully will be actioned.

Reviews.Title: “No Food after 11 pm”
Reviews.Author: Ryans72
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, but I arrived from Vancouver at 11.45 pm, having not had dinner. Given the time difference, I was looking forward to relaxing with a light meal before turning in. I was aghast that there was no room service menu past 11 pm, and there was nothing open in the Airport. No supper for me that night - it never occurred to me that there wouldn't be food when I got there. But the bed was very comfortable, and it was surprisingly quiet, which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good night's sleep - both times.”
Reviews.Author: Canucksters
Reviews.Content: Hard to believe there is a bustling airport outside. Good sleeps on both my Saturday arrival (at midnight) and my return the following Saturday for a crack-of-dawn departure the next morning. Easy to nip down to airport to do early check-in at airline kiosk. Had one breakfast onsite at the Sheraton, mediocre and expensive. On return, I simply got take-out from the airport. Both stays uneventful, just what I needed. Would stay again on fast turn-around trips.Cannot beat the reassurance of knowing you won't miss your plane because you are already on the airport's doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - but watch the nickel-and-dimeing”
Reviews.Author: Traveller99ab
Reviews.Content: Excellent room and staff, and so convenient. But some shock when bill arrived under the door with $20 of charges for six 1-800 calls. I called the desk; a quiet manager reversed the charges quickly. I pointed out that there was no written notice about this charge on or near the phone or in the thin room-information brochure; he agreed, saying "it is Sheraton policy" to charge even for local calls. Some policy; even roach motels do not have such charges! Also, I later noticed the small print on the room fridge price list: items are immediately charged when something is removed from the fridge. I had moved a can from the fridge to the desktop to make space to keep some food cool. I wondered what that metal arm was doing attached to the inside of the fridge door! Again, the charge was removed by the manager. Very nice room, but whatch out for these unnecessary, trivial and somewhat insulting charging procedures!.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stop-over”
Reviews.Author: bergerman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel as a stop-over on our way to Cuba in late July/11. We have stayed here in the past(2 yrs ago) and let me assure you that it has not changed much in the time frame from 1 trip to another. Its very convienent to the airport. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. Amennities in the room are very good. If you are worried about airport or parking lot noise, don't be cause their isn't any. The lounge is quite nice although we found it a bit pricey as is the restuarant. Having said that I guess you have to realize you are in Toronto. Gift shop is well stocked with a good variety of snacks. The staff at the front reception were first class in our case. No issues whatsoever with check-in or check-out. I love the express check-out. Very convienent. The internet area was a nice touch. We checked in and printed our boarding passes right there in the lobby. Very convienent. Would we stay here again. Absolutly.

Reviews.Title: “raw burger in the restaurant. Bored, unhelpful reception staff.”
Reviews.Author: Fiona-Calgary
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and will not stay here again. The receptionist was unhelpful and showed very little interest in checking me in. No explanation was given or offered about the access to the Sheraton Club (I am currently at Platinum level) and no help was offered with my luggage. This was rather shocking as my right wrist was, and still is, in a plaster cast! The room was clean and I have no complaints about it whatsover. The biggest issue was the restaurant in the bar. I waited 40 minutes for a burger with fries. As I had just flown in from the Uk and had a 7 hour jet-lag, my patience may have been less than normal, but lets just say I was less than pleased when the burger was raw and still frozen. I then had to wait 20 minutes for another to be prepared. I made a complaint, in writing, on checking out of the hotel. I handed it, personally, to the receptionist on duty. One week later, I am still waiting for a reply.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, loved the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller30
