Reviews.Content: This was my second time in a month staying at the Sheraton Gateway Hotel and, unlike the last time I was there, I really enjoyed myself. Room I stayed in a room on the 7th floor, a King bed, with a view of Terminal 3. Good size room and it was spotless. One thing that I will flag for you is that the bar fridge was not full -- there were a few drinks in there and all the food, etc, had been eaten and not re-stocked. Club Lounge I had breakfast this morning up in the Club Lounge -- what a great spread. Scrambled eggs w/ salsa and cheese, muffins & pastries, toast, a great selection of fruit (grapefruit, oranges, strawberries, pineapple, cantaloupe, honeydew melon, grapes), coffee and juices. Very well done and the server who was there this morning (a younger gentleman with glasses) was exceptionally friendly with a "Good Morning!" to every guest. Front Desk Seemless front desk check-in handled by Doreen -- she was great to deal with, made me feel welcome and allowed me to check in really early (11am-ish). Mahogany Lounge Karen at the bar was very helpful -- she brought me a delicious bowl of fresh berries, as well as my chicken panini. Both of which were excellent. Overall I had a wonderful one-night stay at the Sheraton Gateway -- it's convenient, clean, good service and very comfortable rooms. I look forward to my return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will recommend to my Company Employees and friends”
Reviews.Author: Charlee M
Reviews.Content: Service and food excellent (although food was expensive). Staff very nice and professional. The hotel is right at the airport, so very convenient to make an early flight. I dropped off my rental car the evening before, which is also located within walking distance of the hotel. Make sure you reserve a room with two double beds for your entire stay if you need them. It was my mistake, and we were moved one night to a room with one bed for my family, However, the staff was quick to add a roll away for me, so it worked out.

Reviews.Title: “My only overnight hotel I will stay at”
Reviews.Author: hummer022
Reviews.Content: Great place for overnighting in between flights, fast convenient no travel time.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect night's sleep straight from the airport”
Reviews.Author: Lucaswestyorkshire
Reviews.Content: I flew in from England and spent my first night here with my partner. He had booked the international suite, which was spacious and very comfortable - a really well-appointed suite with every facility you could wish for. What pleased and suprised me most of all was how quiet it was. Even though we could see the planes taking off and landing, there wasn't a single sound - not even from the monorail which ran directly under our window. We had room service for supper and breakfast the next morning. Menu choices were very good and the service excellent. Valet parking was speedy and efficient and every member of staff we encoutered was friendly ande very helpful. I can recommend the Sheraton to anyone arriving/departing from Terminal 3. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown and Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Angele01
Reviews.Content: After staying in several hotel rooms in Europe over the last three weeks, we came back to Canada and stayed at this airport hotel for one night. It was the most expensive of all our hotels this summer and by far the most run-down. There was duct-tape in the elevator to hold a panel, the buttons for the elevator were worn and poorly fitted. The rooms were clean but not special in any way. The wi-fi was only accessible from the lounge on the main floor. The front desk staff were polite and friendly. Check in and check out were efficiently handled. Sound was not a problem this time although I have stayed here and had to leave my room for a fire alarm late at night. No apologies offered and no compensation. Front desk staff told us that time that it was an elevator malfunction that caused the alarm and that we could go back to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient!”
Reviews.Author: momof6kidsinMN
Reviews.Content: I had a one evening layover in Toronto and stayed at the Gateway Sheraton. It was conveniently located for travelers since you don't even have to leave the airport. The dining was closing when I arrived so I ordered room service - it was MUCH better than I expected (although at a premium price)! The front desk staff was very helpful in answering my questions, making sure that my stay as satisfactory, and overall very pleasant. Same for the staff in the bar section. I would definitely stay here again on a layover or perhaps use as a starting point to just visit around the downtown Toronto area since it seemed to be very convenient for that as well.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms a bit rough around the edges but very convenient”
Reviews.Author: fogetmylogin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not as new or fresh as some other hotels in the area and is substantially more expensive (especially if you need parking). It is very convenient if you are departing or arriving at terminal 3. Travelling with a lot of luggage and a baby we were happy to pay for the convenience. The rooms need a bit of work. They are a bit worn and are starting to smell a bit musty. Nothing horrible though and is really the only complaint. The usual over priced internet and breakfast, although you can also go into the terminal and pay airport prices instead.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly friendly staff, beautiful hotel, just dont touch the phone!”
Reviews.Author: ReBelleDesigner
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute business trip that i had to take solo which was why i was extremely pleased with the warmth that i was met with upon arrival. I was greeted by an amazing employee which i had spoke with previously on the phone.... she was amazing both on the phone and in person and made me feel immediately at ease. The feeling continued throughout my stay. I am from the states and frequent Toronto (never alone) and the level of comfort given to me by the staff stayed with me for the entirety of my trip. I was initially just going to stay one night( although i had booked 2 nights) and forfeit the money for the second night, but the ease and solace that I felt in this hotel had me spend the extra night. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and noise-free. If you dont look out of the window, you dont even realize that you are like literally right in the airport. I did dine in the restaurant downstairs and the service was once again impeccable. Very comfortable for the solo traveler. The central location is definitely a draw. I had no difficulty whatsoever traveling to any of my meetings (or excursions :) The free internet in the lobby was a great touch. I really did feel at home in this hotel. Now for the cons( which really I had none until leaving the hotel) I checked out sunday morning at around 5:45. There was no staff at the desk. I had to go behind the desks and peek into the back office to get someone. Now allow me to backtrack , because im from the states and the roaming costs are insane, I was initially going to try and purchase a prepaid phone. I decided to just purchase a calling card from the gift shop and use the hotel phone. I figured that local calls should be either free or of minimal cost. I did hear something about them being 2.00 after that and figured that the local calls would be 2 dollars per call. fine. I chose the local number to call on from the phone and sat and made my calls. Well... to my surprise, upon checking out i had racked up over 100 dollars worth of a phone bill! In 2 days! For this I may as well have just roamed on my US phone or purchased a local phone. One last thing.... was the parking. I checked in on a Friday in the afternoon.... I left the hotel friday night and when i was leaving my ticket didnt work so the parking attendant called up to the hotel to make sure that my ticket was in fact validated. The attendant didnt give me back my ticket( because it wasnt working) when i came back in I had to take another ticket. To make a long story short I ended up having to pay for an additional day of parking that I didnt use because of the ticket malfunction. This left a sour taste in the end of my otherwise flawless stay at the Sheraton. As of right now Im still uncertain as to whether or not I would stay again .

Reviews.Title: “Was a regular guest, but always treated rudely.”
Reviews.Author: artsysimone
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel pretty regularly through my company for the past 5 years. It was always a relief to not have to wait for a hotel bus after a long flight or a red-eye (an overnight flight). I have stayed at this hotel frequently between 2006-2011. The only thing I ever liked about this hotel was the proximity to the airport, the bed, the orange-scented shampoos and the Starbuck's coffee. The front desk staff has all the warmth and friendliness of rattlesnakes. Staff was usually extremely rude, indifferent and somewhat nasty at the front desk, and often ignored me when I arrived (even when they weren't serving other guests, they'd stand there, perfectly aware of my presence, taking their time at their computer). There were several occasions where my sleep was disrupted by housekeeping staff yelling back and forth to each other in the hall (sometimes I had flown through the night and couldn't sleep on the plane), and false fire alarms that went off when I was sleeping in preparation for a long work day I had the following day. Calls to the switchboard were always an agony, as it usually took them forever to answer (I used to work for a Sheraton hotel on the east coast and another Starwood hotel when I was younger, and they drilled it into our heads that no guest should have to wait for more than 4 rings when calling the switchboard - at this location, I called the hotel switchboard and hung up after 18 rings). When I would finally get ahold of the switchboard, the operator was usually rude and almost confrontational if there was a problem (and I was always polite and apologetic, because I used to work in the hotel industry and know what it's like, so I take painstaking care not to be a pain in the butt to staff). More often than not, they put off checking us in, so I consistently had to call down to the switchboard, wait 10+ rings for them to answer, and then ask to be checked in so my phone would be activated. I was assigned a room with a broken toilet after an exceptionally long work day, and I called down and asked for a room change (I was exhausted). They said they were full and would send up maintenance, and it took maintenance almost 30 minutes to come to my room, and in the end, as I sat on the bed waiting for another 30 minutes, he couldn't fix it - so I got my room change over an hour after I had asked for one. I don't appreciate being lied to (being told it's full when other rooms are available), especially when I'm exhausted and all I want to do is sleep without the sound of a toilet freaking out in the bathroom next to me. Restaurant staff was usually nicer than the front desk staff, especially the morning staff, and I have always had a good experience with them. The evening wait staff seemed less friendly and rather abrupt, and getting food service from the afternoon bar staff was always slow an frustrating. And by the way - a glass of beer here costs about $8-$12. Why? Because they can. It's absolutely ridiculous. I believe I have had one experience with bed bugs there - on the fourth floor. I didn't see the bugs, but my ankles were covered with about 6 or 7 red bites when I woke up the following morning. I'm not 100% certain this was a bed bug experience, though I've been bitten by them in other hotels before and the red bumps around my ankles looked identical. In the 5 years I stayed at this hotel, I have only had the one alleged bed bug experience in the summer of 2009, and when I told the manager about this, she didn't seem surprised and waived my in-room internet fee of $15 (another ridiculous money-grab). I've had no subsequent occurrences of bites after that one time, and it is my hope that, if those bites were bed bugs, they dealt with it quickly. I think of everyone I've ever talked to in this hotel (besides the morning wait staff at the restaurant), she's the only nice person I've ever encountered. I forget her name, but she worked in the evening I believe. I don't recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't have to stay here. I'd recommend it if you're leaving on an early flight out of Pearson International Airport, as you won't have to deal with hotel airport bus schedules and the like. The proximity to the airport is a definite convenience, the beds are very comfortable, and surprisingly, runway noise isn't too bad considering how close it is to the airport - they did a good job with soundproofing, I'll give them that. However, if you're looking for value for your dollar and top notch service, you won't get it here (food is expensive, alcohol is ridiculously expensive - just go to the Swiss Chalet in the airport, at least it's fast). If you're expecting a warm welcome and a smile, you will be disappointed. Staff seems to have a chip on its shoulder, and were bitter and sometimes downright hostile during many of my frequent stays. I always went out of my way to be nice to them when I checked in, and it was a rare occurrence indeed when I would get a return smile. I've since quit my corporate job to start my own business, and I don't miss having to stay at this hotel at all. If you just want to sleep and get on a flight, then the beds are wonderful and the soundproofing from airport noise is well done (as long as a fire alarm doesn't go off or housekeeping staff isn't shrieking at each other in the hallways). Otherwise, don't waste your money. Their rates aren't cheap, and for what you pay a night for a room, the LEAST you should get is a smile from staff.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight, on a trip home from Ottawa. We wanted a quick dinner with friends in Toronto and then had to catch an early flight in the morning. I was delighted that the front desk permitted us to check in when we arrived at 1100. The linens were probably the loveliest I have experienced in a hotel, and the room was spotless. My only disappointment was that, as far as I could tell, we had to go to the lobby to access the free wifi We had stayed at a less luxurious property in Ottawa and the wifi was free, and available in the rooms. As we sleeping the morning we checked out, I was frightened to hear the room door open (I was staying with my daughter). I called out, and there was no answer, so I ran to the door and a fellow traveller apologized. Apparently the front desk had assigned her our room. I called the desk immediately to advise them of the error, and also to prevent this from happening again. Without my requesting it, the manager credited our account for the inconvenience. Mistakes happen, and I was more than pleased with how the management handled this situaiton.

Reviews.Title: “an oasis in the middle of a busy airport”
Reviews.Author: Auxiliary7010
Reviews.Content: Our room overlooked the skytrain stop but the sound proofing ensured no noise intrusion, unfortunatley our room was next to the lift so we could hear the weights going up and down, however they did not spoil our sleep too much. An excellent dinner was made special by Mustafa our waiter, an amusing knowledgable and wise man from Mostar in Bosnia. All the staff were friendly and efficient and made us feel welcome. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wendymary
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton once very nice, clean ,i dont think i would stay again the reason being the parking fees are ridiculous priced i think the hotel should give a discount for there quests, would consider staying before and after with the car when we go away but only if the parking fees change....

Reviews.Title: “Really Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: Talee48
Reviews.Content: really wonderful hotel the rooms are beautiful and well taken care of great staff very friendly and so helpful two thumbs up to Rosario and Mostafa

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: doobeebaby
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in transit. Booked a room on the club floor. I was not expecting much so the stay turned out to be much better than expected. The club lounge served good breakfast, had free WIFI and plenty of drinks throughout the day. The rooms were also very quiet for a busy hotel and the front desk staff were friendly. Room service was efficient. The hotel feels a bit dated but one cannot expect too much from an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs upgrading, but very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Ruperto
Reviews.Content: Stay here on overnights at Toronto Pearson on a regular basis, when connections require it. Its very convenient and a lot better than off airport hotels nearby that even though they are close still take a lot more time without any benefits in comfort, although some are cheaper with the same amenities. I like the pool and gym, and the bar and cafe are fine but lack signature items. The rooms need substantial upgrading. They are fine for a one night stay but have too many wear and tear scars to warrant the prices charged. The Fairmont at Vancouver Airport might be the standard that should be aimed at. Reception is fine, but can take time to get thru. I dont believe I've ever stayed here when the elevator and escalator system is in full working order...another sign of poor Sheraton investment in a property they should consider a flagship marketing opportunity !

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nealyyz
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to express my sincere thanks for the wonderful stay at the Sheraton this past Saturday. The staff was courteous, friendly, professional and accommodating. Just one example of our experience was that we had specifically requested a room overlooking the airport as my children were accompanying me on this trip and they were extremely exited about being able to watch the airplanes. Without hesitation, the staff was able to accommodate our request and we all had a super experience. Anytime that we asked one of your staff for anything we were treated with the utmost respect and class. Thank you to all for making our stay that much more special.

Reviews.Title: “High Quality and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Steph2727
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night in May. Arrived from London Heathrow at around 9:00 pm. Had to change terminals to get to the hotel via the train. Fortunately we were on WestJet the next day so did not have to change terminals again. Room was spacious and very nice. My sister flew up from Boston and met us at the hotel. She was hungry so we went to the bar area around 11:00 pm which was still very busy. I was almost half asleep so I don't remember the food but service was good. The next day we took a taxi to downton and visited friends for a few hours before our return to the airport, hotel check out and our return to Florida. Would definitely stay here again for a short turn around. Price was higher but you are getting covenience and quality which is worth it to me.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent property for business and family travel”
Reviews.Author: unclepants
Reviews.Content: I stay in 50-60 properties per year and the Sheraton Gateway is one of my favourites. It's not just the best airport property I've visited, it's one of the best-run hotels on my travels. The staff are always well-trained, quick to recover if a problem arises, and always seem concerned to make my visit a good one, despite the huge number of guests that must go through here every day. Platinum guests, despite the large number of us that turn up here every night, are treated well. The Club floor and Club lounge are very nice and and well-maintained, with the breakfast in particular worthwhile. Service sets the property apart and my experiences have always been positive. Joumana and her team have always found ways to accommodate my special requests, be it a very early check-in, connecting rooms for the family on an award stay, or taking extra care of my mother when she was staying at the hotel without me. If I have any quibble with the hotel, it is that I'm often asked at check-in if I've stayed at the property before, sometimes when I've been there just a week or so before. This is a very minor quibble, though, and doesn't change my opinion of a great property. Recommended highly.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the price!..staff very helpful,kind and interested in meeting your needs.”
Reviews.Author: susammy
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was so convenient.Located in the airport,an open floor plan of the lobby,restaurant,lounge, convenience store,convention room and elevator access to your hotel room eliminates confusion and saves time.The hotel has a calm,safe atmosphere.Hotel room very clean,no odor,well stocked with towels and supplies,and fair amount of space for you and your travel equipment.Rooms are practically sound proof...neighbors or jets unnoticed.If you like the ease of being near the airport,this hotel is the best with the amenities and at a good price.Staff very friendly and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - disapponting room”
Reviews.Author: Holoboss
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of convenience of getting there right from airport. That really IS great. But the rather unfriendly person at reception did not charm us from the beginning. however, the room was much worse than that - a bit dingy and stuffy, with carpet and even walls in need of cleaning. The very poor lighting helped to hide these shortcommings, but in bathroom the old, tacky looking tub did not drain properly, resulting standfing in dirty water while taking shower. There was no robes to use after shower, and while there was a tiny coffee maker, there was no tea to brew in the room. Perhaps these problems would be ok in some cheaper hotels, but this one tries to look like a more posh option - which clearly - it is not. We just returned from a trip to so cvalled "third world" country - and had better accomodation, and much nicer service than that. not to say- free internet - while this hotel asks for $16.95 fee to use internet, even if you want to check a single email. In all - if it was in a different location it would NOT be worthy even 1/2 of its cost. We often stayed in toronto in some cheaper hotels near airport, offering free shuttle. and they all were better than this one. So, if you can spend extra 20 minutes to take shuttle - save money and have nicer service somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a layover beats other nearby airport hotels hands down”
Reviews.Author: jorees
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for it's convenience to the airport while waiting for a delayed flight. Through booking.com the hotel's price was only $109 plus taxes and the same price as the Travelodge or Comfort Inn. The staff were very kind and helpful and advised booking online to get a better rate. After my booking was delayed due to a computer glitch I was upgraded and given complimentary access to the Club Lounge with free snacks, internet, and breakfast. The food was very healthy and fantastic. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel In The Airport Area Of Toronto! AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: cin1
Reviews.Content: Ok.....I'll Keep This Short! The Hotel Is Located In Terminal 3 Of Pearson International Airport. The Sheraton has a Sky-walk that leads you into the Airport so you don't need to go outside! The Staff are EXCELLENT! The Lobby, Restaurant, Bar, Pool, EVERYTHING About this hotel is AMAZING!! The Rooms Are Huge in my opinion, and the BED'S!! OH MY!!!! BEST BED'S EVER!!!!!! Excellent Shower, Love The Shower Head With The Pressure! Great To Use After A Day Of Travelling!! Folks! I Can't Stress Enough!! Spend The few Extra Dollars And Stay Here On Your Travels! You Will NOT be Disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “No Better Place At Pearson Airport Toronto”
Reviews.Author: KarenGr
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times. Sometimes we leave our luggage while we travel elsewhere, sometimes we have our pets, sometimes we do park 'n fly, last time we arrived at 1:00 am with 2 cats and 250 lbs. of "stuff". Regardless of the time of day or night, to walk enclosed the short distance from Terminal 3, or the easy monorail from Terminal 1, no place is as convenient as the Gateway. Slipping under the soft sheets in the perfectly furnished room at any time of the day or night is pure satisfaction. Stay on the Club Floor for easy access to nibbles or any of the other equally accessible floors and you won't be disappointed. The newly renovated lobby is refreshing. Despite several visits we've never had the time to indulge in the other available services, ie workout room, spa, swimming pool. We do however eat in the bar or dining room which is always pleasurable. The staff is extremely helpful and accommodating. At times we've needed to use a freezer. Never a problem. When we travel with lots of stuff due to our disappearance for 6 months there is always an eager assistant to assist us getting the luggage to the terminal, an easy walk. There is no better place at Pearson.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, but...”
Reviews.Author: Itchy002
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Gateway is attached by an elevated walkway to Terminal 3 at the Toronto airport. It is very convenient for travellers who are transferring to another flight the next day as there is a shuttle train which stops right outside the hotel. You can go from Arrivals at Terminal 3, to the hotel, hen to the shuttle train and to Terminal 1 without going outside. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The room was comfortable and surprisingly quiet. All amenities were provided including fridge, coffee maker and hair dryer. There is a business centre with free internet and free wi-fi (for 60 minutes). The only downside was the atrocious prices in the coffee shop and restaurant. Fortunately there is a Swiss Chalet right across the walkway in Terminal 3 which, surprisingly, charges the same prices as the other Swiss Chalet restaurants (no airport 'markup'.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient, With a High Price Tag”
Reviews.Author: JeremyMcNeil
Reviews.Content: Did this hotel on a stopover in Toronto. If you are simply using the hotel as a means to an end (i.e. Late flight with early morning connection) then it certainly meets those needs well. It is right off Terminal 3 with very easy access to the other terminals. The rooms were clean and beds comfortable. They were only double beds and with 2 adults and 2 kids this was a bit tight. No hotels should have doubles anymore - queens and up only. Shower was good with excellent water pressure. However, the price was way too high for the value. At over $300 for the night I definitely paid for the convenience with no extra service, luxury, or quality of hotel. I paid about the same in New York for much more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a layover”
Reviews.Author: Bubbavon
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a layover. I got the room fro $85 taxes incl from Priceline which is a vcery good deal. Super handy that it is right in the airport. After a long flight it is really nice not to have to get to an airport hotel by shuttle etc. Just walk on in. Staff was friendly. Room was completely quiet considering you are at the airport. Room was nice with a King size bed. We found the room had a bit of a chemical smell but it was not so bad we did not get used to it. Only issue is everything is extra - like internet. Went to the gift shop and bought a litre of water, two 600ml coke and a 600ml orange juice and it came to $15 OUCH! other than than no complaints and if you can snag it on priceline you are seriously laughing. Would not hesitate to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Best Stopover Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjnl
Reviews.Content: Easily accessible being located in Terminal 3. I have stayed here many times and even though the rate is a little higher than 3 star hotels nearby...the convienience more than makes up for it. The beds are "to die for". Only complaint would be the cost of room service is quite high

Reviews.Title: “Airport Overnight Stopover”
Reviews.Author: PJP567
Reviews.Content: Clean, close and easily accessible. I booked a night for free through Aeroplan. Probably wouldn't pay the full rate to stay here though. Convenient yet overpriced based upon what I have seen.

Reviews.Title: “A truly great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tanya M
Reviews.Content: Although we are in and out of Toronto a number of times a year, this is the first time we have stayed right at the Airport. The Sheraton was so easy to check in and out, then just walk across the road for our flights....no traffic, no shuttles....just a great location. The room was perfect and the staff were great. We have already recommended this location to several friends. With our CAA discount, the price considering it was Toronto and the airport location was very good. Overall, our stay was a pleasure! Tanya & David Macdonald, Salt Spring Island, B.C., Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great room, splendid view of airport activity, and very convenient for flights”
Reviews.Author: ABear
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night between flights. The room was great â€“ clean, spacious and well-equipped (although I donâ€™t think it had a safe). Best of all was a fantastic view of the airport and aeroplanes, and it was fascinating watching all the activity! Soundproofing was excellent - Despite the proximity to the aircraft (and the little trains running between the terminals just below the window) there was very little noise. Reception were welcoming and efficient, with no queue on either check-in or check-out. However, we were disappointed with the bar â€“ The menu didn't seem to have much in the way of sandwiches/salads, and I ended up having a small and rather overpriced bowl of fries. (Service was slow, despite very few people there at the time; and the bar area seemed dominated by the television.) The main restaurant menu looked rather more elaborate than we wanted, and we didnâ€™t want to return to the bar, so we ended up going over to the airport to get an evening meal. Proximity to the airport is, of course, the great feature of this hotel. Our flights were at terminal one, but it was a very easy trip on the train between terminals.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an early morning flight - but thats it”
Reviews.Author: Saphire81
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 5 times now due to early morning flights and my reaction is always the same..... well, it will do. Prices are ridiculous, and ever changing. I paid $400 for a standard room one stay and then only $210 a week later for the same room category. Prices get higher during busy travel times, but I guess thats to be expected. Rooms are in no way as clean as I expect them to be. Yes they have fresh linens, no bedbugs and a clean toilet, but thats about it. Dust covers most table tops, carpets are dirty, and mirrors have fingerprints from the last 2 guests all over them. At first glance the room looks tidy, but once you settle in you will notice these things. Check in/out ALWAYS has a line up with MANY people in it. My last stay I was 5th in a line of over 15 people. It took 45 min to check in... and I was 5th in line. I feel sorry for everyone behind me. You would think that being at an airport that runs 24 hours a day they would be adequately staffed around the clock. Nope, usually only 2 people running the desk at nights. I only continue to stay at this hotel due to early morning flights - I can hop out of bed and be at my terminal in 10 min. If that is what you need, stay here. If you are leaving later in the day I would recommend looking elsewhere. Most hotels near the airport offer free shuttle service to/from the hotel and cost half the price to park your car there while you are away.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More....”
Reviews.Author: bluenibor
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel. I was surprised to find a big red stain on the carpet in our room upon opening the door. I must admit it had the most comfortable bed and we had a good sleep after a tiring day. We enjoyed a terrific supper in our room from the room service. I was surprised in this day of free wifi I was charged $9.95 for one hour of internet. I expected this Sheraton to be more luxurious so I was slightly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and value”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Cain
Reviews.Content: Booked three days in advance, paid on booking over the web, got a great rate on the club floor - less than $200, King bed, mini-bar, free internet and breakfast. Arrived at Pearson Terminal 1 home from vacation at 10:00pm, loaded the bags onto a trolley, and wheeled it all the way into the hotel room via the Skytrain and a few elevators. How convenient is that? OK, it is 10 minutes from Terminal 1, but you'd wait that long in the taxi line-up most days. Reception was quiet and efficient, room was comfortable and clean, club lounge breakfast was sufficient. Our flight out was at noon, but from there we could have made it any time. We loaded the trolley, wheeled it to the check in desk. No fuss, no muss, easy as pie. Great location, great stay - what more is there to say?

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much here for the location only”
Reviews.Author: LongWayAcross
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel can't be beat for it's proximity to both T1 and T3. Sure you have to take a train from T1, but it beats schlepping your bags up and down stairs onto shuttle buses to the adjacent hotels. Room service food is $$ and disappointing. Thinking you can't really screw up a hamburger, well it was cooked from frozen and was dry and not very good. Caesar salad was wilty and tasted like it was prepared earlier in the day and kept in the fridge. One other note, as a SPG Gold member, had asked for a late checkout of 1pm. With the DND sign on the door, had a call from the housekeeper across the hall at 1230 asking me when I was checking out. Not very professional!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what they provide”
Reviews.Author: Chuckus1
Reviews.Content: I used 7000 Starwood points instead of lowest AAA rate of CAD 244/night. I had asked for a room on the airport side at time of booking, but was blocked into a room on the other side. The agent at check in was able to change this. As a Diamond, I was upgraded to the club floor. I arrived after it closed in the evening. No wireless in the rooms. Only wired internet is available and for that they forgot to deduct it from the bill. I had to call down to ask that it be done as this is a published Platinum benefit. A Cobb with chicken was ordered through room service, but they forgot the chicken breast. The waiter was courteous and returned promptly, but for only the salad (no drink) I would have thought for CAD 32 including tax, service and delivery fee they would have checked it for accuracy. The club breakfast is barely adequate. They did have hard boiled eggs and french toast but otherwise it is basic continental without any smoked salmon, meats/cheeses or oatmeal. The attendant was overly chatty and that probably contributed to the orange juice and milk pictures being empty. The cereal dispensers also couldn't handle to granola and it kept clogging up. I was also surprised they wanted you to fill out a form on the table and a first for me was a line for a tip for the club attendant. I don't object to tipping, but I was surprised this was out on the table. I went ahead and gave the attendant $2 and she seemed pleased. I then went downstairs to check out. Only was agent was working and the line got to be a bit long. The manager did notice this and quickly brought out 2 other agents, but I'm not sure why they were in the back in the first place. The agent quickly and courteously processed my check out but had to go to the back to get a print out. I'm a little confused why the front desk doesn't have a printer at each station. Also, if you arrive T1, you have to take the train over to T3 where the hotel is located. This is a bit of a pain and next time I will probably just go for a less expensive hotel and deal with the short shuttle ride. Today the train was single track so I just missed it going from T3 to T1. It then came back and stopped at T3 before going off to something called Viscount and then back to T3 to return to T1. Overall waiting time 7 minutes exactly. This is too long for a internal airport tram. Maybe the GTAA is trying to save money on power during non-peak hours or maybe the other side was being repaired. When I arrived at the hotel around 8pm the night before, both sides were in order. In summary, skip it unless you get a good rate or have a generous expense account.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good night sleep.”
Reviews.Author: ND38
Reviews.Content: Overall the room was clean and serviceable. However the room had a terrible musty smell, as though it hadn't been used in a long time. My husband and I were there with our 3 kids so they must have decided to give us one of the worst rooms- our window looked directly into the airport train and waiting area for the train. We literally had people about 15 feet from our window. I'm not sure if they could see in or not- but if I didn't have 3 boys that liked trains I would have asked to move rooms. We were also woken at 2:00 am by the people next door having sex. So lovely when my 10 year old is woken by a banging headboard and moaning and groaning. I had to distract him by playing a game with him on my phone. Overall, not a good stay unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to layover”
Reviews.Author: YOWCanada
Reviews.Content: My family and I regularly layover at this hotel when we have early flights from Pearson Airport. Our stays have always been excellent. Rooms are spacious and very comfortable. I also regularly stay at this property for business and am never disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: biggles_71
Reviews.Content: I spend 10-15 nights a month in hotels across the country and this is by far my favourite. The Sheraton Gateway offers spacious rooms with the most comfortable beds ever!! It has a great fitness centre with gym/sauna/hot tub and pool. The food is consistantly superb albeit a little pricey. Most of all I appreciate the staff, for professional, courteous service with a smile, ask for Maria. She is always so helpful and goes out of her to make you feel at home!!

Reviews.Title: “Inspired Service”
Reviews.Author: WillandDavid
Reviews.Content: I didn't have any particular expectations for our stay in this hotel -- we chose it mostly for it's location inside the airport as we were flying in from New York and spending a night in Toronto on the way to Hong Kong. We wanted the convenience of being right at the airport so we could have a leisurely time before departing. But I must say that our stay was made the moment we checked in. I think the name of the woman who checked us in was Cora. She was friendly and efficient and really made us feel at home, taking time to find the best room for us in our category. My partner and Cora started chatting -- he had some questions about ground transport. Cora gave us excellent instructions on getting into the city using the bus and subway -- and saved us at least $70 Canadian by doing so. She really made us feel at home in the hotel. We had a very pleasant stay. Breakfast was good. And we found the service to be excellent overall. Just small touches -- like the housekeepers saying a cheery hello when you pass them in the hallway. I wrote to the GM, Joumana Ghandour to tell him about our experience. And we immediately heard back. So it seems the attention to customer service comes right from the top.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: bmichael
Reviews.Content: March 9th 2011 Mr. Joumana Ghandour, General Manager Sheraton Gateway Hotel in Toronto International Airport Terminal 3, Toronto AMF, P. O. Box 3000 Toronto ON L5P 1C4 Dear Mr. Ghandour: I am writing to you to compliment one of your front desk agents, a lady named Flavia. I was in the hotel restaurant yesterday morning when prior to an important meeting a button fell off my jacket. I went to the front desk to ask for help, not knowing what they could, or would do. Flavia advised that there was no repair or sewing service, but then said she would reattach the button herself. She took my jacket attached the button and returned it to me in the restaurant in a few minutes. What an excellent example of how to treat clients. I am a demanding client with high expectations, which, Flavia more than met. She was efficient, helpful, and friendly. True professionalism is rare, so I feel it is incumbent on me to acknowledge Flavia for the excellent service she provided. Flavia represents the Sheraton Gateway Hotel very well. Please recognize Flavia in some meaningful way, make this note part of her permanent file, and provide her with a copy. Sincerely yours, Downtown Acura M.R. Brugel President

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...please improve check-in”
Reviews.Author: markofzorro
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed overnight at the Sheraton the night before an early morning flight. The location is superb, as it is connected directly to YYZ terminal 3 and we took advantage of the 7 day parking package (a great rate included in your stay). The rooms are spacious and clean and like all Sheraton hotels the beds are wonderful to sleep in. The only negative experience I had at this hotel was at the check-in counter. We were checking in on a Sunday evening and I anticipated the hotel being busy however, the hotel lacks any real organization for queueing making this process unduly long. We stood for 25 minutes behind one counter waiting behind another guest and we were largely ignored by the other counter staff who welcomed those who arrived long after we and the other guests in our line. Although a bit annoying this shouldn't detract from the hotel as it is superb. But please introduce an organised check-in process!

Reviews.Title: “Great for overnight stay between flights”
Reviews.Author: randaDeltaBC
Reviews.Content: As always this is an efficiently run and managed hotel. We stayed overnight and between flights. Great room and very comfortable bed. Easy check in and check out. Comfortable lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Buddies
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in the best location you can ask for if you are plannig to stay around the airport. No need to go outside to get to your flight. We had an early flight from Thunder Bay on a snowy morning so it was so nice to just walk next door without having to go outside. It was so nice of the hotel staff to check us in a 8:30am in the morning and not have us sitting or walking around until check in time at 3pm. We can not thank them enough for doing that. We must say the rooms are clean, big and very comfortable even with alot of luggage in the room with you. The bed is amazingly comfortable. You can even watch the planes come-in to land from your room window. The next morning was very easy to check out, took 5 mins. as we were in a hurry to beat all the people in line that were heading to St.lucia and going through the gates with west jet. Josh and Samantha

Reviews.Title: “don't think i'll be back...”
Reviews.Author: traciemoir
Reviews.Content: I've worked in the hotel business before, at a true 4 star hotel, and this one is definately NOT a 4 star hotel. The service was lacking greatly, especially when I went to buy food at the restaurant. It wasn't busy at all, but I had to wait at least 10 minutes to even get service. The bartender was too busy talking about her upcoming trip to the US, and how she just got back from Miami, to every other person sitting at the bar. When she finally decided to come over and take my order, she was very cold and rude about it. Did I ask too many questions? I'm not sure. As for the rooms, I was very disappointed. On the website where I made reservations, everything looked so neat and clean! The bed was great, but the furniture was very dated, and the bathroom was not what I expected. Just as I got in, I heard a knock on the door, the maid then barged in, and said when she cleaned the room, she didn't check the fridge...when I worked as a maid, we always had a supervisor to come and check the rooms once cleaned...then phoned down to the front desk to tell them the room is ready. The carpet was not vacuumed either. And 15$ for internet? A bit outrageous isn't it? Being connected to the airport was a big thing for me though. I live 2200 km away from here, so no vehicle. And I most likely won't be back down this way for quite a while, but I won't stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great bed”
Reviews.Author: EconomyLifestyle
Reviews.Content: Recently overnighted at the hotel, staff really helpful and welcoming, especially David @ Front Desk. Hotel is in an excellent location, great lobby area, bed was amazing. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The man that saved my LIFE”
Reviews.Author: ajaynes
Reviews.Content: No Mervyn Fernando didn't actually save my life, but he did go above and beyond his job requirements to give me and my fiancÃ© exceptional service. In American colloquialism Mervyn is technically a life saver. We were returning home to Atlanta from an overseas trip in Africa when a snow storm shutdown most of the airports on the East Coast. After three days of delayed and canceled flights we landed ourselves at the Sheraton Hotel in Toronto. Keep in mind that we hadn't showered or brushed our teeth in almost three days. As dirty as our clothes were the clothes in our bag were even worse from our Africa trip. We contacted housekeeping and 10 minutes later Mervyn knocked on our door. We explain our situation and even thought the hotel does NOT provide laundry service, Mervyn helped us out. He returned with two hotel robes. We changed into the robs and gave our foul smelling clothes to Mervyn. He washed them in the Hotel's washer and dryer and returned them to us folded. They smelled so good that I must have sniffed those clothes for a good 15 minutes. Thank you Mervyn and thank you Sheraton Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location for travel”
Reviews.Author: PeachesTheHobo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for the second time at the end of January, while travelling through Toronto and on to warmer climates. Its worth it to get a good night's sleep although the rooms are pricey. My main comment is that we had both great service and horrible service from the staff. I booked through booking.com, clearly indicating 4 people needing to stay in a room with 2 beds, and I also mentioned that need in a comment to the hotel. When we checked in the surly young female clerk did not greet us with a smile, a friendly attitude, or even professional courtesy. She looked right at our family of 4 and said "we have you in a king size bed." When I told her we had requested 2 doubles, and pulled out the comfirmation email I had printed, she said they had no record of that request, but she could check to see what was available. There did happen to be a double room available, but she was still completely graceless. I was very surprised at her attitude, I wasn't being loud or unpleasant to her and there was no reason to treat me like that, especially at a hotel of this calibre. On the other hand, the bartender at the lounge was very attentive and friendly. We went in with our newly 19 year old daughter to have a drink before going to bed, and when he ID'd her and discovered it was her birthday, he delivered her drink on the house.

Reviews.Title: “great access to the airport terminal 3”
Reviews.Author: beamylevi
Reviews.Content: we have made it a habit of staying at this hotel before our flight and comes in really handy to use, as you don't have to get up as early and no stress. You can leave your room in your shorts all set for your trip to warm weather in the winter and even put your luggage on a cart provided at the hotel. We will continue to use this hotel as parking is included if you buy the package, to which I suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay. Can't beat the location... especially for terminal 3.”
Reviews.Author: kaleidoscocious
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Sheraton Gateway after arriving on a late flight. Booked the room as a Starwood point redemption. There were a fair number of people checking in at 1am, but I only had to wait a few minutes, and things went smoothly. Room was small, but clean, comfortable, and quiet. I had a great sleep. I was coming from terminal one (Air Canada domestic), and it was a bit of a hike (and tram ride) to get there. It's more closely connected with terminal three. Had breakfast in the restaurant. Service was so-so, food was acceptable, but disproportionately pricey, typical of Sheraton restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lucinda03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Gateway Hotel in Terminal 3 twice in January on our way to and from St. Martin. We live in Halifax so we overnighted in Toronto on our way. On previous occasions we have stayed at various hotels but nothing compared to the excellence of the Sheraton Hotel. It was so easy to get to the hotel from the arrival lounge via the sky train. The reception staff were extremely helpful. The room was large and well appointed. The lobby restaurant have exceptional staff serving you and the food was varied and well cooked. Check out was easy the following morning. I must mention the most comfortable beds we have ever come across in a hotel. The only negative was the shower was difficult to control but other than that the whole experience was beyond our expectation. We will always stay at the Sheraton on our way through Toronto. Thank you Sheraton for making our stay so welcome! We have already recommended this hotel to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Superb service with each request we made.”
Reviews.Author: 80ToesInTheSand
Reviews.Content: 8 of us stayed at the Sheraton Gateway the night before an early morning flight and Saira Malik and the Sheraton Gateway went out of their way to ensure that our short stay was comfortable and relaxing. Saira gave us all lovely rooms on the club floor, explained what the lounge had to offer, gave me extra points when one of the room phones did not work and then stored our winter gear for a week. And it was a 3 minute walk to the terminal in the morning. It made our vacation feel as if it started a day before we left.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Steveℜen
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this property back in September and experienced a problem with our room. The hotel management contacted me directly and apoligized for their shortcomings. To earn my business back, the manager was kind enough to offer a free upgrade to a club room on our next visit. We took advantage of this offer before a trip to Exuma staying on January 22nd. We were upgraded to a business suite upon arrival. The room was amazing. Nice big comfortable bed and a great view of the airport. We had a 9am flight on the 23rd and wanted to take advantage of the Club Lounge prior to checking out. We arrived bright and early at 6am and the lounge was not open. A lone employee finally arrived at 6:05am and began to set up. He was very slow and completely ignored us. He proceeded to set up the coffee and juices first so we tried to check-in electronically from the Club Lounge. Unfortunately, neither printer was working so we couldn't print off our boarding passes. We ended up having to leave at 6:25am. None of the food had been placed out yet. As a result, we had to purchase a breakfast in the terminal after checking in. Overall, this property is good and I will stay here again. Rooms are very comfortable and you can't beat the location. However, I would not recommend upgrading to the Club Floor. There is definately room for improvement in the area.

Reviews.Title: “SAIRA MALIK AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Tammer_11
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing time at the hotel, special thanks to Saira Malik for helping my friends and I and also to the amazing customer services she had provided us during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel .. Wonderful service .. Oh so COMFORTABLE beds!”
Reviews.Author: Neelysgramma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton in mid-January upon return from vacation. Our flight arrived just before 2:00 am and we headed straight for the hotel. Check-in was very quick. We were granted a late checkout (12 noon) of which we were extremely thankful due to the late hour. The room was immaculate .. the bed SO comfortable. A great experience and we'll definitely stay at the Sheraton Gateway again! The only negative comment I have is regarding menu pricing at the on-site restaurant. Very pricey so we decided to eat elsewhere. And Flavia (who was working in the Club Lounge) added to our enjoyment by going above and beyond in her service to the guests! Thank you Flavia! Hope to see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Location”
Reviews.Author: fyzhix
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Gateway Sheraton quite a few times and its because of the convenience of the location that I keep coming back. The rooms are overpriced because of the location but I find them quite reasonable with my government employee rate. The wi-fi is free in the hotel lobby but quite expensive in the room (I believe $20 CAD for 24hrs). I haven't eaten in the restaurant or used room service as I walk to Terminal 3 to grab something to eat if necessary. The staff are friendly but the quality of service varies from individual to individual. The people working in the gift shop provide fantastic service. The beds are extremely comfortable and what I come to expect when staying at a Sheraton. If you're a light sleeper, request a room a bit out of the way or not near the ice machines as quite a bit of traffic makes its way through the hallways. One thing to make note of if you're wanting to pay by interac/debit, the last two times I stayed at the hotel their machine was "broken". I find that a bit difficult to believe as their ABM and credit card machines worked and generally they are on the same lines.

Reviews.Title: “NOT DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: muscletongue3000
Reviews.Content: stayed at hotel overnight, rather than take limo halfway through the night for early flight. very pleasant staff. lobby rather large with tons of people off delayed flight sent over from terminal. very accessible to terminal I via monorail, although located at terminal III. used starwood points -- very easy on starwood website. WILL use it AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Tamer747
Reviews.Content: Being on the road all the time for business is hectic as it is, but the staff at the Sheraton Gateway Hotel Toronto Airport makes it easy to face the challenges that my trips take me to. If you are going to be in the GTA - I strongly recommend you stay at the Sheraton Gateway Hotel Toronto Airport. The service I recieved from Cora, Flavia and Saira is second to none. From the moment I walk into this property I feel among freinds who care about my comfort. No wonder I am a "regular"! Cheers, Tamer

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality !”
Reviews.Author: Kyle_McColl
Reviews.Content: Saira Malik and her associates were a great help to me. Saira helped check me in early in the day and also helped recover some lost items from a colleague of mine. Her associate, whose name has escaped me, was helpful in getting a very important fax brought to a board room meeting that was held at the hotel. This hotel offered some of the best customer service that I have ever had at a Toronto hotel. I will be recommending the Gateway Sheraton to all of my colleagues for future use.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent front reception service”
Reviews.Author: jamie_marilyn
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent; especially Saira at the main desk - she was very helpful

Reviews.Title: “staff are always pleasant when im in town staying at this hotel..Saira was especially helpful”
Reviews.Author: kajah4
Reviews.Content: rooms comfortable and large.BED AWESOME.This hotel is a must for travellers. so convenient to all terminals

Reviews.Title: “Best Airport Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: XJASPX
Reviews.Content: I would like to mention that Flavia at the front desk is extremely friendly and approachable and ensure that my stay was as comfortable as it can be. The room is nicely layout and roomy for an airport hotel. The hotel steam room is one of the few at a hotel that actually works. The hotel restaurant have really good food and enjoy the Shrimp Pasta for dinner and Burger for lunch during most of my stay here. The Maple glazed chicken is also really good. This is a great airport hotel, however, they only offer free wifi in the lobby and in the club lounge. With that being the only negative, I would give this airport hotel a pass!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, caring staff, saved our Christmas cruise from disaster.”
Reviews.Author: sandy154981
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the Sheraton Gateway by airport van from Belleville, Ontario, on December 21st, 2010. My husband is diabetic, and shortly after arriving at the Sheraton, he realized he had not packed his pen, which is the means of administering his insulin. At the front desk we met Cora Conol, who immediately started phoning local pharmacies to locate one who would deliver a pen to the hotel. This met without success, due to restrictions on taxis at the airport. Cora, who is a diabetic herself, then loaned my husband her pen, so he could take his evening supply of insulin. One problem solved, but we were due to fly to Ft. Lauderdale for a 10 day Christmas cruise the following day. Cora then arranged for me to go to a pharmacy, who had agreed to give me a pen, by limo. The limo driver waited until I picked up the pen and returned me to the Sheraton Gateway Hotel. We then proceeded on our holiday and had a wonderful cruise. Without the help of Cora Conol, this holiday could not have happened. Thanks to Cora Conol and the limo driver, Lali, for their assistance. Wonderful people. Sandra Gordon

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: flyguytb
Reviews.Content: I am a Westjet FA from Vancouver and I have been staying at the Sheraton Gateway Toronto Airport now for about 4 years. It's a wonderful place to come home to, where you feel like you are always welcome and everyone is always happy to see you. Flavia greets me and my crew practically every morning I arrive at the hotel and she makes it her personal mission to ensure that all is right for our day sleep at the hotel. She leaves nothing to guess work and ensures that every FA and Pilot signs into a room they are happy with. If there is anything we need, she sees to it being taken care of, immediately. And she does it all with a wide smile on her face and being most gracious about it all. Although I feel like I am returning to see friends, it's never a doubt that as a "Guest" I am indeed well treated and well looked after. Flavia, it's such a pleasure to see you along with the rest of the staff every day I am there. Thank you, and all the staff for making my stays there so enjoyable. All the best in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: ontarioCanadaDylanB
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for the last 8 years + and have never had to complain about anything the hotel is very well looked after, staff go out of their way to ensure that everything is to your expectations, If you are lucky enough to get Flavia at the front desk you will be more than satisfied. She tries very hard to make sure everything is as you expect, as we have found out over the years, and especially at Christmas time when our flight was canceld over and over again.Flavia assited in makeing sure we stayed in the same room without having to be disrupted more than we already where.

Reviews.Title: “Execllent room and desk service”
Reviews.Author: Onourway547
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 4, Myself, spouse, adult son and adult female friend. In October when I started to look for hotels near the Toronto airport I looked first at a couple of favourite properties. However we would have had to take two rooms due to the situation, None of the properties I favoured would allow a cot in the room. When I phoned the Sheraton Gateway I talked to the manager Sham, giving him the details of our needs. We negotiated the use of one of thier family rooms which had a pull out sofa for the third bed we needed. This was a double bonus since the Sheraton Gateway is right at the airport and connected to the terminals and the off property parking garage by an elevated train known as the Link train. We would be able to park for a reasonable price and leave coats and winter gear in the car since we were flying to Florida for a holiday. On arrival we were quickly checked-in and in our very spacious room. It was great. The one downside was the pool. It was at this point out of service for needed mtce so was unavailable for the "kids" to use. The hotel provided a very nice town car to transfer them to the near-by Sheraton Four Points ( one of my favourites in this area ). This worked out very well. In addition there was a generous price adjustment for the inconvenience. The bed was very comfortable with NO airport noise. Nice flat screen TV with a great selection of channels. In the morning it was an easy get-up and onto the LINK train for the 2 min ride to Terminal One for our flight. Did not have to go outside at all, very convenient. An excelent experience with the booking through Sham, great stay. I have one gripe with all of the 5 star hotels including this one. They cannot seem to provide a complimentary breakfast nor complementary internet. In this case they wanted $10 for an hour of internet. Other 5 stars we have stayed with are the same. The Sheratons have a club level which includes these things but at an extra cost to what normally is a higher price anyway. I recommend this hotel and would quickly stay again for the location and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: firoan11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the sheraton gateway and I had such amazing service with a customer service representative named SAIRA so polite so helpful so energetic and full of life. My next stay will always be at the sheraton because of her she made my day. Thank you soo much. Mazen Sawwaf

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: mousekins23
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean. Staff are very helpful and courteous. Saira at the bell desk did her best to accomodate my extra needs....will definetly continue staying there when on business

Reviews.Title: “not happy!!”
Reviews.Author: gjancar
Reviews.Content: we made it clear that we wanted our children to enjoy the pool and hottub, when we booked. We went on a carabean vacation,, we wanted our children to enjoy a night before, to get ready for a great christmas, then we get ready to go swimming and we are frowned apon in the lobby by the workers??? when we ask were the pool is they say it is under renovations ? then we get back a week later, go to leave and after 11 min waiting at the gate to get out they tell us we owe another $18. for 2 extra hours . While people honking behind us! not a very nice way to go or way to come back!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for layovers”
Reviews.Author: jozobami
Reviews.Content: had a 8 hour long layover and chose to check in, take a bath, order room service and SLEEP. all three missions were completed. it took 2 minutes by trian to get to teh hotel from our terminal, quick check in, quick room service (though food wasnt anything spectacular it was ok) and nice big clan bed in a room overlooking the runways! quick check out and retur to departure terminal. the shower gel and conditioner etc were really nice too. didnt expect that. the lobby has free internet by the way. would stay there again anytime with a layover of 7 hours or more.

Reviews.Title: “Brutal way to end a long day of travel!!”
Reviews.Author: tcola33
Reviews.Content: After 3 connections, finally got to this hotel at 1:00 AM. Person at front desk didn't even look up, let alone smile. We were travelling with a young toddler to see family over the Holidays so we had several suitcases. No one had the presence of mind to offer a porter to help us get our bags to our room and they wouldn't allow the baggage trolleys from the airport into the elevators, thus requiring 3 trips back and forth to get the bags to the room. Had requested a crib for the room when I booked the hotel (over a month ago) as well as earlier in the day when I called to confirm AND at the front desk when I checked in. Got to the room at 1:00 AM to find no crib! Phoned the front desk and was cut off. Phoned again and was told someone would be up with a crib shortly - no apology! The person who got the crib to the room for us seemed perturbed that we'd had the gall to inconvenience her. Hey guys, I know the economy has been tough and you're trying to find ways to make a buck but it'd be nice if the Kleenex boxes you supplied actually had tissues in them. One more thing...having your employees show a modicum of courtesy to paying guests doesn't cost anything!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for its proximity to Pearson airport”
Reviews.Author: mattituckmattituck
Reviews.Content: Saira at the front desk was a fantastic first impression of the hotel. She was able to answer all my questions and even though I arrived earlier than check in was able to get me my room immediately. My bed was incredibly comfortable and given its proximity to the airport I didn't wake up once during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Stressed”
Reviews.Author: lorianne26
Reviews.Content: I was flying to London, and all the flights have been cancelled someone had told me about the sheraton gateway hotel, I decided to go and have a look. When i arrived at the hotel i saw the front desk agent her name was Flavia, she was very helpful and informative she told me about the lovely spa service they offered at Vaccaro's. I ran into the lovely girl name Roxy, she told me about the massage and manicure service. I decided to go with the massage and i will definetley recommend this spa to anybody coming through on stop over!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, and food”
Reviews.Author: hpdoug
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff is courteous and very helpful. Flavia is a true professional - always willing to help customers. Suzanne at the Mahagony Bar is the best, and Barbara working upstairs at the club lounge delivers outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, expensive”
Reviews.Author: Aliceesjan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night to fly out the next morning. The hotel is great, service is terrific and the rooms are nice and comfortable. The only thing I did not like was the lobby downstairs which looked like a gaming zone that night, could have been the day, on earlier visits it was more quiet. The location is great, we rented a car to go a few days to Grimsby and Niagara Falls which we dropped off at Alamo which is 100 meters away from the entrance of the hotel, next morning we had to fly from Terminal 3 which was another few meters away.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable only if you have an early flight, not to visit Toronto”
Reviews.Author: gluka
Reviews.Content: We had to spend the night at the airport due to a flight cancellation. Dispite the room was offered by the Air company, the experience was all but positive. The room was clean and confortable, but we have been asked to pay for any kind of basic service, which are normally included in the room fare even by any road motel! In this "Hi level" hotel you are supposed to pay for your internet connection and even for the "toll free" calls you make, and their unfair policy is to tell you about it only when you check out! The only thing they do not charge for is yhe air you breathe! Another absolutely negative point is the restaurant/breakfast room. Everything is "a la carte" and the prices are out of market: 5 dollars for a cup of coffee, plus tax and tip for the waiter. I suggest to have food in the terminal, it is better and cheaper, andat least the personnel is kind.

Reviews.Title: “FLAVIA ROCKS!!! INCREDIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: flygirl712
Reviews.Content: I am a flight attendant and have been staying at your hotel very frequently the last seven years. The Sheraton Gateway is my favorite hotel that we stay at and I am always relieved and excited when I see it on my schedule. I know that I will feel at home when I stay there. The beds are incredible, the rooms are spacious and I love the internet cafe in the lobby. One particular reason why I enjoy staying there is because there is an employee there that always makes me laugh. Her name is Flavia and she is outstanding at what she does. My role as a flight attendant is very much about providing outstanding customer service and several times I get disappointed when I do not get the same service elsewhere. However, Flavia never disappoints. At six in the morning I know I'll be greeted with a sincere smile and genuine hospitality. Years ago I had left my charger behind and called the hotel and luckily I spoke to Flavia as she had answered. Two days later when I returned to the hotel Flavia personally gave me my charger! I was so impressed that she went above and beyond to help me with something that I'm sure happens quite often. Since then I have loved the Sheraton Toronto Airport even more because I know that someone genuinely cares. It's hard being on the road sometimes and I definitely feel at home at the Sheraton because of people like Flavia. Thank You Sheraton for having someone at your location that helps give that secure feeling and trust. It's a pleasure staying at your hotel. Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “It is our hotel of choice for meetings!”
Reviews.Author: Dobs_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: We often use this hotel for meetings, seminars etc. It is convivient, clean and we have always received excellent service. Our Service Manager Nicole Aitkins was always available and ready to help with any questions/requests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location for Meetings”
Reviews.Author: Project_Coordinator
Reviews.Content: Our company has organized several meetings at this great location. It's direct access to Pearson makes it easy to organize travel for our clients. The service is prompt and attention to detail great. Would recommend for anyone who needs to organize a trip for busy travellers.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING PEOPLE !”
Reviews.Author: CoachTom77
Reviews.Content: What sets this Hotel apart is their Team from the most tenured to the newest associate! They really work well together! I was especially impressed by a front desk supervisor by the name of Flavia....always upbeat and positive! I have stayed in several hotels in Toronto, this one tops the list....because of their Outstanding People!

Reviews.Title: “Thank goodness for the Gateway”
Reviews.Author: vee_travels
Reviews.Content: Our flight was canceled due to weather and the airline would not provide any of the passengers with hotel vouchers. They were happy to give discounts to hotels that were accessible via shuttle but when we asked about the Gateway we were told it was too expensive. (We look young and artsy so maybe that was the reason?) We had already been to the Gateway to see if they had room and the clerk had suggested we seek travel assistance so we could get a rate discount. So we went to the information desk and were told to they were only offering discounts to an offsite hotel. We wandered back to the Gateway to use our AAA discount and the same clerk assisted us. She was appalled at how we were treated and gave us a very reasonable rate, was empathetic and truly sweet. We feel so lucky to have this haven in Toronto and being here in a storm almost makes being stranded okay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Jules154974
Reviews.Content: It was a delight staying at the Shertaon Gateway located at T3 in Toronto. Our conference organizer Nicole Aitkins provided me with excellent support with preparing and scheduling our meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Flavia”
Reviews.Author: Slava1
Reviews.Content: Great service at check-in. Got a free movie to compensate for renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Great for overnighting at Pearson”
Reviews.Author: rpt319
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good and is situated perfectly for an overnight layover. I had flown from Cuba to Toronto and was connecting to Edmonton the next afternoon. I landed in Toronto at around midnight and was through customs, received my baggage and in my room by 1 AM. The rooms are a little small. Especially, when I had three people in it with me. I expected there to be a couch in the room for one of us to crash on. Instead, they have an easy chair with an ottoman. It was a good thing my sister is relatively short, so she curled up on it and was fine. The bed was comfortable and quite clean. Didn't see a single bed bug which is a concern now in Toronto. Now two negatives with the hotel. For being a hotel that has triple thick windows to keep out the aircraft noise, they certainly didn't do it with the walls between the rooms. Unfortunately, the neighbors on the wall with the bed were quite amourous and I could hear every noise through the walls. The second problem was I had ordered a pizza and the front desk would not let the pizza guy come up. I had to go down to the lobby and pick it up there. Very strange as the elevators do not have a card swipe to get up to guest rooms. I would definitely stay there again, if I needed to be at the airport. They have a airline check-in terminal in the lobby. So I checked in and printed my boarding pass right there. It is connected to Terminal 3 and the LINK Train runs between there and Terminal 1. So I never had to actually go outside to get to and from the planes. I can't comment on any of the other services offered at the hotel as I spent about 8 hours in the hotel. Most of them asleep, so it appeared to be a full service hotel. But I can't say for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Super Convenient and a comfortable stay always”
Reviews.Author: CanadianAandJ
Reviews.Content: Located in Terminal 3 (go to luggage pickup, head out through main exit, turn right immediately and follow overhead signs). Super convenient for a stop over. Staff friendly, beds comfortable. Needs a little TLC in rooms (paint touchups, carpet cleaning, etc) but otherwise fine for what you need it for. A bit dark and depressive....but again, you are just here to sleep right? Not the most quiet hotel, but I bring earplugs....and I recommend you do too. In hotel restaurant and room service are insanely expensive....airport restaurants are only a one minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “All about location.”
Reviews.Author: Walter077
Reviews.Content: Rooms are large, bathroom a bit small though. Nice and clean. Food is better than what you can get at the rest of the airport. Biggest advantage is that you walk right into the terminal. If you stay in Toronto for a longer period, consider another hotel, as a taxi downtown will cost about $ 50 one way. Stayed here for two nights during a stopover. When we returned home a week later, we had to kill 7 hours on this airport between flights, and could store our luggage at no charge.

Reviews.Title: “Most humiliating experience”
Reviews.Author: Manny005
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recent stayed at the Sheraton Gateway. When I booked online, I asked for a crib for our 5 mth old. The room was to be pre-paid so I believed it was charged to my credit card accordingly. This was 2 weeks prior to the stay. On the night in question we checked in, but there was no crib, no biggie, our baby had to sleep in the bed which meant that I didn't sleep! In the morning I was about to leave when I noticed the "bill" and went to the front desk to inquire what was wrong. I was told that my card was declined, but no explanation was given why I wasn't informed at check in (Note I have a pre-paid credit card so I know the funds was there). They tried it twice more and on both occasions was told that it declined. At this point I offered my Debit card and after one try was told it was also declined. At this point the manager escorted me to an ATM and had me withdraw cash to pay. After arriving at my destination I was checking my emails and noticed a number of emails from my credit card company. At this point I realized what had happened. 4 attempts to over charge my credit card was made and no attempt to charge the room rate ( pre-paid) was made when it should have been 2 weeks prior! When I told my wife she mentioned that an employee had told her that none of their machines were working since moving around the front desk a few days prior! The hotel manager lied to me about attempting to charge my credit card on the night I booked the room and then gave me some cockamame story about over charging for incidentals. (There were none). I'm still waiting for a proper explanation and an apology, in the meantime they've asked if I would like to book my return stay with them! LOL

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: btrvlr
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and courteous staff... well located within the airport in Toronto. Was treated very well, and I'm thankful to Sham who helped save the day! Thanks again! I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exeptional stay all around”
Reviews.Author: inoakville
Reviews.Content: From our welcome to our departure we had exceptional service especially from all the staff. Room cleanliness was outstanding and the location and I must add the view for an airport enthusiast is TOPS. I highly recommend this place and would definately return any opportunity I can. A special thanks to Danuta who was especially helpful in our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Ripped Us Off”
Reviews.Author: Steveℜen
Reviews.Content: My family have used this hotel for years before taking family vacations together. It is located in Terminal 3 and could not be more perfectfly located. We have always had a good experience at this property. When we needed a hotel on September 30th before our trip to Florida, it was an obvious choice. I booked this hotel months ago through the SPG web-site. After a lengthy discussion witt my wife, we decided to indulge on this stay and upgrade to the Club Floor using extra SPG points. 3,000 I believe. When I booked the room, I specifically requested an airport view because my two young children love looking out at the airplanes. I followed up my e-booking by calling the hotel directly in August. When we arrived at 4:30pm on September 30th, we checked in. We were given our room keys and sent to the 7th Floor. We arrived only to discover this was in fact not the Club Floor. We immediately returned to the front desk and I was told that the Club Floor was sold out, so we were placed on the 7th Floor instead. When I booked the room on SPG.com, they offered a club room and I cashed in my points for a club room. Why would the hotel sell more Club Rooms than they have available?
