Only after I complained did the gentleman at the front desk offer to add access to the Club Lounge to our room key. I was completely shocked, I redeemed my SPG points for a Club Room but they could not provide me with a Club Room! We did take advantage of the Club Lounge following this disappointing check-in and I must say this property has really cut back over the past year. The snacks provided in the lounge were fruit, cheese and crackers. In the past, this property has always offered a much better selection. We decided to leave and go out for dinner. This stay really upset my wife and I. We have discussed it since our vacation and the only conclusion that we can come to is that when we arrived to check-in with two young children in tow the front desk staff discriminated against us because of the children and would not honour our reservation. When we did stop at the Club Lounge, there were no other children. It would appear to me that they don't want kids on this floor for whatever reason. When we checked out the following morning, I made an inquiry about receiving back a credit for the SPG points that were redeemed for a Club Room and was told no. How could they not refund our 3,000 points when they failed to deliver a Club Room. I will be pursing this further with Starwoods head office since nobody at the hotel seemed interested in resolving my concerns. We have another trip book in February and we will not be staying at this hotel beforehand!

Reviews.Title: “Staff at check in were the most polite staff we encountered in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Oct102010
Reviews.Content: The Desk staff at the Gateway Sheraton where a pleasant surpise to us when we booked at this hotel attached to the airport. Every Airport staff person we ran into was short and almost rude --- However the Sheraton especially Rosario were professional, extremely helpful and worked hard to accomadate our needs. So much so we immediately booked for family flying out three days later. Rooms well set up, very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate”
Reviews.Author: sleepy111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel prior to our flight the next morning. The room was impecable. The linens for the crib were as soft as a baby's bottom. The room was spacious well decorated and furnished. The heavenly sleep in the heavenly bed waslike heavan. Our prompt wake up call begrudgingly sent us on our way. A very pleasant surrounding situated in the hustle and bustle of the airport. I would recommend this conveniently located hotel to any travellers that need to be at the airport early in the morning. It takes all the stress away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Denise313
Reviews.Content: First hotel I stayed at in a long time where the front desk made me feel welcomed. Rosario Parlor who handled the check in was excellent to work with and smiled.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic comfort and conveniece with Sheraton serevice.”
Reviews.Author: wayward201
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times over the last ten years and the service is always excellent. The quality of their Sweet Sleeper beds assures a good night's sleep and although it is located at the airport there is virtually no air traffic noise. The food maintains a high standard and in my mind it is the best value on the "strip".

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel, great location if you have are departing or arriving on a late/early flight”
Reviews.Author: MFA024
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on September with my parents in law. My parents in law arrived to Toronto on a late flight, and the location of the hotel was extremely convenient! They just got off the gate, then took the stairs, and the hotel was right there! We also had an early flight, so again, it was very convenient for us. As for the hotel itself, the front desk staff was very attentive, we were greeeted by the housekeeping lady once we got to our floor, and the rooms are great and spacious. I was worried about the noise of the planes at night, but guess what? We couldn't hear a thing, even though I am a light sleeper! So if you are not sure to stay here because it is right next to the ariport, you may want to change your mind! I had a great sleep and I loved the hotel and the service provided! I would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional front desk service and support”
Reviews.Author: TakeFlight7
Reviews.Content: During my stay the front desk staff were attentive and supportive of requests. As the client's first encounter is critical in establishing an opinion of the hotel, the front line staff set a positive tone for my hotel experience. I especially thank Rosario for her friendly service and support. Thank you Luba Rusyn

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Siroka
Reviews.Content: After a long day trip from Europe, this hotel was conveniently located for an overnight stay before an early morning flight to another Canadian province. We travelled with our small dog and we are pleased that Sheraton is one hotel in the Toronto airport area that allows pets. We had room service and the meal arrived within 30 mins and was warm. Pleasant, friendly staff. Even though the hotel is adjacent to the busy airport, you do not hear the roar of the airplanes. We have stayed before and will stay again. Our double room was confortable, spacious, clean and with modern decor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: postergirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before an early morning flight and took advantage of a park and stay deal. This became a huge advantage to have our car stored indoors after there had been a fair amount of snow during the week, and we didn't have to scrape or brush off when we got back. The check in experience was friendly and efficient. I was welcomed back as a SPG member and given a great room with a great view. The bed was super comfortable, as is the norm with the Sheraton chain. The best part for me was definitely the ease of walking out, taking the train to the terminal and having a nice and easy check in for my flight. I also loved that the concierge would store our winter coats and boots for us so they would be indoors and warm to get into upon our return. I could nitpick that I don't like having to pay for internet in the room in this day and age, but wifi was free and available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed.”
Reviews.Author: hatlad
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's right across the street from Terminal 3. Yes, it looks nice. But the service was abominable. Hotel check-in clerk gave us the hard sell to each contribute CAN $ 3 to some tree-planting charity and just wouldn't let up til we finally got "firm" about it. We hosted a conference here and had contracted AV gear, projection screen, wireless internet in conference facility room, etc etc. NONE of that was available when we arrived for the conference WITHOUT PAYING EXTRA when we'd already paid. Showed them the contract and they said, well it's not on OUR forms so we have to charge again to provide. Sounds like a scam to me. Not impressed despite the location and flash.

Reviews.Title: “any closer and you will be sleeping in the terminal building”
Reviews.Author: johndavies68
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel on the 12th september 2010 paid about Â£45 through a third party website.when arriving at the airport .the sheraton is sign posted everywhere.go to level 2 to check in.we were given a room which overlooked a quiet carpark but had a great view of the toronto skyline.the pool is open 24 hours a day but is not supervised .we took advantage of the hot pool and very hot jacuzzi.the only noise you can hear in the room is the 747 planes taking off.not a major problem.all staff were very good .especially the front desk lady.when leaving this hotel there is a covered walkway to terminal 3 and you can also catch the monorail to terminal 1.would stay here again .and a big thank you to everyone that made our stay so good

Reviews.Title: “Great convenient place to stay when travelling through YYZ”
Reviews.Author: LeviTrop
Reviews.Content: I booked here on a recent overnight back to Vancouver and had a great stay. I also stayed here one night when I was a kid, and you can tell it has been renovated since, although there are still some finishing touches that need to be done in the bathroom. I liked the Starbucks coffee and cup (which I assume was complimentary) on the desk, the great view of the runway, and the very comfy king-sized bed. My only complaint is to watch out if you are ordering room service: They added a $5 delivery fee, AND a mandatory 18% tip on top of the delivery fee. Who is that delivery fee going to if you also are tipping the staff, I don't know. At 1am after a long haul flight I was too tired to read the receipt and notice the included mandatory gratuity, so I ended up adding a second 15% tip for the delivery staff. $26 for a Caesar salad, but at least one of us walked away happy after that transaction. To his credit the fellow who delivered it was very friendly. Overall, definitely recommend this hotel to others, but perhaps the management can look into addressing the multiple mandatory delivery charges on their room service.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed I Have Ever Slept in.....”
Reviews.Author: JoH1967
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand the previous two reviews about dirty beds and rooms. Maybe they had employed students who didn't use anti-perspirant to make up the rooms on that occasion?? Our two rooms, with interconnecting door, were both spotlessly clean. The beds were the softest and fluffiest we had ever slept in, the bed linen all pure white and clean and crisp, the pillows soft yet substantial - we all had a wonderful nights sleep. The rooms themselves were quite standard - but perfectly sufficient for an overnight stop at the hotel. We did not eat here as we expected it to be quite pricey, but managed to get a substantial family brunch at a place in the terminal building, a few minutes walk from our rooms. I would definitely stay here again though the premium location did come at a premium price, but only to be expected when you have the airport right on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Pinklogic
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night before our flight. My husband and I travelled with our two children ages 6 and 2. We had connecting rooms with my parents. Upon arrival I asked the woman at the front desk where I could find the luggage carts. She informed me they didn't have any at the hotel .....uh hello this is an airport hotel and you don't have any luggage carts??? Our room smelled of terrrible B.O. and the bathtub was filthy. The carpet had stains and the bottom sheet of the bed had some kind of stain on it. It was clear the bottom sheet had not been changed. I can't believe this is listed as a 4 star hotel. It is in desperate need of fresh paint and carpets and the bathrooms need a serious facelift. We had chosen this hotel because it was so close to the airport but next time we will stay at one further away and take a shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “We would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bythebaytoday
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a number of Sheraton Airport Hotels throughout the world and we are both ashamed that this is how Canada will be viewed by many visitors. This hotel is in a great location (that was why we stayed there). However, it is dated, it is dirty, the staff are unhappy and unhelpful and the prices are way too high for what you get. The room has updated furniture - looks good in pictures but once you get there the room itself is showing signs of being run down and the entire hotel looks like they should start again. (not just some new furniture). The bathroom was the same - the toilet was chipped, the bathtub looked filthy, the carpet had stains (and really - this is a Sheraton - why would stains be okay?). The hallways to the rooms are dark, narrow and depressing. The restaurant was way overpriced for what you got and very slow service that night. We asked for extra towels/sheets and had to call 3 times with excuses made each time and when someone did finally turn up (over two hours after we called) they made sure we knew that they were not happy that we had dragged them out. All the staff did not seem to want to be there. If you are like us and want the location to make a flight then yes you will survive for one night but if you have a choice find somewhere else to stay. There wasn't one huge problem but just a lot of little things that added up to a bad experience. It was not a room or a hotel that I wanted to linger in like many others. Also, here is my big pet peeve with some Sheraton hotels - some have this odd practice of leaving 6-12 inches of the bottom of the mattress uncovered by the bottom sheet. Fine if you are a short person and your feet don't make it down to the bottom of the bed but us taller folk do not appreciate this. We understand that this must reflect some issue with the sheets - that they become undone on the top and people complain so you put more sheet to the top so it can be tucked in well but it results in a space on the bottom of the mattress? We did not appreciate this - if there is a problem get better sheets. Or perhaps staff just find it is easier to do this? Also, this hotel had the sheet, then the duvet (without a duvet cover on it). This seems to be a North American thing. If you are going to use a duvet on the bed THEN do it right: put a proper duvet cover on it that gets taken OFF EVERY TIME NEW GUESTS ARRIVE, washed and a new one put back on. I know this takes extra time - but again, we stayed in many places in Europe and none of them (even the little family run hotels) had a problem with that - even with King duvets. Then you don't end up sleeping with a dirty uncovered duvet - most of us move in our sleep and there is no way that one sheet is going to stay in place between person and duvet. This is just a poor practice. Check out the German Airport Sheraton's and the comparison is like night and day. There was no problem with noise at this Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “great location....too bad the fridge does not work”
Reviews.Author: madronatrish
Reviews.Content: the location is super right in Terminal 3...we arrived on a very late flight. The bar was still open for last call and the server/bartender was super and very patient with some other rather impaired guest. Room was clean and nice. but...one of the lamps did not work and the fridge does not work....even without a mini bar a small fridge in a good hotel is such a nice feature.....no one could help ...said "it doesn;t work.....offer to send someone and a 'CRIB ARRIVED AT THE DOOR" I guess there was a translation dilemna.....great stay and good value in genera.l

Reviews.Title: “Great service; perfect airport location!”
Reviews.Author: PB650_10
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times, and there is no better place to stay if you have an early flight out of Toronto the next morning (especially if you hate mornings and early flights like me). I returned the rental car in the same building, took the elevator and was in the lobby in two minutes. Their check-in system is very efficient, both the machines and at the counter. The hotel crew is always very courteous and professional. The lounge on the 8th floor is really good. In the morning all you have to do is get out of your room and go to your gate! Can't find anything more practical than that. The price is a bit higher than other hotels in the same category, but well worth it for the convenience. The rooms are well maintained and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Airport convenience”
Reviews.Author: BigTipper
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay "near" the airport, then it doesn't get any better than this. The hotel is attached to Terminal #1, with the airport train conveniently below you can get to the other terminals quickly. The restaurant closes at 10:30pm, but the bar has a decent menu, and you can order off of it till midnight, or 1am, can't quite recall. Food was fairly good, with nothing we could complain about. Ok, one thing we could complain about: Price! I think a burger, bowl of soup, and a beer, added up to $46, or something like that. That was for each of us. It was almost $100 for the two of us. Rooms were fairly typical business hotel rooms. In spite of being at the airport, you don't hear the airplane traffic much. They seem to have insulated the outer wall and windows well. Unfortunately, I can't say they applied the same amount of sound deadening to the between-room walls. I could hear most of the noise the next door family was making. Other than that, the room was fine. There were a few carpet stains, and a few other signs that the rooms could use a reno, but nothing too serious. The bathroom was the same condition. It was fine. I've stayed at this hotel a few times before, and the experience is usually the same. They do a good job, but nothing that ever strikes me as world class. You shouldn't experience any huge issues here.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and accomodating service.”
Reviews.Author: Chimpcherry
Reviews.Content: My husband daughter and I stayed at the Sheraton Gateway for two nights in August. The guest services agent Maria went above and beyond her duties to make our check -in and our stay wonderful. The accomodations were lovely and the facilities (pool, gym) were very clean and up to date with equipment. We would recomend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a warm and comforting place to stay. Also, even though we were at the airport there was no noise and we were not far from anywhere we wanted to go in the greater Toronto area. The only downfall is the parking. It cost us $28.00 a night. I guess a small price to pay for comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Spotty yet adequate if you have to stay there.”
Reviews.Author: Martha12344
Reviews.Content: Inconsistent noise levels in rooms. One time just fine this time noisy air conditioner and planes. Cleanliness average- poor. Product knowledge of staff re bedding was poor. Front desk was trying very hard to be accomodating but could not answer for sure re: if the bedding was feather free as needed. Last time we had a problem with the lack of product knowledge as well. The tub was very unappealling and looked dirty. Will only stay here if we have to. The restaurant / bar was accomodating re: dietary needs.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: Bart_104
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at the end of June for business. I needed a place close to the airport and after reading various reviews on this website I found this hotel to be highly recommended - and let me say that it definately lived up to the hype. I was fortunate to stay on the club level which included free internet and a complimentary breakfeast - definately worth the upgrade as the club room was exceptional and the staff were super helpful. The rooms were very clean; and the beds were some of the best I have ever slept on at a hotel. The hotel restaraunt was nice and the food was good - but as others have mentioned previously, it is pretty expensive to dine. Yes, the hotel costs more per night than the others in the area by comparison, but overall I would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay before honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Jalenkos
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding on the 17th of July and were leaving for our honeymoon on the 18th. We decided it would be better to stay near the airport so we didn't have to battle traffic. Arrived at 2am, check-in was a breeze and we were in bed within minutes of arriving after a long day! Room was nice, bed was comfortable. Received a free breakfast at the restaurant downstairs as the Club Lounge was closed. It was quick and just what we were looking for. Kiosk in the lobby was great for checking into our flight, definately saved us time at the airport as the self serve kiosks there had a fairly long line. We were flying out of Terminal 1 which was no problem, just hop on the Tram and you're there in 2 minutes. Overall we were quite pleased with the hotel, was a nice start to our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel......but seen better”
Reviews.Author: JAmerican74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 6 days. Everything was ok, but I've been to way better hotels for the price. Ate at the Mahogony grill one night, and the food was great. Bed was comfortable. Remember, this is Canda so prices are hefty. We did have friends and family rate, so that was another plus for us. Pierson airport is right across the street, so that was extremely convienient. If you rent a vehicle, you have to pay for daily parking...a nice $28 daily which is added to your hotel bill. There are no stores are restaurants outside, so don't plan on taking a walk unless you want to walk around the airport. There is a 24 hr. indoor pool and fitness center also. You can ask the front dest for take out menus if you rather other foods. They have Chinese and Pizza menus that will deliver to your door. There is a mini fridge in the room that used to be used as a mini bar, so you can get some drinks and keep them cool there. Over all, if's and nice hotel......but I've been to others that really had that "Wow" factor. Enjoy! BTW...internet is not free. $16 daily.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Mschuetz
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Gateway Hotel in the Toronto Airport is a fantastic hotel! The service is outstanding and the people are great! The manager Bin is so accommodating. He is always looking for ways to make my stay more enjoyable. This kind of service has been lost in the industry today. However at the Sheraton Gateway it has been found. I would highly recommend this hotel for business travelers looking for a overnight stay. If is so convenient if you are flying out of either terminal because of the tram that runs right from the hotel. If you are travelling on personal business the hotel has great rates on weekends. You will not be disappointed by staying at this hotel. It has it all great people, great views, great food and great service. It is not often you see the same people month after month and year after year working at the same hotel. This is true of the Sheraton Gateway. The people remember who you are and welcome you back time and time again. In a world where there is so many choices of where to stay, this hotel stands above them all.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment - 3 years in a row”
Reviews.Author: federDubai
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Sheraton Gateway due to its location within Toronto AIrport which is simply unbeatable. We travel with young children so we usually do a stopover on our ultra long haul journey to Vancouver. I first stayed at the hotel when it first opened and it was great then. Now it is suffering from a demoralised staff - due to recent staff cuts and a tired looking hotel. We recently stayed there arriving off a 14 hour flight to find that one of our 2 rooms was not ready at 5pm which is 2 hours after our posted check-in time. We were given complimentary access to the club lounge which happened to be closed on the weekend. On the positive note, I did refer the issues to Sheraton through their automated survey and the GM did get back to me promptly and in a very positive manner. I was very pleased with this and hope to see her on our next stop. I look forward to discussing further with her so that all the travelers can benefit from any changes. My recommendation is driven by its location which is unbeatable by far. I would not recommend anyone to fight with luggage to go to an offisite airport hotel especially in the harsh winter. One more note is that the bed is VERY comfortable -pf

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: TrishLondonOntario
Reviews.Content: All the staff at the Sheraton Gateway were gracious and extremely helpful We checked in with a lovely receptionist and when we shared a problem (what to do with our dog during a business interview) she was genuinely concerned and offered several helpful suggestions. She inquired later about the matter, and even offered assistance. The concierge, the restaurant maitre de, and the cleaning staff were unfailingly gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre stay (3 *) in Terminal 3 YYZ hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickinNagoya
Reviews.Content: The check-in was very professional and speedy. Asked about upgrading to Club Level but was informed that the weekend had limited service in the Lounge. The room assigned was alright, but there were 3 items that did not work properly. Initially, I called down to the front to request turn down service and that the closet door, which was jammed, be repaired so I could lock my passport in the safe. This was repaired while we were out, but on our return I discovered the safe was inoperable. Hmmm . . . was it worthwhile to call them back again? I decided it wasn't. Later on, I noticed the light in the tub area was burnt out, too. Again, did not seem to be worthwhile to call about this so late in the night. Oddly, the "turn-down service" advertised in the guestrooms is apparently now not available due to the staff leaving at 11pm??? Small details, but my daughter read about the chocolate and was looking forward to it upon our return from dinner. No big deal, but not exactly what I'd expect from the Sheraton. Will be returning there next month, we'll see how that stay compares.

Reviews.Title: “Fungus in the fridge, ripped sheet and dust everywhere”
Reviews.Author: WeRHappyTravellers
Reviews.Content: We had an unplanned two night stay at the Sheraton Gateway Hotel in Toronto thanks to the Iceland Volcano. The location was excellent for us, as we needed to be close to the airport in order to get regular updates on our cancelled flight. However, the hotel was very tired, as my review titles suggests, our room looked clean on the surface but a closer look revealed fungus in the bar fridge (a lot of it too!), ripped and threadbare sheets and copious amounts of dust everywhere suggesting the room hadn't been cleaned properly for a very long time. The service was also below normal Sheraton standards. We regular stay at Sheraton Hotels worldwide and we're prepared for a certain amount of variation in standards but this Sheraton was well below the standards of any other we have ever stayed in. It doesn't deserve its four star rating and Sheraton really need to do something before this particular Sheraton Hotel gives the others a bad wrap. Avoid it at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but!”
Reviews.Author: Ronsters
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel for a traveller, food is very expensive because it's in the airport, the airport restaurants are horrible! Make sure you get your parking validated at the front desk, you can go in and out any time, parking is $28 a day, front entrance is on level 5, which is a hassle to get to through the parking garage, it takes about 3-5 minutes going throught the parking garage to get to it. they have a discount parking garage called the Viscount which is about 5 minutes away but the train stops in it, the only advantage to this is if you are leaving your car parked for 24 hours. Internet is $16.95 a day in the room or you can go to the lobby, wifi is free for 60 mins. The hotel itself is very good, the whirlpool, sauna and swimming pool was very good. the bed was very very firm, so couldn't sleep well, the room was facing the runway, this was very good for the kids, got to see all the president's planes parked during the G20 summit. overall very good hotel but expensive. definetely Look for alternatives!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: gigiduru
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in Terminal 3 of airport.It si a very good location if you intend to stay overnight in airport.otherwis eprobaly if you intend to stayfor visiting Toronto it is not the ebst location you should stay in downtown.Very clean rooms good fitness facilities ,the price for food in restaurant is a alittle bit expensive.Overall very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: TravelThat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at the Sheraton Gateway Toronto Airport before an early morning flight. The best part about the hotel is the location. You literally walk across the bridge and you're at the hotel. The view from the room was pretty cool, if you like looking at aircraft (which I do). It's basically the view from a control tower overlooking the runways. Unfortunately, not all was good at this hotel. I made the mistake of eating at the hotel bar/restaurant, and almost fell out of my chain when I saw the prices. Unfortunately it was late by the time I got in, and I didn't have a vehicle, so I wasn't in the mood to go out searching for food. In hindsight, I should have walked over to the airport to get a bite. For a simple chicken dish (that wasn't that good) and a beer, the meal was $60.00! For that price I could have enjoyed a filet from the Keg. Also, while at the gateway, I went to use the gym. I walked in to find a space no bigger than a closet, with a rack of free weights and a couple machines... definitely not a good space. There were two people in the room and I couldn't work out because we were bumping into each other. I enjoy getting a workout in when I travel, so I was definitely disappointed. Pros: Location Cool View Clean room Friendly/ helpful staff Cons: Food Prices Parking Option$ Lack of quality gym space I give it a 3 star and recommendation based mainly on the location. It's great if you need a place to crash before an early morning flight, but don't expect to find much in the way of amenities, and bring your wallet if you want to eat there...

Reviews.Title: “No room service after midnight!”
Reviews.Author: chick111
Reviews.Content: Good location (onsite at YYZ airport) and clean. However, if you want to eat after midnight, you will be out of luck. The hotel no longer offers room service after midnight and does not have snack food accessible after midnight (gift shop closed, no vending machines). In my view this is unacceptable for an airport hotel, particularly the one that is directly onsite at the largest city in the country. My recommendation: stay at the Hilton. Otherwise the hotel is decent.

Reviews.Title: “The place to sleep for an early morning flight!”
Reviews.Author: Canada-Malibu-Barbie
Reviews.Content: In trying to get back home, we missed our flight from Montreal and we were rerouted to Toronto. We were thinking of staying in the airport all night due to the fears of missing another flight but when we landed we could clearly see the Sheraton! Inside the airport, frustration was mounting as we could not find a telephone book or shuttles etc...yet we didn't realize that the hotel is actually connected to the airport. We stumbled onto "Travellers Aid" which was a counter near the car rentals in terminal 3. My husband explained to them that we were stuck there etc...and this wonderful lady called the Sheraton and got us a $200.00 room for $99.00! Finally our luck turned around! The room was clean, spotless! The room was so quiet especially when you consider the location! They had Starbucks coffee with "To go" mugs! It was all about convenience We could actually leave the room and go check in for the flight and go lie down until it was time to go through security because the hotel is connected to the terminal by a skywalk! ! A great location for an early morning flight!

Reviews.Title: “Goop Airport Overnighter”
Reviews.Author: Saultites
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight on the way to and from Dominican Republic. Awesome location for airport access, especially for non-Air Canada flights (AC terminal takes a tram, but still quite good access). Great room, nice bed, very clean. Pricey meal in restaurant, and very loud hallways in the early morning with kids running for elevator. I would ask for a room far away from the elevators. But quiet otherwise, and virtually no plane noise.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms”
Reviews.Author: marchbreakneeded
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends, 8 of us in total. Enjoyed the rooms, close together, facing the airport. Amazingly quiet for right beside airport. Parking was expensive, but right close to hotel. Not much around the hotel for eating establishments, but ate in hotel, excellent wings! Would be an excellent stopover choice as it is connected to the airport through a bright skywalk. A tram went by our window regularly and the teens liked guessing when it was coming by and who was on it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Transit Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MillionMilr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Gateway hotel twice, one night each when transiting through Toronto Airport to Hong Kong. This hotel is directly connected to T3 via an enclosed walkway. You will need to take the train to go to T1. From T3, simply take follow the signs to the hotel from the departures level and take the escalator to the bridge to the hotel. Very convenient. If you're traveling with a lot of luggage, you can push your cart directly to the hotel and straight onto the elevator and into your room. This hotel was a welcome sight in between my flights to/from Asia. Request a room with a runway view to see planes landing/departing. My only complaint is that not all the rooms have free bottle water (which I don't understand). One night, I was in a room that didn't have water. The second time I stayed, there was complimentary water. The beds are extremely confortable and the hotel is very quiet for being within the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Board of Directors and Prof Advisory Board Meetings”
Reviews.Author: T0urette1
Reviews.Content: I'm a meeting planner and this was our first experience with formal meetings at this location. We were very pleasantly surprised. The service right from the sales department down to the housekeeping staff was great they couldn't have been more helpful in 90% of the cases. The only hiccup was a special meal that was forgotten and the hotel has more than apologized to both me and the guest.

Reviews.Title: “Room - Perfect. Customer Service - Not even close.”
Reviews.Author: RIGuy1024
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel a couple of times/year and have never been so disappointed in my stay, specifically the service. I'll touch on the good first... The room was in perfect condition and throughout the stay I felt like the housekeeping staff was worthy of chain-wide awards because it was spotless every time. The room was spacious and in great condition. As expected, the food is pretty over priced in the bar and restaurant but I've seen worse and it was pretty good. The bartenders & wait staff are very friendly and efficient. And now some of the bad... I asked at check-in if my key would work for the Club Lounge (I am SPG Gold) and was rudely told no - platinums and those booking a room on that level only. Rules vary from hotel-to-hotel so no big deal but the attitude from the gentleman who snapped the answer back at me made me feel very unappreciated, even as a Gold member (who will be qualifying at a Platinum this calendar year). Upon check-in I was notified that the in-and-out for the parking garage was not working properly and I would have to return to the front desk each time to get my new ticket swapped for my old one - a pain but not a big deal. The issue developed each and every time (about 5-6 during a 3-day stay) I went to the desk to do this and the attitude I got from the staff including one woman who tried to explain to me how to enter my ticket into the machine talking to me like I was a child. I explained to her that I was told by the woman who checked me in that this is what had to be done since the ticket reader wasn't working (I did try once to make sure it wasn't fixed, it wasn't) and then she tried telling me the entire activity of swapping tickets was unnecessary. Again, I reminded her that I was told by her fellow co-worker this is how it had to be done and IF I tried using my old ticket (the one that was on file and paid for) that it wouldn't let me out since I hadn't used it to get back in, she finally understood and swapped it out but with a completely unnecessary attitude. The hotel is great and would stay here again but on my next trip I'll keep my fingers crossed that some of the attitude issues w/the front desk staff have been put in check.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - for travelling families”
Reviews.Author: KirstyKeebler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so close to the airport. We had an early morning weekday flight - no traffic, just got up and a quick train ride to the airport . The hotel is close to T3, our flight was at T1, which was a easy train ride, as the station is in the hotel (which the little one thought was great). Hotel is very clean, rooms are spacious and we had friendly service. We will always stay here if we fly out early for vacation or business.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: LITTLE_BUNNY06
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Toronto for the weekend and booked this hotel through Hotwire. We were travelling with our 10 month old and had requested a little fridge ( for his food & formula ) and a cot. Needless to say, none were there when we arrived. The person who had confirmed that the frigde was reserved, was nowhere to be found. The cot was disgusting! Dirty, metal bars, no sheet...I find it very disturbing that they still have these! The first room we were assigned, had been smoked in and smelled awful. The second one was a bit better, with a nice view of the airport (only + for this hotel ). It was dated, small & dark...the air was unbreathable...The bathroom was small as well with a tub that was more yellow than white, chipped and with dark spots. Unacceptable for a 4 * hotel! Would I go ever go back? I doubt it!

Reviews.Title: “CHECK YOUR CREDIT CARD FOR ADDITIONAL 'DMF' CHARGE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cathrineann
Reviews.Content: Okay, the hotel is fine and comfortable and convenient for travellers. However, I realize that I have been charged and additional $6.67 cents on every previous stay for their 'VOLUNTARY' Destination Marketing Fee! I was not happy about this!! The staff didn't advise/ask me upon check in/out and I think it's pretty shifty that they just add it. Basically, the city of Toronto is getting tourists to pay for tourist marketing!!! Go figure! You may not have a problem with that, but I do. Quite frankly, the city can pay for it's own tourism marketing. I live in BC!! Again, you may be okay with this, but I'm not so I wanted everyone to know about this. It is a VOLUNTARY tax/payment, but at $250.00 a night plus taxes, they can contribute to their own DMF!!! Also, someone said that you get one free hour of internet. I got charge $9.97 for one hour! I am not recommending based on this. I am tired of expensive hotels penalizing their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Nunateach
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Sheraton Gateway Hotel at least once a year, and I have always experienced warm, hospitable service: check-in is always quick and efficient, the rooms are very nice, the beds are Sheraton Sweet Sleeper beds so they are very comfortable, and the food at the restaurant is good. The main selling point for this hotel is the location. It is a quick monorail ride from Terminal 1, so it is perfect if you have an early morning flight. So, all in all, it is not going to be a place you take the family for a holiday, but it is definitely a place worth staying at if you need to overnight at YYZ.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service to the nth Degree!!!!”
Reviews.Author: YYZAviator
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at this property many times over the past few years, but a recent stay (April 2-4) has prompted me to write this review. My accommodations were booked on the Sheraton SPG Club Floor, where the wired and wireless internet (in the club lounge) is free, and you get free bottled water as well as Hors D'oeuvres during the business week in the lounge. The rooms are pretty much identical to the rest of the hotel, except you are on the top floor, and you are well taken care of. My stay this time was notably different, in a positive light. At check-in, my request from my booking to have an airfield/airport view was already taken care of, as well my keys and breakfast vouchers for the restaurant (to which Club Floor accommodations come with on the weekends) were already prepared. Past stays have had me asking for the breakfast vouchers, which just added an extra step. This was a nice touch, as it eliminated me having to ask the Front Desk staff for help a second time. After getting up to the 8th floor, I noticed a selection of the days papers were laid out in the hallway on a nice dark wood table, so that customers could just pick up their paper at their leisure. This also was something new, and I found this to be particularly thoughtful. The rest of my stay was very comfortable. One thing I have come to like about the Sheraton Gateway is just how helpful their staff is, and how friendly they are. the Housekeeping staff is always smiling and saying hello to me in the hall. One final touch that really impressed me was a Waiter in the restaurant. The gentleman's name was Angel. To my surprise, Angel remembered me from a visit a few months prior, and even remembered my order, right down to the incredients in my breakfast omelet! This is absolutely an amazing feat, considering the number of people they serve in the restaurant! To sum it up, this hotel is very convenient as a stay-over for business as well as a nice place to stay for a pre-trip snooze. I have stayed at this property for over 10 stays now, and have yet to be disappointed once. The only negatives (to be fair), to this property are: - the expensive over-night parking charges (28.00$ I believe, but you are allowed in and out access) - The restaurant and room service appear to be very costly - Not much in the area with regards to alternative food / entertainment, unless you have a car and can travel just a short distance from the airport. PS -- If you are staying on the Club Floor, don't forget to check out the Club Lounge in the late evening.. No one usually is in there, and there's a hidden gem - a relaxing massage chair hidden in a far corner! Thanks to the staff at the Sheraton Gateway for a memorable time!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: flicker80
Reviews.Content: The location on the Pearson Toronto Airport site is why you would stay at this hotel. If, like me, you arrive on a late flight one evening and depart on another flight the next day, this is the perfect place to stay, so long as you are not wanting to see anything of the city! The staff in the hotel were excellent - accomodating our every need. The hotel food (dinner in the bar and breakfast) was overpriced for what you get but as a captive market I would expect nothing else. The bedroom was exceptionally comfortable with 2 large beds and soft-as-a-cloud duvets and pillows. The bedroom and bathroom were spotlessly clean and far more welcoming than my home! I would definitely stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for people using Terminal 3 at Pearson International”
Reviews.Author: Wasaga705
Reviews.Content: I had to fly to Toronto to attend a funeral. The hotel is ideally situated, attached to Terminal 3 by a walkway, with lots of public transportation to the city centre nearby, if needed. Prices in the restaurant are high, but you can always walk over to the terminal to eat, where they are better.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to say the least”
Reviews.Author: vee_travels
Reviews.Content: We flew in on the last flight from Boston to attend a funeral the next morning. It was great to take the shuttle from our terminal to the hotel, check in and get a bite to eat. The one unfortunate thing, the non-smoking room had clearly been smoked in. And so was the second non-smoking room - so smelly that they had stuck a Glad Plug-In in the socket. Room three was fine. The hotel was quiet, the food decent and the bar service acceptable. Incredibly convenient hotel is you have family in Etobicoke. The hotel has a pool so you see tons of guests walking around in shorts and sandals which is strange in early March.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: shadisoft
Reviews.Content: Very clean. New rooms, comfortable clean bed.. Free bath robes. Love this hotel

Reviews.Title: “You feel like family at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjsabina
Reviews.Content: My review is a little different than others written on this site. I have been a regular at this hotel over several years, particularly the last year. I stay 1 -3 nights a week. As I read the reviews, I could have responded on behalf of the hotel to explain any of the issues. Parking is the jurisdiction of the airport, the hotel cannot govern the rates. The snacks in the lounge and the change in the room service hours- I think we all recognize that the economy has affected every business. The hotel business is no different. I'm sure that when the economy improves you will see the hotel adjust their services accordingly. I don't think you can complain when the food in the lounge is provided free to those on the club level - there are cheese and crackers, roasted vegetables and fresh, fruit, sweets, good coffee, tea, water. I think that is plenty. In my experience, this hotel is incredible. It is so convenient if you are flying out of Pearson; you just walk over to Terminal 3 or take the monorail right outside the doors of the hotel over to Terminal 1. You don't even have to go outside. The staff at this hotel will do everything in their power to make you feel welcome, give you personal service and take care of your needs - EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THEM. They never hesitate to take a suggestion, immediately take care of any concern and always with a cheerful disposition. The managers are also friendly, helpful and considerate of their guests. They want you to feel at home. It's a small enough hotel that you are never overwhelmed by crowds or feel it is too commercial. The beds are extremely comfortable, duvets, feather pillows (if you choose), and it is very quiet. You need not worry about hearing the airplanes outside your room, although you can get a room to sit and watch the planes coming and going if you like. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and will return every opportunity that I have.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the Toronto Airport Sheraton very much”
Reviews.Author: lizoli
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to stay at the Sheraton, and convenient, as we were flying out the next morning. There was a special rate for parking the car at the Sheraton while we were away. It was waiting for us upon our return. We had dinner in the dining room - love the dining room and food there. Everyone very polite and courteous. Our room was cozy and comfortable - we wished we were staying longer. There was nothing we didn't like about our stay, except it was too short and the elevators were crowded at times.

Reviews.Title: “The best way to kickoff a holiday!”
Reviews.Author: TheNewlywedsOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for one night at the beginning of our holiday to Jamaica. I was absolutely blown away by the service! It was our anniversary the day we arrived (and we were also celebrating a 'babymoon') which I shared with the front desk. As a courtesy they upgraded us to Club Level with a room facing the runway. This was a wonderful surprise as I had really wanted to book this level of room but was feeling the crunch on my wallet. We had just dropped our bags and were getting acquainted with the room when I noticed an envelope had been slipped under the door. It was a card from the front desk staff wishing my husband and me a wonderful anniversary. I was floored! I have never had such personalized service from hotel (especially an airport hotel). It was a great touch and made our stay all the more memorable. We went for the evening hor d'oerves and were a little disappointed. It was primarily a cruditÃ©s platter and some cookies. A definite bonus was the unlimited supply of water bottles they offered to club level guests 24hrs/day. We decided to find out how far our room was from airport check - again to our surprise it was just an escalator ride away (if you are flying out of terminal 3). We were in the mood for a casual dinner and the hotel only offers one restaurant which I did not feel comfortable wearing jeans and a t-shirt to. We decided to check out the food at Pearson and found Swiss Chalet just steps from the escalators that lead you back to the hotel. The room itself was very comfortable and nicely appointed. The bed was terrific and we could not hear any noise from the airport. I will say that I felt the bathroom was a bit small but that is only if I am really being picky (and I don't think a review can have all positives). One of the best surprises was the complimentary morning breakfast offered with the club level room. The food was delicious and there was lots to choose from. They had a great assortment of fresh fruit, toast/bagels, eggs, yogurt and pastries. We had more than enough food to sustain us for the long day of travel ahead. I adored this hotel from the moment we parked our car. It is an absolute must and we will never stay anywhere else if we are flying out of Pearson - that's a guarantee!! It is worth the extra money if not for the service, than for convenience alone!

Reviews.Title: “Does the Job!”
Reviews.Author: ice-lemon82
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on quite a few occasions. Good location if you are only staying the 1 night, walk straight into hotel from walkway attached to airport. Speedy check-in. Good rooms. One of the most comfortable beds to sleep in. Wish I could have taken the bed home with me! Bathroom clean and shower good. Downside is you cannot order room service between 11am and 4pm, not good if you have a late check out. You have to go down to the bar/restaurant (a bit expensive) or go over to the Terminal (before security) for some fast food. It has been a few months since I stayed here so it may have changed since then.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out For the Parking Package.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelLondon_ON
Reviews.Content: After booking a night at the hotel which included an eight night parking package,on arrival back in Toronto and trying to get my parking pass validated, I was informed that I was 6 hours over the allotted time and would have to pay an additional $19.20. With the vagaries of air travel,I don't see how one can possibly time your travel plans down to a few hours. The management would not budge on this issue.So, instead of taking advantage of a bit of good will that allowing me a bit of grace would have generated, they have lost a client,as I have usually stay there the night before travelling by air. The silliness amazes me. I have no complaints about the hotel itself, as it is convenient and passable as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: ManitobaTourista
Reviews.Content: You just canâ€™t beat the convenience of the Sheraton when you have to overnite in Toronto to accommodate late flight arrivals or early morning departures. We have stayed at this Sheraton a number of times, most recently for 3 nights in January while enroute to and from Costa Rica. Our rooms, one on a regular floor and the next one one on the Club floor, were clean and attractive. Most importantly, they were fairly soundproof, the beds were extremely comfortable and, with the black-out curtains drawn, we were able to get a decent sleep. We also really appreciated being able to leave luggage with our winter coats and other unneeded items at the hotel while we vacationed down south. We ate several meals in the dining room. The service was friendly but food and wine were a bit pricey and the quality and quantity were hit-and-miss depending upon what you ordered ( for example, a rueben sandwich with french fries was large and delicious while the cobb salad was a stingy bowl of wilted lettuce topped with teensy shreds of egg, chicken, blue cheese and what tasted like processed bacon bits.)

Reviews.Title: “Filled with ups and downs - appropriate for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Notam
Reviews.Content: My initial room request was not available (hotel was at 99% capacity when I travelled) but the reservations office suggested an equal room vantage point on the Club Floor could be reserved. I booked it. Though there is no check-in service on the Club Floor and Preferred Guest counter was unavailable, check-in at the main counter was efficient and friendly. The room is essentially the same as the seventh floor; I could not tell the difference. Sadly weekend Club Floor guests do not benefit from the breakfast or evening hors d'ouvres (though by happenstance it was available when I stayed due to a large convention in town). The amenities were the same as I have had on the seventh floor, which doesn't seem to match the room details on the website. The monorail runs below the rooms facing the apron, which woke me up periodically during the night. Otherwise it's a great airport hotel. Bar and restaurant food and service is consistently good and the 24 hr gym does the job. Overall, I find the service is kind, attentive and professional. I have no reservations recommending this hotel to others, though I would verify the availability of the services being offered on the Club Floor when booking.

Reviews.Title: “A Great pre-trip experience.”
Reviews.Author: Pugdad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I tend to spoil ourselves by staying here everytime we plan on going away for a vacation. When we stay here we always book the club floor which includes access to the lounge on that floor with free buffet of H'orderves and non-alcholic bevies. It also includes breakfast in the morning as well. We also make sure we request a "terminal view" room so we can watch the different airplanes come and go. I guess we're just kids at heart. In the morning, you just throw on your shorts n sandles and off you go to the airpport on the tram. You dont even go outside. Perfect!...and in my opinion, it might be a bit high in price, but I cant see myself staying anywhere else prior to a getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugsEB
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here probably at least a dozen times. It truly is a very convenient location to stay the night before flying out on such early departure times... It is especially good with kids because when you travel at such early hours, it is a major stress to wake them up, get them prepared to go to the airport to stand in line... We find that we don't even need to bring our winter clothes because you practically are inside the entire time. The beds are very comfortable. The pool room is nice. We don't use the exercise equipment there but looks well supplied. The restaurant is good and price is high but understandable. And incredibly, you don't hear the airplane noise. We stayed at the Marriott a few blocks away--and it was very noisy!. Would pick it again and again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “You Pay For The Location”
Reviews.Author: Zife
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night with my wife the night before a flight. We chose to stay here because they had the airport parking deal (get a weeks free parking with 1 night stay), we thought it was convenient, and we hoped to be able to see the runway from the rooms. It was definitely convenient, we never had to go outside to get back and forth to the airport proper (it's connected via tunnel to Terminal 3), but tha was probably the best part about our stay. I was hoping that since the parking was at the airport, that I would be parking my car in one of the covered parking garages (since we were flying in December, and I didn't want to come back to find my car covered in snow). Unfortunately, the hotel parking is at the very top of the parking structure, leaving your car open to the elements. This wasn't a big deal though, since it would've been the same at most other hotels. One of the other reasons we decided to stay here was to get a view of the runway and the planes taking off and landing. We did have a 'runway' view room, but all you really see is the taxi area, with the landing strip off in the distance, and at night, you can't even see that. Overall, the hotel itself wasn't bad, it was up to Sheraton's usual standards (although most other Starwood brand hotels I've been to don't charge for printing in the business lounge), but for (significantly) less money, you can stay at the Westin Bristol Place a few blocks away, which I think is generally a nicer hotel, and you can actually see the planes in the air. I wouldn't recommend this hotel simply because you can get better for less, but there's nothing wrong with this hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: Oilfan4life
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOT off airport grounds, simply tram it to Terminal 3 and your there. Other hotels are a hassle b/c you have to take a shuttle. If your laying over in TO this is the place to stay. $50-$60 each way for taxi downtown which kind of blows but they do have a decent restraunt on site so not nec. to travel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryDoyler
Reviews.Content: Very Convenient We rented a car at the Toronto airport to travel within south eastern Ontario for a couple of days before our flight to the Caribbean. It was very convenient to drop off our rental car at terminal 3, take the elevator up to the Sheraton lobby to check in. Had a quick bite to eat, a couple of drinks in the lounge before heading to bed. The staff is very attentive, however the food and drink is expensive. The wireless in the lounge is complimentary which is nice as itâ€™s $17 a day in the room and all we needed to do was check e-mail. The rooms are very quiet, modern and spacious. We had an outgoing flight from terminal 3 at 6:20am so it was great to just walk over to the Air Transat check in counter and not have to worry about shuttles or weather. Itâ€™s a great convenience if you can justify the expense.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, average facilities, conveniently attached to Pearson - poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Travel_guy_1999
Reviews.Content: Checked in around 1am on a Sunday morning (middle of return flight from Cuba to Ottawa). Front desk staff was slow, and apparently unable to smile. Was eventually given a swipe key and room number. Unfortunately upon arriving at said room and opening the door it became apparent that the room was NOT vacant (nightlatch was on, so I only woke up the occupant(s) rather than barge into his room while he (they) were asleep). Trip back to the front desk where after explaining to the other clerk what happened I was given another room key. Club level, nice - was not told if it was an upgrade or simply the result of other floors being full. New room was very comfortable, clean, large flatscreen TV, nice leather club chair, desk and desk, etc... Looked recently redone. Facing parking garage with the odd horn/car alarm but managed to tune it out. Next morning I'm greeted by a "zero-balance" folio slipped under the door @ $70 too high. Charming - so much for rapid check-out. But A+ for consistency at the front desk where smiles are apparently not allowed. At least they managed to change the room charge to the rate confirmed throught the travel agency reservation (and quickly make sure the original folio was moved out of my reach). In short, it's convenient if you're short on time between flights, don't feel like facing snow just yet on your way back from somewhere warm, you wil probaby enjoy the room but double check everything on the way out. Keep your expectations low and you maybe be delighted. P.S. to give credit where credit is due, the housekeeping lady I met while leaving my room in the morning was very cheerful, friendly and polite, she could teach a thing or three to the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: cello626
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night in this property for convenience purposes (NOT having to negotiate shuttle service or get our 2-year old into hat and coat after our midnight arrival was worth the price). When we checked in to our room, we discovered it had been smoked in (the entire property is now non-smoking, so the previous tennant is going to be charged a stiff $200 cleaning fee). The guest services staff handled this situation very well. We were greeted within 5 minutes at our smoke ridden room by a staff member with keys to an upgraded room on their executive club floor. Would have to agree with other reviewers that the food is too expensive. We typically order room-service for breakfast after a disorienting, late night flight, but could not justify the price (and service fees) for the pedestrian fare available at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “somewhat average”
Reviews.Author: keithfloyd
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night after flight from uk. room was a former smoking room so we had a supple whiff of smoke. Mini bar the most expensive i've ever seen $10 for a can of lager breakfast also very expensive, taking advantage of its location at the airport. lift to hirecar level broken so had to carry suitcases down three flights of stairs. nice touch

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kevinl31
Reviews.Content: Had a planned layover to visit my nephew in St. Catherines before travelling on to Scotland and Spain the following evening. We arrived around 10:30 expecting to have to stow our luggage until check-in time however they gave us a room immediately. The room was tastefully decorated (matters to my wife) and had a large comfy bed. The restaurant on the lobby floor was also a convenience however a little on the pricy side as this was the first time I had a beer that cost $12. Nevertheless I'd stay here again simply for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, expensive food..”
Reviews.Author: Ryguy7
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay at the airport - this hotel cannot be any more convinient. Located literally at Terminal 3, you don't even have to go outside to get to this property. If you are at Terminal 1, a short monorail ride will get you here. This hotel really is beautiful. You can tell it's a classy place immediately from the lobby. The lobby bar beckons (for you and your wallet) when you walk in and the plush seating everywhere sets the tone for the rest of your stay. The rooms themselves a nice, even a touch more elegant than some typical Sheraton rooms that I have stayed in in the past. Beds are equipped with the comfortable Sheraton Sleeper Bed and the bathrooms all come with the new-ish Bliss shampoo and conditioner. All the rooms are decorated in classic mahogany and brown tones and most come with a mini-bar. One thing to be cautious of is being put in a room that faces the automated train that connects the terminals - it can be noisy. Another great highlight of this hotel is the 24 hour swimming pool. You rarely find a pool open all day and night, so take advantage of the quiet if you can. The fitness centre is also nicely equipped (and well air conditioned) for a workout if you'd like. There are also separate mens and ladies saunas and steamrooms in each respective changing area. In terms of food, the bar and restaurant can serve each others menu - just ask for the other if you only get one. Food is incredibly expensive, almost disappointingly so however some items are worth it. If you do eat here you can expect good service, well nice presentation of the food and tasty dishes. If, however, you can't stomach spending $20 on a hamburger - walk across the skybridge into the terminal for more reasonable prices. This hotel also now offers the Sheraton Connect in the lobby, providing a few computers with free internet access when you put in your room number and name. There is also, I believe, free wireless in the lobby but a charge for internet in your room. There is also a business centre on the lower lobby if you have printing/faxing etc needs. If you happen to have a long time in the hotel, or feel the need to explore Toronto, many options exist to exit the airport area. City buses stop right below the hotel on Arrivals, one express bus takes you right to the subway which will whisk you downtown. You can also take the GO Bus to Yorkdale Mall, a shoppers best friend or even the Airporter which is express to downtown for a bit more of a fee. I just read this hotel won Sheraton's Canadian Hotel Of The Year award and it's not difficult to see why. Beautiful, classy property for anyone that needs to spend a night at the airport and the rates usually are not that expensive. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “expensive but convenient”
Reviews.Author: Beancounter4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Gateway overnight due to a business meeting being held at the hotel. The room was very clean and spacious. It was also very quiet and obviously convenient for those flying in. I drove to the hotel and the parking was not well marked. You eventually go all the way to the top of the parking garage, but it wasn't obvious from the signage that you go on that far. The room was more expensive than others I have stayed at in the area, but obviously being attached to airport comes at a premium. However, the restaurant was very expensive. All entrees on the lunch menu were about $20 and up. Dinner started higher. Coffee - $5, glass of pop - $3.25. The food was good and service was fairly quick.

Reviews.Title: “A better than average airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isaac-Kite
Reviews.Content: From an airport hotel you want convenience, cleanliness, comfort and a bit of peace and quiet - and that's exactly what you get here. Location is great - it's attached to Terminal 3 (domestic). If you are arriving at another terminal you'll have to take the monorail to the hotel - could not be easier. Check in has been a bit laboured in the past, but on this occasion I sailed through without a queue. First room smelled of smoke, but I was immediately transferred a a smell free (and much larger) room, so no complaints there. Rooms are generally of a good size anyway, large enough for a king size or two large doubles. Beds are amongst the most comfortable I have experienced. Although it is an airport hotel, noise disturbance is minimal. Majke sure you get a room on a higher floor - if you get one of the lower floors, the monorail could be passing within 6 feet of your window (I do not exaggerate), so go for floor 4 and upwards. Bathrooms are starting to look a bit dated and get hard wear, but are generally well maintained and kept clean. Breakfasts are good, but pricey. Food in the bar at night is satisfactory but nothing to get excited about. I find this to be my home from home when I'm in Toronto. Stayed here several times and never been disappointed. If you're on the tourist trail though, you're a long way from downtown and would need a hotel closer to the centre ro see the sites - this is very much a short stay business travellers hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Airport Hotel, Basic Set-up, Services what you need”
Reviews.Author: SWFTravelsALot
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property on MANY occassions and possibly WILL need to stay here again in the future, however choose not too any longer since I 'discovered' the Hilton Garden Inn which is also 'servicing' airport travellers such as myself. In conjunction with 'common' travel, I have put in to use the 'recent' park-n-fly packages that many of "the strip" hotels (including THIS property) are offering in order to fill their rooms and parking lots. I was VERY happy until I learned I was paying TRIPLE to what it cost at the Hilton Garden Inn AND even the Sheraton's 'brother' property at The Four Points (about HALF the price). There is nothing 'wrong' with this property. It is showing its age somewhat and feels 'tired'. The beds are JUST fine, as is the bedding and linens. The rooms are quiet enough, although I encountered on ALMOST every trip/stay there GROUPS and/or families infesting the halls and leaving their doors ajar to communicate by yelling back-and-forth. Who ARE these types of people So rude as to NOT understand that concept of PUBLIC places and conduct? The hotel has restaurants and fine room service. All basic fare and nothing Earth-shattering. I would stay there again, however definitely choose not to as the HGI has a financially BETTER package by far, their rooms ARE nicer, staff more versed and diligent AND other guests apparently passed civics. I would recommend as it DOES service an aspect of travel and foots required aspects of some travelers' needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location prior to early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: YYZAC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a great rate obtained from Priceline, prior to an early morning departure to San Francisco. Even though I have stayed here before and knew of the outrageous food prices in the lobby restaurant, decided to try the bar anyways. The prices are still beyond the norm, so I just had a glass of wine and a dessert. Place was pretty slow for a Friday night, so service from check-in to restaurant were all very attentive and prompt. Appreciated the lobby store to purchase shaving cream, which I neglected to pack. Slightly overpriced, but what isn't at this property. Asked for an airport view, which was granted. The hotel's proxmity to the airport is a major selling feature of this property. In the morning, I did not even have to put on a jacket to transfer to Terminal 1. Just grapped the train from outside of the hotel and I was at the terminal in less than 45 seconds. Room was pretty standard, but plane spotters will want a room on the terminal side and at least on floor six or higher as the inter-terminal train & station will block the view of the airport on the lower levels. Did not try the pool or work out facilities, but from what I could see they seemed pretty decent. Would love to stay here again, if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing luxury hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelNut71
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing, the hotel was very classy. The only thing is that there is no parking nearby, it can cost something like $15 overnight but if you go around the corner you can get it for less. The staff helped us with that. The pool was opened 24 hrs, this is rare and we loved it! The staff also gave us printed directions to where we needed to go.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Gateway Toronto - nice but be aware of charges”
Reviews.Author: swhli
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice and modern. Once you are in Terminal 3 at YYZ, you will find the hotel without any problem. It provides you with one hour FREE internet at the lobby. Making a local phone call will cost you $2 plus taxes. Had I known this, I would have used my cell phone instead. We booked it using Hotwire and paid only Cdn $90 a night including taxes. Not a bad deal at all to catch an early flight the next morning. The sound insulation is not that great. You can heard people from another room talking! However, you will not hear any noise from the airport, very strange.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but very pricey.”
Reviews.Author: reelman59
Reviews.Content: This hotel is classy, and very comfortable. My wife and I stayed here as a stopover destination. The $103 room rate wasn't bad for this type of hotel, but the restaurant is very expensive. It cost us $116 for lunch, and I my entree was free as part of a promotion! It is definately geared for corporate travellers. Beware of the mini bar in the room. It works on sensors, so if you move any item for a closer inspection you get charged for it immediately even if you put it back. We had to visit the front desk at checkout to have 3 unwarranted charges removed from our bill. We would stay here again for a reasonable rate, but would not plan on eating here. You're better off to go through the walkway into the airport, and dine at the nearby Swiss Chalet.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep tight, then hop a flight”
Reviews.Author: travelerfromsj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently connected to Terminal 3 of the Toronto airport, and can also be entered directly from the car rental return area. The lobby is very elegant, and offers guests two places to eat outside of airport security: the bar area with a two page menu of snacks and entrees, and the more formal Mahogany Grill. From the bar area we enjoyed watching the hotel lobby on a busy Saturday night, but the downside is that the bar food was very slow to arrive. Our room was very large and, as a Starwood member, on the â€œStarwood floorâ€� (floor 6), which happily meant we were above the LINK train and had a nice view of the runways. The thick windows seemed to block the airport noise very well, but my husband mentioned that in the middle of the night he could *ahem* hear the couple next door, so perhaps the walls are not quite so thick. The room seemed to be in excellent condition except for the bathroom, where the tile was looking a little worn. The free bottled water was a nice touch, and the bed was very comfortable, butâ€¦. I have to say I was not crazy about the bed linens! It seems to be a trend among hotels to supply a top sheet, a bare goose-down comforter (no duvet cover), and then a sheet or bedspread on top. Personally I would prefer that the comforter be inside a cover (who knows if itâ€™s been washed? If ever?) so I kept trying to arrange the bed linens so that there was absolutely NO WAY that anything other than the sheet could touch me, because the sheetâ€™s been washed. Probably. Most likely. Before turning in, we tried to check in for our early morning flight, but the check-in kiosk (located right at the entrance of the hotel) was broken at the time. We were directed to the computers at the back of the hotel lobby and, after much confusion (there really needs to be better signage here), we figured out that using the computers and Internet here is free, but you need to pay 50 cents to print each page after the first free page. The computers use some special printing software to make this work, and all you have to do is enter your reservation name and room number and itâ€™s charged to your room. One caveat is that the special printing software doesnâ€™t work with frames, so if you are printing boarding passes for United Airlines like we were, be sure to choose the â€œno framesâ€� version! Or, just head into the airport and find a check-in kiosk for your airline. Overall, we had a good nightâ€™s sleep, checkout was very fast, and I had plenty of time for duty-free shopping before our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in decline (?temporary) - Concierge Lounge has been cut back”
Reviews.Author: fl2006
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 2-3 times a year for at least 5 years. Location is superb, but I noticed that the last couple of times - July and August 2009, standards are slipping. I am Platinum with Starwood and they are very good about upgrading to Suite/Concierge Floor, but there have recently been significant cutbacks in the Concierge lounge. It may be closed for breakfast and evening snacks during the week (as well as weekends) and when that occurs, restaurant vouchers are NOT provided. Also Front Desk Staff appeared to be stressed out on both occasions. I complained to the staff aboutthe Concierge lounge and much to their credit they agreed with me and encouraged me to fill out a comment card (which I did and did not receive any follow up). I tend to spend a lot of time working out of the room - last week I stayed at the nearby Sheraton Resort and Conference Center (see separate review) which had better Customer Service and a great lounge. If you are arriving late and leaving early and don't expect/use Concierge Lounge, it is a good choice - otherwise you could do better in 1 of the many nearby alternatives if you don't mind shuttle/taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for early flight, but not to count on Club floor services”
Reviews.Author: swirlingcloud
Reviews.Content: Stayed end of June, one night, club floor, take off lane view. RECEPTION: excellent service, flight information available, airport maps available. ROOM: clean, spacious with sweet-sleeper bed. Very comfy. Bathroom amenities for a one-night necessity provided. Room is acoustically well insulated. Air conditioning efficient and minibar stocked. CLUB FLOOR LOUNGE: is entered with room key, both areas are spacious and comfortable, plenty of newspapers and magazines available. Breakfast in the lounge had limited selection and absolutely no service. Had to clean my own table from the guests before me and there was no clean silverware available. Could not check out at the lounge. A LITTLE INCONVENIENT: at departure, I called for the luggage service, went downstairs to check out and found that my luggage was "somewhere" around the hotel with the bell boy. As not to lose my flight I rushed to the terminal so they brought my luggage after me to the check-in desk. Funny experience. Overall good and very comfortable if you must catch an early flight or if you hate airport rush at all times. :) It is situated across the street from the terminals, 5 min walk. I wish there were more airport hotels like this one. Compliments to Sheraton and Toronto airport.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get any closer to the airport!”
Reviews.Author: ACtraveller
Reviews.Content: Booked with priceline so got a good rate, but of course you don't get the nicest room ( people on the tram could look right into our room) Any way the room was fairly large and had a new plasma TV. Exercise room was OK but I found the pool was a bit dirty and the steam room was kind of smelly. Has a nice but expensive restaurant. There are no nice places to eat in the Toronto airport so we took the bus/ train into Toronto and had an excellent dinner in little Italy. Good location if you have an early flight to catch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moose57
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel many times per year to attend meetings or base my Toronto area travel. It is hard to beat all levels of service in every area at this property. Staff are intent on satisfying your needs, friendly and remember you. Recently one went out of his way to help me with something needed for a meeting later that day in the hotel. No more convenient place for a meeting in TO than this hotel. You can even check in for your flight in the lobby. No wonder it gets the awards from the Starwood group.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfortable, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: westcoastgirrl
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here for one night before a 7 am flight home purely for convenience. Check in was very easy and the lady at the front desk really went out of her way with my 2 young children. She invited them around the desk to help her and have them extra room cards to look at. She offered a runway view if we wanted but they only had 1 king bed so that wouldn't work for 2 adults & 2 kids. We stayed with our original booking of 2 doubles. I would have preferred 2 queens though. Still good I think for $100. Parking I think was $28 a day or $4 per 1/2 hour as the hotel doesn't own the lot.
