Didn't matter to us as we had returned our rental car anyway. The room was spacious, clean and the beds were very very comfy. Nice toiletries. The coffee is Starbucks but not that great. Again fabulous service. We received a courtesy call from guest service to make sure all was well. Flat screen tv, leather club chair, desk. Tasteful. Quiet!!!! Never heard any noise at all!!! We ate dinner at the restaurant in the hotel. We were sat at the back because we had kids I'd imagine. The kids menu was good (about $6 and included dessert). They had crayons too. The adult choices were limited and pricey. My chicken dish was a large enough portion but $35. Steak was $40. They did have a summer special of fish & chips for $18 I think. Room service was pricey as well but I did like that breakfast can be pre-ordered for delivery starting at 5:00 - 5:15 am. Great for early risers. We were able to check into Air Canada from a kiosk in the lobby the night before our flight. Great. Couldn't print luggage tags until morning. Not so great. They have a very easy and quick tram from terminal 3 to terminal 1. We never waited more than 3 minutes. Good thing as Air Canada was a long tedious pain but that's another story. Overall I'm very pleased with the choice. Location can't be beat. A very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: my_travels99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of nights in July after getting a great deal on Priceline and we were in town for a friend's wedding. When we checked in we asked for a king sized bed and a room with a view if any were available. To our surprise, we were upgraded to the top floor with a view of the airport. The room was very spacious, large enough to accommodate our luggage and a crib (provided free of charge) while still having plenty of space to walk around. The king sized bed was comfortable and clean. There was a stated charge for wired internet access but I guess the top floor has complimentary access. The gym has a few stationary bikes, treadmills, and free weights. The stationary bike had a personal TV on it which was cool. Overall, our stay was good and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed the third time”
Reviews.Author: artifactory
Reviews.Content: This location is fantastic, the building was builded in the early 90's so the structure itself does not look out dated. The main lobby is as nice as any 5 start hotel I've stayed at before and most importantly the staff at the reception desk is friendly and courteous. My complain though is that we upgraded to the "Platinum" frequent program because the original room given by the staff at the front desk did not have a great view of the terminal. It was facing a massive air conditioned unit. The only rooms available with a better view, were those on floor 8. The room did not look any different than the other ones in floor 5, I was a little disappointed about that. I guess I was expecting something a little better, not that there was anything wrong with it, but still I wanted to feel pampered with the upgraded we had just pay. We kept wondering what kind of amenities does this Platinum program comes with?? We went to the lounge area, which is only accessible with your room key(part of the platinum program). But all we found was used coffee cups with food flies, and cold coffee. The cappuccino machine did not work. This place seemed abandoned and depressing. I guess to make the story short, the only amenities we were able to obtained was a free breakfast, which it was just o.k. served at the Mahogany grill restaurant located at the hotel. This restaurant by the way is outrageously expensive! we expend $150 for a simple steak and a trout dinner the night we arrived, and half full martinis glasses! my god, we go to the CN tower and we eat like kings for less money! I would not recommend this restaurant, the food tasted it like ketchup and soy sauce. I have stayed at this location a few times, I can't say for sure I am coming back. I might consider the location in Downtown, which by the way, last time we stayed there it was excellent. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: tracicakes
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here since our flight arrived after 11:00 pm and we have a 5 year old. We just walked through the terminal to get to the airport, so it was very fast not having to get a cab or take a shuttle. Very nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel that is very convenient for long lay overs”
Reviews.Author: travelingraysgirl1
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Sheraton Gateway and I was not disappointed.T his hotel is so very convenient to the airport. The service at check in was great. Kudos to Maria and the management. The room itself was large and well appointed. Very clean. Quiet room that has curtains that keep the room dark for sleeping during the day. comfortable bed. Complimentary coffee. Could not ask for anything more. I would stay there again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport location in Toronto's Pearson International”
Reviews.Author: Mbrown58
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for the most convenient location to stay at while traveling into or out of Toronto's Pearson International, the Sheraton Gateway is your top pick. This luxurious hotel is located directly adjacent to Pearson's Terminal 3, and is right next to the new sky-tram that connects to Terminal 1. The hotel is state-of-the-art, with a fabulous lobby, complete with complimentary computer stations for guests. Suites are beautifully appointed, and many face the runways. Despite this, there is virtually no noise from jets! This hotel is near many shops and restaurants located on the airport strip, but it hosts its own restaurant and bar. If you do need to park, though, be aware that the nightly rate is $29! I parked at Park-n-Fly and shuttled to and from the airport for less than 1/2 that price. The shuttle brings you right to the door of the hotel; pickup at the airport is every 20 minutes. A great value. I used priceline; bid on both a 4-star and 3 1/2 star, and received this hotel both times.

Reviews.Title: “Professional & Courteous”
Reviews.Author: frank1771
Reviews.Content: The staff took care of all our needs, they were very helpful. The restaurant was top notch, kudos on the Calamari with Wasabi and Cucumber dip, fantastic. Will definately come back to this hotel. Thanks again!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Convenient ,and Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: offtoseeamouse
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were met by the friendly staff and the service could not have been better. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The beds are the greatest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for an airport layover”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaChristiegirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Toronto from Dominican Republic just before 11 pm and had just over 8 hours before our flight to take us home to Calgary. Instead of staying in the airport, we decided to get a room at this hotel and were pleasantly surprised. It is connected to Terminal 3 at Pearson International, so it was an easy two minute walk to the hotel via elevator or escalator. The rate was reasonable at $157 plus taxes and we were given a nicely appointed room on the 4th floor. The bed was extremely comfortable with fresh, new linens. Our room was clean and comfortable, although a little warmer than we prefer & we couldn't adjust the thermostat. The toilet also dripped but I just closed the door to the bathroom to resolve that annoying sound. We didn't hear anyone in the rooms on either side of us, but did hear people chatting in the hallways. A newer 27 inch LCD television gave us something to watch and had digital HD channels. Set the digital alarm & also used the hotel wake up call service (which was provided on time). We noticed a lounge with sports on the televisions and it also provided pub food (we did not go there though). A 24 hour pool & fitness area are just behind the front desk and that is where the drink machines were located. Small gift shop on site, it was closed when we checked in. The room supplied two "to go" coffee cups & coffee, which we made in the morning before we checked out at 6:00 am. Overall, a great stay, worth the money & very convenient (especially if you're flying through terminal 3).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, but needs upkeep”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Axe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shearaton Gateway due to the close proximity to the airport since I had an early morning flight. The train linking the airport and the hotel was out of service, so a bus shuttled people back and forth, running every 7-10 minutes. This worked well, but was a rather long walk to the pickup point from the arrivals hall (but was very well signposted). The reception area is on the second floor, but the long, steep escalator was out of sevice, necessitating a walk up steep stairs with the bags or trying to find the elusive elevator. The room itself was clean and quiet (I couldn't hear any air traffic at all), but in need of some minor repairs, including exposed wiring due to a broken outlet cover (a real hazard for children). My room also had a strong smell of a floral air freshener (not sure what they were trying to cover up), which bothered my allergies. This hotel worked well for my purposes, but should be better maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for long layovers”
Reviews.Author: needtogetoutmore
Reviews.Content: I had to find a hotel for 1 night due to an overnight layover. Since I didn't really care for location (other than it had to have an airport shuttle), I booked with Hotwire. For slightly over $50US, I got this hotel. For the good: You couldn't ask for a better location because is it connected directly to the airport. The rooms were fairly big, with modern furniture. I requested an airport runway view, and they were able to accommodate me. The rooms were fairly quiet, despite having planes land and takeoff. The lobby had a relaxing feel to it. The beds were fairly comfortable, but you could hear the springs. For the bad: I didn't like that I had to pay for the Internet from my room. There was no wireless connection, only a wired connection, at a fee per hour (and maybe per day). I think you can use the Internet for free in the lobby, but I wasn't interested in sitting with people. I had just come from a long flight and just wanted to be in comfortable clothes. I would think that if the hotel can put wired connection in EVERY room, they are obviously more interested in making money with it than putting less expensive wireless connection on every floor (unless it interferes with airport communication somehow; which then you would ask why there is one available in the lobby?). The rooms were clean, but I did notice dust where the carpet meets the walls, especially on top of the baseboards. Not a big deal for me, but might be important for some. I also noticed an odd odor coming from the bathroom. It reminded me a lot like the bathrooms in my local hospital. The smell might be coming from the water. I didn't use any of the hotel's amenities, so I can't comment on those. I had pizza delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stopover in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: MSkinner
Reviews.Content: Spent May 11th evening here, as we had a stopover on our flight. Excellent location (attached to Terminal 3), great lobby, great lobby restaurant / sportsbar, very clean, felt safe, rooms were excellent, beds were very very comfortable. Didn't get a chance to use the workout room, but looked good. If we have to stay in Toronto again for a stopover, this is a no-brainer. Just a tip - if you book through hotwire.com and ask for a 4 star hotel near the airport, good chance you'll get this one. The only other 4 star, apparently, is the Hilton, but everyone I know who uses hotwire gets this hotel. It'll save you $50 - $100 / night.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: ReginaUnhappy
Reviews.Content: I attempted to cancel my reservation because I was stranded in Maimi due to a mechanical problem with the plane. I tried to call and cancel and was given the run around and told it would be alot of paperwork for them. My cell phone finally ran out of minutes in an attempt to cancel the reservation and in the end my credit card was billed 174.90 for a room I did not have the pleasure of staying in. NOW as a result I am out the money. VERY RUDE STAFF. NOT HELPFUL. I would strongly recommend dealing with anyone but NOT them.

Reviews.Title: “It was supposed to be such a good idea........HMMMM”
Reviews.Author: yadayaba
Reviews.Content: Call me crazy but I thought it would be nice to meet my Beautiful girlfrend at the airport and run away to this hotel before heading back home the next day. I was returning after a a few weeks away. When i booked i requsted the room was made avaiable to my girlfreind brfore i checked in and i paid for the room piror to check in and added her name to the guest list. When she arrived .They wouldnt let her in the room unless i was there, or more to the point my credit card was there. Unless she wanted to pay for the room in full (Wouldnt that be the second time the room had been paid for?) To be fair to the staff they where only doing there job, but it slightly embarrseing not to be able to get into your hotel room. I cant fault the room or the hotel resturant, nor even the service. But our time here was marred by the fact that unless i was there no one was getting in the room. It easy to say that I would be unhappy if they had let just anyone to check in but my Delightful girlfrend has quite an unuseal name. So if she had I.D. (she did) to back up our request i think they should have let her use the room. We have had chance to use this hotel since. But because of this problem we have always took ourselves (and our Credit card ) elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay!”
Reviews.Author: philwoj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Gateway on valentine's day with a girlfriend and I must say that the hotel was beautiful. We stayed in a room with a view of the airport, so we could watch the planes land and take off. The room was clean, room service was quick, and the entire staff was polite and very hospitable. I recommend getting the VIP lounge access for a few extra bucks. Overall, you MUST stay this hotel, business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Hotel... not worth it for Avg person”
Reviews.Author: Parikh
Reviews.Content: DON:T GO THERE I booked through Hotwire.com... got best rate i have ever since... for given 4 star hotel... stayed there for 2 nights at terminal 3 gave me wrong postal code.. when i put it in Google maps and in my gps i sent me to around Derry/Dixie.. After wasting my 1 and half hours and getting hung up once... finally someone picked up the phone... they told me it's at terminal 3 "Departure".. .dead tired when i talk to them they say if i want to park there it's $28/ night... so $56../ 2nights for my car....... got in to arrgument with front desk then she transfered me to manager... as a solution manager said they will give me one night free parking and room upgrade.... said I don't want room upgrade... give me parking for both nights said they can't do that... had no energy at talk to them so i settle for what every they want to do... manager was way simpler and understandable and easy to deal with. when i went to my room didn't look like any bigger room then any other hotel... Pros: (i)Right at YYZ Airport 5/5 for Business personal... (ii)Good place to have formal gathering or meeting (iii)The room was very spacious and clean good Management level staff well trained Cons : Not worth for avg person as a get away weekend (i)Too Expensive ($5 + or something for coffee or soft drink ) Parking ($28/ night) shared with Airport Parking Wireless Internet ($14+/ hour) unless on 2nd floor lobby (ii) Service level Staff needs to be better trained (iii) Pool was dirty (have no idea with those black things were floating around in all four corners but they looked like some kind of dust...) (iv) No microwave (can't have your own popcorn while you watch movie) (v) Hot tube was not working at the Pool (vi) Staff doesn't know much about "things to do in" Toronto. (vii) Req to warm something for me ... told me to bring it to kitchen and they will do it for you... took them 12 min to do that at night 2 AM OVER ALL NEGATIVE Experience.... will not go there again... Because of that, we'll stay at an another hotel off-site which we stayed before our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: coleco76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife on Saturday March 7th before my early 6AM flight to St. Lucia. It was also the night of the time change difference. I booked the hotel in advanced using my CAA discount for a total of $125 + TAXES. Check-in was a breeze and even easier to checkout at 3AM. I booked by wake up call which arrived on time. The room was a king room and also included a large chair with reading lamp & table, large desk with jacks for power & Internet access {for a fee}. There was also a small fridge and coffee & tea maker and large LCD television which also shows the departure times of the flights. The room was quite spacious and comfortable for both of us and had all the amenities I was expecting with a Sheraton hotel. The hotel has a bar, pool, fitness centre & restaurant but since we had an early flight we didn't use any of them. We walked over the Airport and ate at Swiss Chalet. The hotel is connected to Terminal 3 via a covered walkway next to the main lobby so there is no need to venture outdoors. From the same covered walkway you gain access to the rail-tram to take you to terminal 1. My room was on the parking lot side of the Airport and the hotel is quite in the evening & night with no airport noise. I will definitely stay this hotel again because of the easy access to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Location is worth it!”
Reviews.Author: zulusimba
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on prior occasions, and have enjoyed each stay, so I will give my last stay a blind eye. Previously, my rooms have been top-class, no complaints, etc., with all the staff being friendly, outgoing and courteous. This last stay, however, was questionable. My room, #427, was literally beat up. It was located adjacent to the elevator doors, so I was able to hear everything that was going on throughout the night. The in-room safe didn't work, and the furnishings looked well-worn; not at all what I expected! In addition, my colleagues were supposed to be next or near us, but ended up being at the far end of the hall, in rm #426. They're room was what I expected it to be. So you may ask, why didn't I get a room change? I checked in at 10:45pm, had a bite to eat, and was out the door at 6:30am the next morning. I figured that 6 hours in my room just wasn't worth having a room swap. So, I will continue staying at this property in future as it's service and location can't be beat. One bad experience won't ruin my 9 great ones! And to the girl who woke us up at 4:45am with her shrill shreiking voice while waiting for the elevators on the morning of Mar. 7 - Karma will get you! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooom - Restaurant not family friendly”
Reviews.Author: danield
Reviews.Content: We booked through the Starwood website and got a reasonnable rate for our 1 overnight stay at Sheraton Gateway Toronto after a late night flight back from Cuba. We asked and got a late checkout (we arrived at the hotel at 3AM). The room was well appointed with all the amenities. Good comfy queen beds and hide-a-bed. We were very statisfied with the room. HOWEVER, please be warned about the excessive prices at the on-site restaurant (if you are not on a gov. or business trip). Juices or coffee will set you back $5 ea. For our family of 4 we had to pay $35 plus taxes and gratuities for 4 juice and 3 coffee. That is in adition of the $16 2-eggs breakfast or the $16 pancakes (which we knew was expensive and very good but agreed to pay). Total bill: $101 (taxes and gratuity incl.). Part of it our fault. The menu were on the table when we arrived but we did not have time to read it (small print anyone?) before the server asked us and our children if we wanted juice or coffee. Thinking it was included (as a buffet) we said sure. Welcome back to America.......Ever heard of a recession? Because of that, we'll stay at an another hotel off-site which we stayed before our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up !”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravellers2008
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for 1 night on 2 separate occassions a week apart on to-and-from flights to Panama in late Feb. Both times, everything was as-expected. Check-in was smooth, room was nice and as-booked, and everything else was in order (good hot water, wakeup call arrived on time, staff were efficient), rooms were above average, check-out was smooth. Loved being attached to the airport so we could change in/out of our warm weather clothes before/after the trip without going outside. Our flights were late arrivals and early departures so we didn't sample the food/pool/fitness but we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Both convenient and a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrystalVancouver
Reviews.Content: This was a planned stay; before my husband and I stayed "by accident" when we missed late-night connections. Everything was as I expected -- got the room I asked for (not close to elevators or ice machines), check-in was easy. The room was clean and quiet, and the bed was comfortable. TV, radio, hot water etc all worked well. I didn't eat or drink there but we have done so previously and the food was fine. The only minor problem was that there's only one hour of free internet, in the lobby, and setting up for Macbooks was more complicated, but within 5 min someone had sorted it out. This hotel is a much better option than taking a shuttle to one of the nearby, cheaper motels, as it's possible to wait ages (up to an hour) for a shuttle. You don't even have to put your coat on walking from the terminal. We'll definitely plan to stay here again. One suggestion: book early; you can always cancel, as the price can increase as you approach your travel date.

Reviews.Title: “Really Convenient and an Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel9999
Reviews.Content: After flying all day it was really nice to be able to walk to the hotel without ever leaving the airport. We have stayed here many times and it has always been consistently good. The rooms are comfortable and the food good.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience, Comfort and Cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: TravelsWithChildren
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to notice of number of negative reviews for this hotel recently. I have stayed at the Sheraton Gateway many times per year for a number of years now and have been consistently happy with the service, convenience, cleanliness and comfort of the hotel. From the walkable access to the terminal and the expedient check-in to the available swimming pool and even the coat hanger in the room, this hotel is designed for and caters to the business traveler. It's hard to go wrong staying here. There's even an eleveator off the main lobby that takes you straight down to the parking garage where the rental car counters are. The hotel is also amazingly quiet given its proximity to the airport. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravelsouth
Reviews.Content: I was stuck!!! After all day meetings my flight home was cancelled due to weather. Stopped by the desk and had a Wonderful agent check me in!!! The lady was understanding and thoughtful. Checked in to a room with a Great view of the runways....Had a wonderful meal from room service and the bed....was wonderful.....If you cant make it it to your own home...this place makes you feel at home!

Reviews.Title: “Was better in the past”
Reviews.Author: voyageur08
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Sheraton Gateway before and was very impressed with the service and amenities. This time, not so much. I arrived late (11 pm) and was given the key to a room that had not been made up - the beds had been slept in! I phoned down and was moved to a room by the elevator that was noisy. The room itself was nice enough despite a big stain on the carpet. As other reviewers have said, the hotel's big advantage is its location right in the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls - how much do you value your sleep?”
Reviews.Author: WRAndy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Dec 31, 2008 (yes NYE) since we had an evening layover and didn't want to deal with taxis or a shuttle to make our 6:30 am connection to Cuba. The hotel itself is very nice and the location is great with easy access to T3 and T1 with the monorail. We didn't eat there but I took a peek at the restaurant's regular (non-NYE) menu and their prices looked to be bit higher than I would pay (slightly higher than say a Keg). Our biggest complaint is the sound transmission in the hotel. While I'm sure there's good sound insulation to prevent outside (airport) sounds from intruding into the suites. They must have used it all up by the time they goty around to building the walls between rooms (and from the halls). Unfortunately, our neighbouring guests (4-5 inebriated NYE celebrants) were quite boisterous (I considered it unreasonable to carry on in an airport hotel beyond 1am even if it was NYE). The walls were so thin that we could definitely pick out specific details of their often heated conversations. We complained first to the front desk and when that failed to do anything we spoke with the manager to shut them up. By this point (2am) it would have been too much effort to be moved to another room but it seemed to eventually settle down. However, we could still pick out their conversations at what seemed to be a normal volume. Unfortunately, we were later (~3am) treated to more noise - this time more amourous in nature..... Everything else about the hotel was fine....and would be fine if you are a heavy sleeper or had no neighbours

Reviews.Title: “Location the Main Quality”
Reviews.Author: TectonicGreg
Reviews.Content: Of all the Toronto airport hotels, this is one of them. It's much better to book a hotel for less money and take a shuttle or cab to get to it. It really to me is a trap for people with layovers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: WelcimStranger
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in December 2008 prior to flying with Air Canada to Havana in Cuba. Found the hotel very convenient, just a short walk down to the departure lounge, which took the the stress out of taxis to the airport (and the cost of course). The room was very quite, the lobby of the hotel had complimentry internet facilities which we found very good. Would recommend strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed twice in Dec for layovers”
Reviews.Author: vovi
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the convenience. It was right off the T3 next to the T1-T3 shuttle. The beds were pillow-top and very comfy. Our rooms were clean. Checkin and checkout were smooth both times. Internet was complimentary. Internet promo gave us a good price. We had no complaints. If we get a good deal next time, we will do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for rate scam”
Reviews.Author: Goodtravels_8
Reviews.Content: Watch out for price scam. I booked this hotel for my two senior parents to stay the night before their flight in Dec and to have parking included for $119.00. I booked it in Sept and I clearly asked if this was the Hotel at Terminal three where you get up and walk across the street to the terminal. I booked the reservation by phone and asked their exact address and clearly asked for the Sheraton at Terminal Three.The Sheraton hotel staff where I booked the reservation confirmed that this was case and encouraged me to book it as prices go up to $300+ in the next couple of weeks. When my parents arrived they informed them that they did not have a reservation there and that they never have rooms less than $300.00. Indicated that they must be booked at their other hotel on Dixon Rd with the shuttle. So either Sheraton Staff are lying to customers on the phone upon booking or they are lying when you get there to get more money. The hotel did not honor the price and charged my parents over $235. The only convenience I wanted was to have my parents not be transported and waiting for shuttle buses in the cold. My parents noted that they were not the only ones with this problem during check in.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel Airport that delivers first class service”
Reviews.Author: DeanYYZ
Reviews.Content: Staying at an airport hotel is usually a stay brough-on by necessity, however I was absolutely delighted with the Sheraton Gateway Hotel at Pearson Airport. There was a slight issue when I arrived with the television in my room not working, but when I called to ask if it could be rectified, the hotel not only gladly obliged but had all my belonging moved for me, had my roomservice order re-dispatched to the new location and they even paid for it in apology. The service is attentive and goes above and beyond what's required. The staff are excellent. The rooms are well appointed and are what you'd expect from a Sheraton. Also, you can hardly tell you're at a busy airport, the sound-proofing is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Super comfy, but expensive food!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBumm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a unexpected stopover in Toronto (missed connection). We were glad to find a good rate ($99CAD) at such a nice hotel. The beds are quite comfy. And after a long day of travel, it was wonderful to just hop on the monorail from one terminal to the next, and drive our luggage cart right up to the lobby. However, when we landed in Pearson no one of the restaurants were open, so we had to eat at the hotel bar. The food was good, but expensive IMO ($19 for a lb of wings, $9+ for a pint of beer). If we had other options, we would have taken them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for YYZ, but be careful, they may charge you for using the bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: Postalsaint
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel for a great rate thru Priceline.It was well worth the price we payed for the room. Incredibly convienient if flying out the next day. They will charge you for everything,,,EVERYTHING. I got my credit card statement 2 weeks after my stay. There was an additional charge of $41 from Sheraton Gateway Toronto. I called the hotel to find out why. Apparently they charged me for the coffee and toiletries (soap, lotion) I used in the room for one night stay. Great hotel for YYZ if you can get it thru Priceline, but be careful of hidden fees.

Reviews.Title: “overnight stay great idea!!”
Reviews.Author: pianoesmeralda
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the uk late afternoon on 15/8 - and planned to pick up a car on 16/8 and to head off to Niagara. Didn't want to stray too far from the airport, just needed a night's rest. Hotel was very good, rooms well appointed, beds very comfortable - we had an airport runway facing room (on request), but were a little disconcerted when the monorail went past our window!! Had supper in the hotel bar and then buffet breakfast in the hotel coffee shop before picking up our hire car from Hertz (almost directly under the hotel) and heading off to jolly old Niagara!! Good choice to stay so close to the airport to save schlepping our way across to Toronto...

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, lots of extra charges”
Reviews.Author: WolfgangConstanze
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing for convenience if you are just staying one night near the Toronto airport. If you don't get a deal on the price, it can be very expensive, but we have twice gotten excellent rates online (less than a 2 or 3 start hotel). The room is lovely and service is excellent, but they charge for every "extra" including wireless internet. If you're paying for everything yourself, don't stay here unless you can get a deal on the room rate. However, it does make for a very civilized travelling experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exorbitant hidden fees, mediocre service and poorly set up room mar this otherwi”
Reviews.Author: tomc1227
Reviews.Content: Watch out, because this place charges unbelievably high fees for everything from parking (CAN$28 a night!) to slow wired internet access (CAN$17 per 24 hours!) and even phone calls (CAN$2 + $0.10/min to make an 800 call!!!). With the week US dollar, I paid an extra USD$50 a night just to get things I get for free at 3 star hotels. The room was fine, furnishings were OK except the desk was badly scuffed and scratched. The overpriced wired internet didn't even work when I got to my room; I had to get down on the floor and figure out that a converter box had been unplugged and plug it back in. Finally, they apparently have no bell service; as when you pull up to the main entrance there wasn't a soul around to help. I had to leave my car, go up an escalator to the lobby, and wait 10 minutes to get to the front desk (no concierge staff) to find out where to park and how to validate. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you don't use the internet and don't need to park or make any calls.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glasgowtravelmonkey
Reviews.Content: Due to a delayed flight we were checked into this hotel courtesy of the airline. The room was comfortable and clean, ideal for our purpose. Quite a bit out of Toronto so not an ideal location if you are sticking around but would definately recommend if looking for a good airport hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: Domestika
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. I initally stayed for one night a couple of weeks ago after missing a flight and having NO other options. I was afraid it would be horrendously expensive (as it's super swanky) but the price for a room with two double beds was more than reasonable. The room was enormous. The beds were comfortable with a ton of pillows. Great, clean bathroom. TV was fine (though pay to order movies are 12$!!). We had a couple of drinks in the bar downstairs, which is very nice and loungey. The prices are drinks are absolutely astronomical, but what can you do. You don't have to go there! Breakfast at the restaurant the next morning was also retardedly expensive, but you can get breakfast elsewhere in the airport. I stayed again for one night a couple of days ago and was again very pleasantly surprised. The room was very nice, extremely large. Huge bed. Nice clean bathroom with bath. Leather chair and footstool to recline in. Writing desk. Two phones. Very nice. I had dinner in the restaurant and they were very accomodating to my dietary needs. I also realised as I left the restaurant that they have complimentary computers with internet in the lobby! Just need your room number to sign on and you get internet access. Someone from the bar came over to see if we wanted to order a drink or snacks while at the computers! In the same area is also a tv with a few comfy, nice couches to chill on. Overall, I was very impressed. I would certainly go back, and would also reccommend it. Very, very nice (and reasonably priced! - 140$!!) way to make another-wise annoying layover very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Braindrain
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night recently. I arrived on the midnight flight and had another flight at 8 am the next day. I arrived through T1, took the connecting train to T3, took a right turn and there it was. Definite plus for being so accessible. Check-in was smooth. I was surprised to see lots of front desk agents as I thought I might be arriving at an odd time. Got to sleep around 2 am but had no noise whatsoever with people beside me. When I popped out early in the morning, noticed there were papers in front of the rooms on both sides. The room itself was a decent size. My room had a king bed. There was the ubiquitous flat screen tv and a work desk. The decor was modern and I didn't have any problems. The only complaint I have is the clock in that I really didn't know if I had turned it on or not. It's really hard to tell. Had to set my BB alarm, just in case. The Plat/Club lounge was decent. There were hot eggs, variety of different breads, variety of juices, etc. I took this over the Air Canada Maple Leaf Lounge in T1 since the MLL doesn't have hot eggs. The lounge was mildly busy but had no trouble finding space. Check-out was a bit slow in that there were only 2 agents. However, not agonizingly slow. Once I got to the desk, check-out was smooth and agent was very helpful. I gave it 5 stars as I really don't have anything significant to complain about. However, I certainly was not able to make good use of many other services.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but Very thin wallls”
Reviews.Author: khicks
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night after flying from Singapore. Just wanted a good night's sleep before continuing on home. Well the room was very nice, bed comfortable but had several problems. The biggest problem was how thin the walls are. We could hear everything going on in the next room - from the tv, to the girls talking on the phone, even heard the cofffee machine dripping the next morning!!!!!! You would think in a relatively new hotel that sound management between rooms would not be an issue. Also, as stated by several other reviewers the service was lacking - called room service to order a late dinner, was told someone would call me back, 1/2 hour later still no call and had to call again (almost missed being able to order my dinner choice). Plus the cost of the food is outragous!! Don't think we will be returning no matter how convenient - SLEEP is much more inportant!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location but Restaurant Prices are Outrageous”
Reviews.Author: Blondieblueeyes
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel the night before a 6 AM flight. The hotel itself is fine - room is small but comfortable and clean. The location is perfect and extremely convenient - definitely worth staying here if you have an early flight or long lay over. The only complaint I have is the price of food. We ate in the lobby bar - we had 2 drinks (1 glass of wine, 1 draft beer), 1 personal pizza and 1 club sandwich (that was made with processed turkey) and the bill was over $80 with tip. We would have been better off eating in the airport terminal or taking a cab somewhere else. We would definitely stay here again if we had an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Early Morning Flight”
Reviews.Author: Vespe
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Sheraton Gateway the day prior to our flight to St. Lucia. With winter getaways to the sun at this time of year, the weather can be, let's say, uncooperative, and fearful of this we decided not to take any chances in missing our flight and stayed overnight at the Sheraton. It was the best thing we could have done as we were much more relaxed in our hotel room directly across from Terminal 3, not worried about getting across the city at 3am - highly recommend this as an idea for anyone departing on an early morning flight. The rooms are spacious with a comfortable king size bed, desk, sitting area and flat screen tv with a station to track departures. The runway view rooms offer a fantastic view of Terminal 3, and would normally be a window onto numerous take-offs and landings had it not been blizzard conditions. Snowplows and trucks buzzed across the runway in place of planes - interesting nonetheless. The spa,located on the reception level, is small and split between two locations, one across from the other. Services offered were very good and well-priced for a hotel spa but could, however, use an expansion, and more staff (only one person on site at the time.) Restaurant bar is lively with reasonable quality food, friendly service, but overpriced. An excellent place to spend a few hours watching the comings and goings to the terminal. We did not take advantage of the check-in kiosk as the walkway takes you right into terminal 3 (wonderful for those cold days). Overall, it's a very good hotel as an accommodation option for stopovers, or early morning flights.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for the airport.”
Reviews.Author: craig_traveler
Reviews.Content: Surporised to get this property when biding through Priceline. Hotel is connected to Terminal 3 by elevated walkway. Big hotel that had a room available at 7:00am which was nice. Large single room with all modern conveniences. Restaurant a bit pricey, but theres other options in the terminal building. If you want to ge tto Toronto downtown you can catch the airport bus down on the arrivals level. Great for ealry morning departures of if your in transit overnight. Decent gym.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: jimKelowna_bc
Reviews.Content: This is comfortable place to stay - a good bed, comfy chairs and so on. Food and beer are outrageously priced. I was here two days - in-coming and out-going to Cuba. The first time my room was dirty. The second time it was clean. There is a cramped gym. It is great the hotel has a steam room, but the problem is that it does not get hot. My biggest complaint is that if your flights are in Terminal One, it is quite a trek, involving at least 3 escalators and 2 elevators and long walks. It almost seemed like more hassle than taking a shuttle to a hotel. It took 15 minutes from the Hotel to the airport checkin counter in Terminal 1.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: edmb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on Jan17th while waiting for the flight for our honeymoon the next day. Location: The hotel is located in terminal 3. We arrived at terminal 1 and it was very easy to get to the hotel. Just follow the signs, take the train to transfer terminals and you are there. The next morning our flight flew out of terminal 3. We simply walked out the hotel door, down an escalator and you are in front of the check in counters. Very convenient location! Check-in: Check in went smoothly. The room key was waiting for us and we were upgraded to a king suite without asking. We were offered late checkout at 4pm. Room: The room was spacious, clean, quiet, modern decoration, and there was a LCD TV with plenty of channels, including the airport flight information. The bed was amazing. Sheraton sweet sleeper beds are the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. Service: Service at this hotel is very good. They try their best to make you feel like you belong and to give it that small hotel feel. We had a fruit tray and wine delivered to our room within 1 hour of checking in. We also called for some shower caps and they were delivered within 30 minutes. The only service hiccup we had was in the morning I called reception to inquire if breakfast was included in the "romance package" that we had booked and she told me no. We decided we would go over to the airport to get some breakfast, but on the way I stopped at the SPG gold desk to confirm breakfast wasn't included and they told me that it was indeed included. She sent us off to have breakfast while she went to find us some vouchers. It was one of the best breakfasts I ever had. Freshly squeezed orange juice, fresh pineapple and strawberries, bacon, eggs, hash browns, cereal, croissants...delicious! Also, on the day we checked in to the hotel, my wife hurt her back when she was lifting a bag and it was quite bad in the morning. She was not looking forward to a 4 hour flight in pain. We spoke to the lady at the SPA in the hotel and she arranged for a registered massage therapist to come in and give a massage before our flight left! Check out: Check out is easy, they slip a receipt under your door at night. If everything looks good and you have had no other charges to your room, you simply drop your keys in the designated box on the way out. We will definitely be staying here again if we are flying through Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating and lovely”
Reviews.Author: SKSC
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel coming or going from the airplane. We had a very late arrival (3 a..m.) Not only was checking in FAST and efficient, I'm sure we received a room upgrade, although we were too tired to notice. They gave us late check out to 4 p.m. which was fantastic...this gave us the oppourtunity to SLEEP, shower and change before the drive home. This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel revolving around flights at Pearson. I highly recommend this hotel and you can't beat the location, especially in the middle of winter when you have to catch a flight. Lovely and accomodating front desk staff! We WILL return. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Air Transit Lodging”
Reviews.Author: bfstacy
Reviews.Content: Convenient lodging when in transit by air through Toronto. I arrived on a Friday night at about 11 PM and the lobby, restaurant and lounge were very busy. I checked in quickly as there was no wait and went to my room. It smelled horribly of cigarette smoke. Three times I called the front desk and guest services: who transferred my call to the front desk - and no one picked up the phone. At this time I realized they never gave me a breakfast coupon either. I went down stairs and they rapidly rectified the situation givng me a new room and breakfast voucher. There were three people at the front desk doing nothing and no had picked up mey phone call. The rooms were comfortable with LCD TVs. Breakfast service was excellent. But of course the only reason to stay here is if you have a long layover and want to shower and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Disappointments”
Reviews.Author: Epags
Reviews.Content: This our fourth stay. Because our travel time is over 10 hours to Toronto the last thing we want to do is rent a car and drive into the city late at night. To walk out of baggage claim and into the hotel keeps the stress way down. Normally I rate the service and conditions as excellent. This trip was a little disappointing in that there seemed to be a number of small issues that, for the price of a king suite on the Club floor, should not have existed First is that the Club Lounge was 'closed for renovations' although there was no signs posted on the room nor were we notified by management when we made our reservations for that floor. At check-in the staff at the front desk did provide a coupon for a buffet breakfast the next morning (breakfast was to be included for people on the Club floor anyway) but we missed out on the evening wine and food that would have been provided if the room was open. Room Maintenance: The bath tub stopper did not seal and you could not take a bath. Luckily we always carry our own stopper for such occasions. Should not have happened considering the cost of the room. Room amenities: Interestingly enough the mini bar did not have any fruit juices nor did the mini bar charge sheet indicate there should have been any. Some people like drinks other then alcohol. (As commented in other posts, it is a quick walk back into the airport and orange juice was available at one of the fast food shops). Although we had advised the management by email of our arrival plans and requirements, there was only one bathrobe in the room and we had to call for another.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: agibson23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on a stop over between Cuba and Vancouver. The location being "attached" to the Toronto airport was our main reason for choosing to stay here. Our brief stay was excellent. The exterior of the hotel can use some touching up but the interior, at least the room we stayed in was excellent. Tastefully decorated and comfortable, particularly the bedding and pillows. The only glitch we had was when we were planning our trip and making the reservations to stay here. I went to the hotel website but didn't receive a confirmation email so I called the actual hotel front desk the next morning. The person I spoke with was rude and mis-informed. She advised me Sheraton does not have online reservations and if I did it online it would be through a 3rd party website which she herself would never do. She essentially implied that if I was trying to get a discount this is what I need to expect!!! I eventually escalated and received my confirmation email. Aside from that little unpleasant experience, the overall stay was comfortable and convenient. Would recommend staying there again if you are on a quick stop in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: CdnTraveller60
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times, merely out of convenience of being able to speed up my departure from Toronto. The hotel is nice, but a little tired looking. The price for accomodation and food is the kind that is only possible for hotels that are this close to a major airport. And even then, they are pushing it. The restaurant especially, maybe they feel better charging outrageous amounts for the food, but it doesn't make the food any better than mediocre. I'll pay good money for good food, but this wasn't it. The hotel staff is top notch, I'll give them that.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Comfort”
Reviews.Author: hmlax
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel before and paid a lot (329 CDN per night), but this time was an exception because of a special conference rate of $119(CDN) I got. If it had not been for this special rate, I would have avoided this hotel all together. The rooms are standard Sheraton rooms, spacious, great bedding, great bathrooms, and convenient to the airport. The only two major complaints is the price and parking, I guess for being so close to the airport they can charge whatever they want, and the business traveler generally does not have to worry about price their major objective is convinced and comfort right? And parking is usually not a major issue either because most people are staying there due to an early flight or late flight. However if you are driving to stay at this hotel, beware parking is $20 CDN per day, and very hard to get to because you are mixed with traditional airport parkers. Overall the actual hotel was fine, but if you are not utilizing this hotel for the benefit of being directly connected to the airport, there are better options surrounding the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, convenient, watch out for minibar charges”
Reviews.Author: willCodeForFun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Gateway overnight before an early flight. It was adequate, and the room was relatively comfortable, with a good king-sized bed. Watch out for the minibar: we moved everything around so we could put our own food in, and everything we touched, we got charged for! Would have been really expensive if we hadn't been paying attention. The room service was expensive and not particularly appetizing. We were too tired to go out, so it did the trick, but it wasn't a splurge we were glad to have made. The front desk service was chilly and unenthusiastic. Be aware that the only luggage carts they have available are the ones you pay to rent from the airport. Was extremely inconvenient when getting our luggage out of the car to go hunt down a cart, though there were loose ones we didn't have to pay for, abandoned amid the parking lot. You can't beat the convenience, though. The hotel is right in the airport terminal. We were able to return our rental car, take the elevator up to our hotel, and take the elevator down in the morning to get our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Our first choice for stopovers...”
Reviews.Author: mdz
Reviews.Content: We have made this our first choice when stopping over in Toronto. The beds are incredibly comfortable, the rooms really spacious, check in very quick...and it is so easy to get to from the airport arrivals area. Great deals on the weekends...better than during peak business travel time. I have no complaints. The room service breakfast is really tasty, and very fast! Will be staying here often...even just overnights...

Reviews.Title: “Location good for onward travel but eat in the airport”
Reviews.Author: saf51
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night after flying in from UK, with an early flight to Vancouver next day. Our room was very comfortable with good facilities and ideally located for the airport-it takes 10-15 mins to get there with no need for a taxi & a reasonable price. We were disappointed with the food in the restaurant and felt it should of been of a higher quality for a hotel of this standard and was not good value. With hindsight we should have eaten our evening meal at a food outlet at the airport. Nice bar though

Reviews.Title: “Very good standard for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobby1802
Reviews.Content: A really very good Airport Hotel. Convieniantly located accross Terminal 3 with excellant airport train connection to Terminal 1 this hotel really surprised me. Although frequently used there was nothing worn out, staff was very friendly, service was good and breakfast nice. The rooms were spacious and the windows absolutely soundproof, you can look onto the runway, but you donÂ´t hear anything. We stayed on the Executive Floor and we were upgrade which was definately a big plus. Negative is that the taxis fares are quite expensive and that there is nothing around except the airport terminals, there are 2 -3 shoppping malls in eays reach, but better rent a car than pay the high taxi fare. The hotel can be recommended, for a pleasant functional overnight stay at the airport. Good management there.

Reviews.Title: “Good first night stopover”
Reviews.Author: LiztheWhizz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night having arrived in the late afternoon from the UK. I thought it would be nice not to have to get a hotel shuttle or hire car, but just to wander over the footbridge and be in our hotel room, as we arrived at Terminal 3. We also figured that the airport monorail that goes past the hotel would be a great treat for our 6 year old son. And everything was as we wanted it to be. Check in was painless. We asked for a room overlooking the monorail, and the first one on the 4th floor was just a bit too near! We opened the curtains and were eyeball to eyeball with the people on the monorail station platform, who kept waving to us! Also the room was a bit dark as the station blocked out the light. We asked to go up a floor (ie 5th) and further along from the station, and this was great - nice view down onto the monorail and over to the airport terminal. The room was clean, reasonably sized, though the dark decor didn't do it any favours in this respect. Noise was minimal considering we had an airport view and a monorial trunndling by, glazing must be very good. Once settled in, we went for a ride on the monorail, then feeling jet -lagged, returned to the room where we ordered enchilidas and burgers on room service. Service was prompt and food nice, but you get stung three ways for eating in the room: 1) the price of items on the room service menu is inflated; 2) they add an 18% service charge; and 3) they charge 2.50CAD to bring it to your room. Looking at other menus in other Canadian hotels, it seemed this triple whammy was not unusual. We would probably still have done it for convenience on this occasion, but it was still OTT. We did not have breakfast in the hotel, preferring to get our hire car and get on the road where we had great, reasonably priced breakfast in a diner style chain called Fifties. Would certainly recommend the Sheraton for an airport stay. It provided comfort and diversion in equal measures!

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Notam
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving in Toronto, I found it odd that the signs directing travellers to the Sheraton were ubiquitous on the departures floor and not arrivals. I waundered aimlessly on arrivals trying to find the entrance to the hotel. It was nearing midnight when I arrived at reception and to my dismay, all check-in agents were working at the main desk. The preferred guest check-in did not have a clerk present. There was no sign indicating to me or another business traveller that the counter was closed , so we stood there for some time. We finally gave up and stood in the queue with other travellers. Not a great start. However, main desk check-in was plesant, suite request was honored and a briefing of what services were available this late hour (including the 24 hrs gym). I elected to return to the airport after dropping off my belongings to get something to eat, as the room service menu offered heavy (burgers et al) or otherwise pricy items for midnight eating. The bed was comfortable though the duvet was too hot for me, the airport view was impressive and the higher floors did not have to deal with the new tram shuttling between terminals sliding by the window. The hotel is quiet compared to other airport hotels (showers, neighbours conversing and doors slamming in preparation for early morning flights). The bathroom was spotless and well maintained, though I choose to use my own amenties vs the Sheraton brand. I'd stay here again in the event of a late night arrival or early morning flight. Overall, it's a terrific airport hotel, other than the inattention to business check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jetset_woman
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for the money - got a fabulous deal through Priceline. We did get stuck with a smoking room but after brewing a pot of coffee and turning on their air purifier, the smoke smell wasn't too bad. Hotel is attached to Terminal 3 of the airport - as a result parking is a little pricey - $24 per night. Rooms are spacious and the Sheraton "sweet sleeper bed" was very comfortable. Rooms were nicely appointed and very clean. The front desk staff were very friendly. I think this hotel would be of particular interest to those who need a stopover hotel either on the way or home from a trip. Never used the amenities but they said both the pool area and gym were open 24 hours. Mini bar prices are expensive but standard for that type of hotel. If I needed to be near or at the airport again, I would certainly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Place”
Reviews.Author: deezeb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal in every way especially if you are flying out of Terminal 3. The rooms, pool, hottub are wonderful and clean. Beds were so very comfortable. Very clean hotel. As far as the noise...you are staying beside the airport you have to expect a bit of noise...If you want quietness then you should stay elsewhere. But, as far as that goes I have never styed in any hotels that there isn't some sort of noise. Don't read negative reviews as you can't please everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: shadowsand
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because family members were traveling from different parts of the country to meet up and travel together. There were several aspects of this hotel that made it a tremendous meeting place. 1. The rooms were comfortable, clean and well maintained. We definitely felt this was a well managed hotel. 2. The spa facilities were extensive and open 24 hours. We enjoyed the steam room, hot tub, pool and sauna. There were lots of towels. 3. The restaurant and bar was expensive but the food was OK. 4. The train between terminals was wonderful. What a great way to get around. We were very happy with our experience and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JM27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Gateway for 1 night as we had an early morning flight the next day. Overall it was a great experience. We had a club lounge floor room which I would recommend as it has a lounge that serves free appetizers, breakfast, soft drinks, and water, as well as free internet, and a huge big screen TV (great for spouses who like to watch late night TV!). The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the room was well appointed. The bed, of course, was heavenly! On some down notes, the pool is quite shallow (4.3 feet is the deep end!)- although it is open 24 hours, and I did not find the room totally sound proof (I could still hear some airport noise at night). Of course, the prices for food and drinks are very high, but what else would you expect at a hotel located at the airport??

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: nat07
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Sheroton property for one night in Novemner 06. I was not expecting much as airport properties are very seldom of the highest quality. As soon as I walked in I was greeted very pleasently and looked after right away. The lobby itself was not spectacular, but it was clean and organized. My room was bumped up from a regular suite to a deluxe suite which you need a pass in order to get to. Our room was beautiful and has everuthing we needed. As guests of the deluxe floor we were allowed access to an excecutive room which had TV's, beverages, food etc. Everything was included and someone was there to make sure we had everything we needed. To make things even easier for us the, the lobby was connected to terminal 3, which for us was very useful as we had a 0600 flight. This hotel really did go above and beyond any expectations I had and therefore they deserve a huge Thank You. I will deffinately be returning as soon as I get a chance. Nathalie C.Ottawa, ON

Reviews.Title: “just heavenly”
Reviews.Author: snackwells24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and it was soooo convienet we both said that day we will be back next year. We take a holiday every year and found this stop over hotel jem. I don't think we will ever change to another stop over hotel. We paid $109 - a great steal. Check in was a breeze and we rec'd our luggage in 5 mins. These beds are the best in the world I swear!!! I didn't want to leave for my flight. When we stayed there we went to T3 to eat dinner and grab something to quickly eat in the morning(our flight left at 6 so nothing was open at 3:30 am in the hotel. The gateway to T3 is the best - don't have to go out into the weather and is tempurature controlled. The "train" from termina; to terminal was under construction but am planning on seeing the other terminals this year TIP: DO NOT move anything in the mini-bar/fridge it is sensored!! If you pick up something and put it back down it automatically gets put on your bill. We had $50 extra on the bill at check out OOPS. We explained and it was taken off the bill ( we put our early morning b-fast in the fridge and shoved everything over) any other questions feel free to e-mail me at snackwells24@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient and Exorbitant”
Reviews.Author: mentaltraveller
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here seven times and I keep telling myself it's convenient but it just isn't. You still have to take the airport terminal bus if you are using Terminal 2; you have to take the sky train from Terminal 1; and it is only relatively convenient to Terminal 3. Given the range of other minuses, I will be staying at a different airport hotel in the future, with better restaurants and staff. It's not such a big deal to take a complimentary shuttle to one of these other hotels, since you have to take a train or shuttle for terminals 1 or 2 anyway. I agree with all the other reviewers who've mentioned how this Sheraton nickle and dime you for phone charges, internet etc. The breakfast buffet is always appalling and so is the price. This last time a large number of fruit flies emerged from the glass as the waiter poured in orange juice from concentrate; the omelette was cold--the chef hadn't bothered to heat up the onions, peppers etc inside it; the fruit (melons, etc) looked and tasted very old and musty. A complete and rather disgusting rip off--and you're trapped there for choice. Room service just for a bowl of soup in the evening can cost over $15. The strange lobby always reeks of very cheap vanilla scent. Guest services has yet to respond positively to a single request. If you ask for a kettle, they simply don't have any--a good indication of their priorities when they are charging as much as $360/night and can't be bothered to keep one or two working kettles on hand for guests who might want tea or hot chocolate. Guest services was unable to coordinate luggage issues--that took half an hour and $5.00 beyond tip with the doorman who we discovered existed on our own. Housekeeping/guest services were unable to provide me with the garment I left there by mistake. Also, I had to call them four days in a row--no one got back in touch even though I left full details. No follow up whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Sheraton at T3 YYZ”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been freshly furnished identical to Sheraton Ctr, downtown Toronto. Leather chair with ottoman, tasteful gold coloured wallpaper, dark wood furniture, and oh, that heavenly bed! Rooms are soundproof. Air Conditioning worked well. Staff helpful. I chose to go to the airport for meals (using the handy train to T1), so can't comment on hotel food. I was on the 6th floor, and really enjoyed the view of the planes. They do nickel and dime e.g the business ctr computers are priced per minute (you buy time onto a stored value card), and phonecalls are all with fees. The fitness ctr has more equipment than typical. The hotel pool is a fairly large square, but a bit too shallow for my liking at the one end. Big whirlpool next to the pool. All those facilities are 24 hours! It is so convenient being at the airport. Got this as a Hotwire Best Value, which made this stay even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For A One Night Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MrMrsTravel
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our one night stay here. We chose this hotel because we were picking someone up at midnight from the airport and didn't want to drive anymore at night. Plus we got an awesome rate: $117 Canadian per room per night! The fact that the hotel is connected to Terminal 3 is awesome, and even if you're arriving in Terminal 1, with the monorail it works really well (we rode the monorail just for fun to see). Oh and we couldn't hear the monorail at all, or any planes from our room - very soundproof and quiet rooms! We had our dog with us, and the hotel was perfectly fine with dogs (no special restrictions or anything). As far as places to walk with the dog though... we had to walk around the parking lot, but the Sheraton does have a bit of green space for dogs to do their business on, which is good. I would definitely pick this hotel again if I was just doing a one night stop, it really is great for that. However, I wouldn't actually stay here for a vacation because there isn't really much around since the hotel is connected to the terminal. I'd much rather drive just a few mins on Airport Road where there are several hotels, restaurants, corner stores, and lots of green grass to walk the dog ;) Other than that, the hotel was very clean, the rooms very spacious and beautifully decorated, the food good (wonderful breakfast buffett!!), great pool and fitness ammenities which are open 24 hours (great for travellers!)! There's always lots going on at this hotel, at all hours people are coming and going, since it is an airport hotel! It's an interesting atmosphere - always something going on in the hotel lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel all the way around!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a room overlooking the International Terminal. ZERO noise, and an always changing view. Clean, comfortable, modern room. Food was outstanding, and the fitness center was one of the finest I have ever seen in a hotel. The locker rooms had a steam room and sauna, and the pool / hot tub were awesome! As a world traveler I am very picky. I will definately stay at this facility again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steveℜen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gateway prior to traveling to the Caribbean on November 25th. This was our first stay at this hotel, but Sheraton has become our only hotel choice since they introduced the sweet sleeper bed. This hotel is incredibly convenient if you are flying out of terminal three. We had a 6am flight, so had to check in by 3am. We went down, got our seat assignment,handed in our bags and they went back to the room to shower and clean-up.(you only have to clear security 1hr prior to your flight) The hotel itself was clean, and the rooms were very comfortable. Check in was pleasant, and the staff were friendly. We had a eight floor room facing the airport which kept me entertained for the night! I will definately be returning on our next trip south. It made life so much easier.

Reviews.Title: “A regular's view”
Reviews.Author: Iarlaith
Reviews.Content: Admitting to being a regular in an airport hotel is sad but I have been a regular to the Sheraton Gateway this year. Work has taken me there but as a place to stay it is not bad. Close to airport - it is just a pain that you see it when you land from Europe but it takes you almost an hour to get there - not the Sheraton's fault - I blame GTAA and their "in-field terminal". It has the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in. Food is pricey - but if you have a car there is a good selection of standard restaurants nearby - front desk staff will give directions. Minibar auto-charges if you lift something up - daft system especially if you are not a "native" and want to see the ingredients fo something before you consume it. Sheraton need to rethink this. Generally the staff are helpful - there are just a few sour faces that you learn to avoid if you are a regular !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: annievee
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently before and after a trip down south. PROS - great place to stay if you have an early flight - renovations are ongoing, the renovated rooms are great - food is great (although pricey) - love the heavenly bed - excellent treatment of starwood preferred guests CONS - walls are paper thin. Heard families with excited children getting ready for their flight to disney at 4 in the morning. Was woken up by wakeup calls to neighbours on each side and heard conversations without difficulty. - renovations are ongoing....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with no noise.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property as an overnight to another flight and would highly recommend it to others. It has been about 8 months since I stayed here previously and noticed no negative changes. Front desk staff were fine and can be described as cold and impersonal. The sound proofing of the rooms is incredible as I did not hear one single plane fly over. This was my first time sleeping in their "heavenly" bed and it truly was that kind of experience. I was going to explore the gym and pool area, however, ended up curled up in bed with my meal watching Desperate Housewives! Room service was prompt, albeit pricey (what else is new), and adequate. I left in the early morning and did not sample breakfast. My one minor gripe is the noisy air system in my room which I didn't keep turned on for long. This location is a good, functional property for business and overnight stopovers. Good room deals are available through expedia and hotwire. Sweet dreams.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Basic Comfort”
Reviews.Author: GlobalQueen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel on a Friday and Sunday night over one weekend. As we checked in two separate times, we had a pretty consistent experience. The hotel is conveniently attached to the airport and accessible via an overhead skybridge. The check in process was not smooth as they have a separate desk for Starwood Preferred members. Despite standing at this desk away from the main check in, no one (on both occasions) came over to attend to us, so we lost our place in line by having to go over to the main check in line. On both nights the toilets were running and leaking water from the back of the toilet. There are no luxuries in the rooms, but they provide for the basic comforts ie. toiletries, separate work desk and chair, phone, tv, etc. On one night the bed simply had a comforter, the other night we had a duvet. I tried to order room service at 2am for a delivery later that morning. No one answers in room service and the front desk had to page them to call us back 20 minutes later! Very inconvenient for a hotel that presumably has guests arriving at all hours of the day and night. When the room service arrived, it reminded me of a bad cafeteria, with the plastic coffee carafe worn and coffee only filled 1/2 way in the pot, the bagel was toasted but cold, etc. Check out was more efficient and they offered to pay for our parking for the inconvenience of the sleepless night with the toilet the first night, etc. Overall, I would stay here again, but ONLY because of the convenient location of being able to cut parking time, etc. and roll out of bed and get over to the terminal, beating some crowds and aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely beds and great beer at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: scouselatic
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to the Sheraton within 9 months, having been impressed at our first visit when we were evacuated from Cuba due Hurricane and arrived at 2am. We stayed again when our daughter was unable to fly with us (passport expired) until the following day. The staff on the desk were very sympathetic and gave us the 'government rate' when I asked for their best price. Despite a false fire alarm during the night - we didn't have to evacuate due to an inroom 'tannoy' that kept us fully informed of the situation - we stayed again for a second night, the beds are so comfy, the view across the airport is great, absolutely no noise, and the bar has an excelent selection of Canadian and European beers. Restaurant also good, especially for breakfast. The hotel is not too far for visits downtown, 25/30 minutes, we used the limo service from the airport and the express bus service, if more than two then the limo works out great at around C$40 the bus C$9 each one way. Looking forward to staying here agian in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding comfort with a great view of the planes..!!”
Reviews.Author: labelleprovince
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in June 2005. We were not actually using the airport but this was the 4-star that came up on Hotwire for US$54/night. For that price the hotel was exceptional. The rooms were very spacious, nicely finished, clean and well-equipped. As usual at Sheratons these days the beds were oustandingly comfortable. We had a 7th floor room overlooking the terminal and runway and our kids were very impressed with the view. The staff at reception were very professional and courteous. There were only a couple of minor irritants - firstly the hotel is quite awkward to access due to its extremely close proximity to the airport terminal, secondly the parking at $21/night is a bit steep (although it's very convenient), thirdly the mini-bar has an absurd sensor system that detects when you lift an item from its location and automatically bills you the requisite exorbitant amount. This sort of ridiculous nit-picking has no place in a hotel of this quality and Sheraton would be well-advised to abandon such annoying policies.
